h90TvL5aK0a1Ub64rbATow.text: Worst customer service ever! I was trying get a duck, the employees shooed me away, worst attitude ever and this place just looks unclean

BEblCGCq2QHuWlZ5TTw7eA.text: Ducks would be good but beware when you order rice dish, you might end up with bony duck! Service is bad too. So disappointed.

rTf_87jV7gc_fmaJ4DFZUg.text: Add Asian BBQ & Noodles to your restaurant options if you want good food at fast-food prices. The staff is pleasant and the restaurant is very clean. The walls have this strange  neon green paint which works for the place, in a weird way.    I usually get the 2-item combo with duck and pork belly. The duck is always juicy and tasty, minding a few bones here and there. The skin is flavorful and the duck fat just melts in your mouth. The pork belly has a sweet and somewhat nutty taste and the crispy skin adds a great texture in every bite. You can watch the guy take the hanging meat and chop it up. The combo also includes a large helping of rice and a small side of Chinese broccoli.  They have a large selection of dishes and combinations so there has to be something there for everyone to enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating chilled pig ears.

FzA8XJJCLvb-lfeJBgyADg.text: I placed an order to go and the dude gave me the bait and switch !!  I pointed to the meat in the display case that I wanted and he was like "sounds good".  Told me to take a seat out of sightline and when my order was ready the bags were all tied tight......  as I opened it and checked the bbq pork and ribs I ordered, I noticed they were ice cold..... So I said "dude you gave me old refrigerated food"  he just looked at me and told me to microwave it when I got home !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  WTF !?!?!?!?!  BOOOOOOOOOO

06s__mcXCt2-RLqKlwUEkg.text: You know it's the real deal when the duck is hanging by it's neck in the display case when walk into the restaurant. Sort if a whole in the wall in china town. I thought the restaurant was efficient and fast.   1. Chinese sausage fried rice very good ( on the menu it says salted fish and sausage, just get sausage)  2. Seafood dry chow fun ( okay but not that good) maybe the gravy ones better  3. The BBQ pork and roast pork belly was the best. The roast duck was okay kind of chewy want the skin more crisp  Overall food was very good for the price $38  For all the food I just mentioned

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local best
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood dry chow fun
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage fried rice

C8zD6IhcT2URPXI4Y3uGLg.text: A must go place if a Chinese coming to LV! It is a little bit long wait but price is good and food is authentic!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must order too!!!!

pMpdzOSF5YmKSzjdUfmjFQ.text: Pretty good food here, but we did take out and the service was ok.   We ordered a bunch a food and kept reminding them to get our hot sauce and they forgot!   They also didn't give us any napkins! Which is pretty important in my opinion.   I'd give them 4 stars for food but 3 for service and forgetting our things when we kept reminding them.

WwEb4dMw8paqis0puPed1Q.text: The food was super salty!!  The beef stew which we tried to order a pound of was barely edible with rice.  Notice I said tried...  we ordered a pound ($8) only to be told it's only available as a take out item and that they would kick us out if we ate it there.  But we could order 3 side dishes at $3 and that would equal a pound.  We'll take 2.  The owner stood and watch the server scoop to make sure she wasn't going to give us extra.  Awkward!!   We ordered the roast pork appetizer only to be told they just sold out of it.  Ok, give us one of the 3 ducks hanging in the window.  Sorry someone came in right now and bought the last three.  Well, let's go won ton noodle soup.  The broth was super salty but flavorful and the won tons were tasty.  30 minutes later they told us they had more duck and roast pork.  Great we'll take a side dish of both.  Sorry you can only buy in lbs.  Ok we will take a pound.  Duck was super fatty and the skin was not crispy at all, yuck.  I must admit the pork was good.  I expect service at Chinese restaurants to be horrible and they met and exceeded my every expectations.

Pf8dC0hLT_rcBbtZ8LR4cg.text: The place smells tasty (lots of smoke coming out of kitchen) and food tasted good... if you are looking for authentic chinese cuisine, this is the place to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yum yum bbq pork and roast duck
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yum yum

LksEm2iebZjbemkvfHBWIg.text: The best things DO come in small packages!  Don't let the non-descript strip mall vibe keep you away from this rockin' great food. Taking our lead from other Yelp reviewers we shared a double BBQ: Duck and Roasted Belly Pork and also ordered the Beef Chow Fun (dry). This gave us a chance to try both sides of the name: BBQ & Noodles!  We were pork belly virgins  and let me tell you after RBP, we'll never look back! It was beyond yummy; crispy outside and SO smooth and tender inside. The duck had great flavor as well, but a bit more fatty than meaty. It had great flavor and what do you expect from duck! We still loved it. Dish came with rice, a bit of 'gravy' and greens. Oh and don't forget the dipping sauces, beyond yummers.    The Beef Chow Fun was another amazing dish that we tried after reading another Yelp reviewer. So glad we did!  Wide perfectly cooked noodles, a very light sauce, scallions, and beef. The beef was cooked to perfection and didn't have a trace of fat or gristle.  Beyond good.     We'll be in town for a couple of weeks, so lucky for us we'll get to go back!

awMemy5i13HQYcy3D8R9aQ.text: This is a great place to have Asian BBQ. It's as authentic as what you would get in Hong Kong.   Pros: good BBQ items, porridge, noodle soups, and stir fry noodles  Cons: they automatically charge you tip (15%) whether u have 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 , etc. look at your receipt carefully and don't get dooped.   Tip: Cash only

NZgHuyzJkfrUZYbyC0aTuA.text: This place is a pretty good cheap food find in Las Vegas Chinatown.  What they do best is meats, especially the BBQ pork ($6.5 for rice plate)  and Roast pork. The bbq pork was one of the leaner ones I've had, which sigifies good quality.  The roast pork was pretty flavorful too.  The duck was just okay (not that much meat and a lot of gristle), don't really recommend this unless you have to have duck.   The noodles are okay, but portions are big. We got beef chow fun, and some dish using thin wheat noodles ($7 each for both) - both weren't that great but certainly passable.  We also had salty fish fried rice which was a little too fishy - I wouldn't do that again.  A lot of folks ordered the Cantonese style fried noodles ($10) - that probably would've tasted better and had heaping portions.

88Lh1qdsscQaQi1UWYK_YA.text: Well, not enough praise can be heaped on the excellent food served at this place. It satisfied my longing for the Chinese food I crave when I have not been to Chins for a while. The roast duck was impeccable as was the egg clam soup. And the fried noodles with veggies was superb. Thank God for small wonders right here in Vegas. Forget the uppity so called Chinese restaurants in the big hotels on the strip. Go venture into Chinatown if you are a foodie who appreciates the taste of Chinese cooking the way it is meant to be. Bravo!

aBuvORCaqmOS1J_627q-1w.text: Delish!! Wish they had a place like this in Phoenix!  I would eat here every day.,Amazing duck and great pork plate too. Had the fish ball soup and reminded me of Hong Kong.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood chow fun
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish ball soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq pork combo

B9_0hxFq_dj-xemeJhd26g.text: If I were to rate the restaurant only on its food, I'd give it 5 stars immediately. The roast pork, the roast duck, bbq pork, dumplings, it is all top notch and absolutely worth the trip over if you are spending a weekend on the Vegas strip.  The wait can get somewhat lengthy. The seating is a bit cramped like they might have put one too many tables in there. The service is quick and efficient even if it's a little robotic. The prices were good, you can leave there having spent under $10 a person and feel like you've more than gotten your money's worth.  Parking is plentiful and the location is easy to find.   Overall, I'd say if you have a desire for chinese bbq, you can't do any better in Vegas.

sS6mMQjBlG8oUbHh-LXVwQ.text: Great food and price. It was super crowded, however, the servive was fast. The duck was very delicious!

zpUehUjqCm4J7ElSJPDCMg.text: Came by for a quick meal before my class.  Remembered the combos on their menu the last time, and I decided to try it out.  Picked Wide Noodles with sides of "Beef Stew", "Black Mushrooms w/ Oyster Sauce", and "Beef Balls".  You also have the option to order this served with rice.  Anyway, the noodle soup is the noodle you selected with the sides as toppings.  It tasted okay to me, but the beef balls served with the largest I have ever seen served in restaurants.  Including tax it costs $6.50.  I personally think the BBQ item over Rice is the better menu option, so I will definitely come back and try more entrees off of that portion of the menu.  And Roast Duck Wonton Noodle Soup sounds good as well.  And this is a CASH only business.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.50 for 3 items combo with wide noodles. (10-6-2010)
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My to go order of Roast Duck over Rice. (9-17-2010)
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come in for Asian BBQ. (9-17-2010)

z1gJbxogabbUIzVoP7WLlw.text: Just your standard Chinese BBQ place.  Serving wonton noodle soup Cantonese style. Small place to stop and eat. Mostly local crowds. Will definitely come by more often when I get cravings for wonton soup. Place is CASH only. Stewed tripe was great. Chinese BBQ Roast pork prepared perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3sEEmfVaHBHLt5ZQAxpFjg.text: Hands down BEST place to get some roasted pork. I'm not a local, but I take very frequent trips to Vegas and I always have to drop by. I'm also that friend that asks you to buy me like 2 lbs of it if I know your're going to be in the 702 -I just gotta have it. Salted fish fried rice is also delicious. And if you want to feel kind of healthy, order the Chinese broccoli (gai lan) and voila! All of your major food groups in one meal. You're welcome.

pF9_q8DIwqj3TFUHFnBs7Q.text: This is the my first time eating at this place.  I went there for lunch and was surprised at how packed this place was.  I had to try their HK style noodle soup and their wonton soup.  For under $4, there were quite a few wontons in the bowl.  But wontons were just okay, the wontons at Noodle Palace actually tasted better.    The HK style combo noodle soup on the other hand was very flavourful.  The broth was quite tasty.  The last time I had this type of combo noodle soup was over 20 years ago back in HK.  I ordered three additional toppings for the noodle soup - pork skin, beef ball and beef stew.  I expected a decent bowl of noodle soup, but what I got instead was a big bowl with not too much toppings inside.  I was a little disappointed with the portion size.   But because the broth is so good, I will definitely come back for more.    Next time I will also try their BBQ meats.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo noodle soup with pork skin, beef balls and beef stews

-OOEOjhFbw2gnAvIuuILLQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised to see a full room of customers dining in this hole in the wall.  From the outside  you would think twice about walking in.  You wouldn't expect a full room of people and nice noodle/bbq cafe decor.   I had the roast duck wonton noodle.  The duck was good but the rest of so so.  Overall, I'd say I was happy with my meal and will definitely return to try the roast  suckling pig.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork blood chive congee
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck wonton noodle
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork

_qN8juCyMbbdIVomEUZ-Gw.text: I owed this place a review.  I've been here twice and liked both times.  After a long night of drinking, you just need something soupy.  If you're in Vegas the whole weekend and already tried pho, then you should definitely try this place.  I found this place through YELP and I would totally recommend it to people.  It's some ways from the strip, but worth the drive.    The food I've tried: *WonTon Noodle Soup with Roast Duck: great price and great portion.  The soup was clear and flavorful.  Oh, the roast duck is so good and I remember a big piece of shrimp in my wonton.   *Chinese Fried Donut: This is very good here, nice and crisp with flavor, it's good if you put it in your noodle soup or porridge.  *BBQ Pork: I like to order this as appetizer, everyone loves it at the table.   YUM! Makes me hungry thinking about it.

jF0IeIqhLqs6WQjedcp2cQ.text: Don't really what was the big deal about this place to get 4 stars. I had plenty of better noodle shops and bbq in LA and OC. The wait was not worth it. The only thing was the owner and helps were nice.

oeJhu-MAdcO0wSFoxsiw7g.text: The first time I had the roast pork from this restaurant was at my hubby's cousin's Christmas party.  It was delicious.  What's there not to like about roast pork?  Uh, well...those of you that are watching your calories and cholesterol,  don't read this post.  Shoo- go away!! Or go and take a Zocor or Lipitor and come back to this post.  As I was saying, the crispy skin and the lightly juicy fatty meat was balanced very well.  The flavor was very nice and I knew I wasn't eating Sam Woo's roast pork.  It different, it didn't have the Sam Woo flavor.  It had it's own distinct flavor that was equally as good.  And I was so happy it wasn't Sam Woo.  In the Asian population, everyone knows that Sam Woo has the best BBQ in town.    Two weeks after Christmas, I went back to order 2 lbs of roast pork for dinner.  The roast pork was consistent and still tasted just as good.  A week later the hubby and I went there for dinner and their duck noodle soup did not disappoint.  Oh yeah, I'm total fan of this place.  It's cheap and food is good and hearty.   Like most Chinese dives, they take cash only and you can communicate with them in English but if you speak a little Chinese here it goes a long way.... Oh yeah, this one here had to bust out in her Cantonese.  For this super Americanized Asian girl that was real hard!  Real hard but so worth it for the good food. -M2

0Kzx4y-1veRw6CSaI3mjAg.text: Food is good, but make sure check the bill. It added 15 % tip that you don't know so you tip again.  Bill is in Chinese, make sure to ask for bill details

S6JIgUOnKKAsYLrrLLPQlw.text: I never knew that vegas had such an awesome chinatown. We've tried many places and this place was simple, salty, and oh so good.   Noodle soups - f-ing great Chow Fun - huge portions and also really good. I got it "wet" and it came with a lot of veges and meat Wontons - plump and tasty BBQ duck - not too fatty and good.   They also have the fried bread but we didnt try it. It looked good though. Service sucked but then again, going to a cheap chinese restaurant and expecting good service is like interviewing Kanye West and expecting him to be modest...it rarely happens but when it does, it's pleasantly surprising.   Definitely recommend coming here for a nice cheap meal off the strip.

xw_QpT7fnIn7n-tRwlGtXQ.text: Great cantonese food. The congee with roast duck is AWSOME. A must visit every time I am in Las Vegas

-WPwOpLQiCc4ttFgpTGKzg.text: I wish i could give them a great review but i cant. I wish i could give no stars as the customer service was a no star at all. I waited over 35 min for some combination fried rice that never came out. I watched patiently as others came and sat and ordered and even those who came in after me for a to go order and was served. I dont know why my food was overlooked BUT customer service is everything to me and i left to go get served somewhere else. I dont even think i would try this place again because of that.

hQBNeRYPjVwepNdhAMfuWg.text: I heard so many great things about this place, so I finally decided to try it out! It's completely worth the hype because the wonton soup was amazing, the beef tendon noodles were great, and the dumpling version of the wonton soup was perfect! What's great is that they have this little bar type thing at the front that you can look at and see what other things you want added to your noodles, like tofu, fish kabobs, or various internal parts of the cow. Great place to go for lunch and the prices are fair!

JRH41_iJ5B1iQt8cJS9hcA.text: Came here for the very first time in June with my family. Very decent asian food if your looking for some wonton noodle soup, chow fun, porridge, very tasty roasted pork. will definitely come back when visiting Vegas!

7vp2hc9AE1441Ybe14xe6A.text: Likely the best Cantonese / Hong Kong style BBQ in Vegas. I tried 85% of the menu items so far everything is good.   The roast pork belly has a crispy skin w/ just the right amount of fat. The BBQ pork has the right balance of savory and sweetness. Their porridge is the traditional Cantonese style cooked for hours where you will not find the rice grain but packed with flavor. Their perfectly cooked veggie w/ lightly drizzled oyster sauce is just impeccable (in other restaurant typically over or under cooked and drown in oyster sauce). Their wonton and dumpling filling are just packed w/ flavor and have perfect chewy texture (owner said they are made fresh daily).   I honestly don't see how anyone who frequent Chinese restaurant can give this place anything less than 4 stars.

FAvr5Bc_-_mjrXnhs2zubA.text: What a gem! I didn't think I can find authentic Chinese cuisine that is comparable to NYC until I came here. The service is not as fast, but in Vegas there is no need for NYC-rush ( : This place has quickly become one of my favorite go-to places for a cheap, simple, delicious meal in all of Las Vegas.   My favorite is the roast duck and wonton noodle soup. Great portion for the price and generous with noodles (very important). You have your choice between several different types of noodles. I've tried the egg and the ramen, both tasty. If you don't want to spend $, you can get a wonton noodle soup for just $3.99 and the portion is perfect. You'd be surprised how much food they give you for such a price! My friends ordered the pork belly with rice and it was incredible.   I highly recommend this place above other Chinese restaurants in the city. I will most definitely be a frequent customer : )

PxQnQsA861OFQZVUA6MBKg.text: This place is authentic and soo good, best wonton noodles in Vegas for sure.  Also got to get the roasted pork belly, not the best I have had but the best in Vegas for sure.   This place is cash only which sucks but there are so many plus of this place that a trip to the atm before is worth it.

cvtwTyGjYO1vnPespLTPpA.text: I absolutely adore this place. It reminded me of the small places in Phoenix I used to frequent with my family. It's small, cash only, quiet, and delicious. The pork is mouthwatering. I love the chow mein (get it Hong Kong style and ask for the crispy noodles). The price is right, so my coworker and i had dinner here about 3 times while we were in Las Vegas on business.

1zU0naB_E2xvUzlP10kYvQ.text: Had the roasted duck, bbq roasted pork with crispy skin, bbq pork, Chinese broccoli, wonton rice noodle soup.  All were good.  The duck was tasty.  Both pork dishes have the right amount of fat (not too much but just a little to keep it juicy).  The pork dish with the crispy skin was very good and better than most places.  The dipping sauce was very tasty.    Much better than the Sam Woo in Las Vegas.  Prices were good.  Service was good - I did order in Chinese so may be that helped a little?    Seating was a little messy and they don't really have a system.  People showing up during lunch time and for a second, no one really know who was there first.  The waitress did try to sort it out.  We had to wait about 15 min on a Thur afternoon (shortly after 12 pm or so).   Given the food and knowing how Chinese restaurants are, I am still a fan.  By the way - cash only.

NUezg4NjDa1QuOI-AiDcmw.text: The Chinese broccoli was delish! The Duck Congee/Porridge was good but it was ALL duck bones! Little to no meat. Sad times.

Du-IMth-2l-H-0z2Rz5SHA.text: Went today-Monday - for lunch. There was a line waiting   The entire time we were there people were waiting. The service was fast. The staff can get orders out and re-arrange tables. The deserve to be top 100 local restaurants just for  that.  We had won ton noodles that were real good. Portions are generous. Watched roast duck and roast pork run out fast and replenished.

35gDoYkFEXjovftsTlWHTw.text: Food was great! It is a cash only place so hit the ATM before you get there. They took a bit to take our order but it was busy.

YQWQKsYAsAWVHJLQN-0VGw.text: I love this place!  I'm literally in love with everything I have tried and I must go there at least once a week.  Wonton noodle soup is so addictive.  I usually add duck or pork belly to it.  The pan fried noodle with vegetable and BBQ pork is my second favorite.  You must try it if you are a mushroom lover because they put big chunks of mushrooms (2-3 kinds, not the boring button mushroom) in the dish.  I give the place two thumbs up not only for the soup and noodle but also for the hot sauce provided on every table.  The unique flavor of both the hot sauce and vinegar go with their food perfectly so that the combined flavor stand out comparing to the same dishes in other Chinese restaurants.   Another big plus is that for a little Chinese fast food place the service is always good.  The waiters and waitresses are fast, attentive and friendly.

RHNx_EL6xp7FEdwozls8wg.text: Place was out of Duck at 7pm on a Tuesday. Rest of food was mediocre including BBQ pork ribs and fried rice. Vegetables were good. My friend got sick after his meal. Definitely disappointed after reading other reviews.

HWWgXYRM-J-0w9YjVGiCVA.text: This review is only for this Location. I've been to the old Location as well.it was during my visit to Vegas a few years back and my cousin bought us to the old Location. we pretty much try out all the main Chinese bbq dish there and to say I can mostly give it a 3 star. not for service nor how cheap or expensive the foods were but is pretty much base on how it looks,smell, and taste.. 3 important for us real Chinese. I have to say why does the original Location uses less MSG if any of you people knows what that is? and the new Location uses more..when I see some of the post you people write and mention that there pork belly was a little salty well if they don't use more MSG how would they taste so good. all u people is eating MSG..there price is not all that expensive if they are serving legit Chinese BBQ but there not..if u can see American people eating in there than id a different story. U don't want to see all out Chinese people in a restaurant because most of the time Chinese will go for big potion and cheap price. For u to get that they really have to use shity ingredient and u don't want to eat these kind of food. I really thought that people in SF CA has a lower expectation on Chinese food but even in Vegas too. This is just a disgrace for Chinese food.

poX4_zeN2G6jIGl30FBOAA.text: You come here for the food and not the service. Majority of the employees speak Cantonese and/or mandarin. Which is nice. Some of them speak English. You can see a lot of Chinese people here, so you know I it is legit. They do get busy during lunch and dinner.They have cook ducks, chickens, and ribs hanging for you to see. Their food reminds me of San Francisco. They are fast and the food comes out quick.   Their congee is delicious and it always hits the spot. Our favorite is the chicken with no bones congee. If you order the congee order the fried Chinese donut (fried bread) to dip in it. You won't regret it!  But they do run out pretty quick.   The BBQ combo is filling and you have a list to choose from for your meat. Their roast duck and roast pork is our favorite. The prices are pretty cheap. They do get busy and there is a line. The service is ok, you have to flag people down when it's busy. They sometimes ignore you. Its a typical Chinese restaurant like back home. Just make sure you raise your arm high enough for them to see. Like I said before you come for the food and not for the service. Don't forget they are CASH ONLY!

0yIaUOizaoh5gHUm20K31w.text: CASH ONLY. 4 stars going to authenticity but only 3 for food. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my pork belly and duck combo. Pork belly was right on, but duck was a little soggy. Good flavor on all. We also got chicken chow mein, small ramen style noodle. I am used to bigger noodle, and bbq pork chow fun. Portions are ample but flavor profile on dishes were a bit bland. Perhaps they allow guests to season to their liking. It certainly was crowded and had a large Asian following.

2JCez_KFQtGqkTJiQFI4PQ.text: This place is super authentic! Fantastic meat for great prices. The two of us ordered the 3 meat, roasted pork belly, BBQ pork and roasted duck, plate to share ($18.99) and a order of Chinese brocolli ($4.25). I would say my favorite was the roasted duck. Skin was crispy and fatty. It was plenty for two and tasted delicious. There's a waiter that speaks English so don't be diswayed.   CASH ONLY. There's a ATM in Cue D's.

fivYVjJEGeil66S-nmA9Bg.text: I wish I could give zero stars. Had a complaint because we saw our server dipping his fingers in our bowl of soup while serving it to us. They totally disregarded our complaints and said they had no idea what we were saying. Well, you just lost a customer. Never coming back.

JGN-33s3Neto0jkUoMcDsw.text: Love their duck and roasted pork. Too bad their not open on Fridays. Their sauce is so delicious!

J3EwSgXjaTKS2JTxbq11MQ.text: You want that hole in the wall Chinese food??? Not that fast food panda stuff.. but the real deal! The one with the roast duck hanging on a metal rod. With the crispy pork being chopped up. With the noodles and wonton soup all in the same bowl! This is it! The portions are big! The  service was easy. The food is delicious! The bbq pork, crispy pork, roasted duck, egg noodles with wonton soup were all so helpful to cure my hangover. It does get busy so come early!   Recommendation: Bbq pork over rice , crispy pork, roasted duck, wonton noodle soup

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q9sQXGyqHwIgCp_igcfKrQ.text: Clean interior, friendly staff. The food here is amazing! We ordered the salty fish and sausage fried rice, won ton soup, and a bbq platter (roasted pork belly, duck, and hainan chicken). This was more than enough food to pack lunch for the next day. This place is cash only. We will most definitely be back to dine here again.

LFBDXyKj_UOnGFDq3VO7ZQ.text: In Las Vegas for tasty duck and Vietnamese food. Crowded but I think since we went in May, they have moved to a bigger location.

bhNif_98cvvtY-hDxBwBGA.text: I tried coming here a couple times but the line was always out the door and over 100 degrees so we always picked other places to eat. The inside is kind of stuffy and like a typical Chinese take-out restaurant but that means all the more authentic! I had the opportunity to come here and finally try their renowned duck and char siu!   The duck wasn't bad in my opinion, definitely average or a little above average which is a good thing. The Char Siu thought was where it was at. Lightly crispy on the edges and a nice sweet glaze on top has me coming back for more! I definitely will pay a visit when I come back to Vegas!   Also, this place is cash only and most dishes on the menu are $8-$12 so be prepared!

myjJa67Q8BBi7qxgkt29cw.text: This place never cease to amaze me.  Didn't see it on the menu but I was crazing for beef stew wonton noodle soup.  So I asked the waitress if I can order this.  No problem she said. As usual the service is great and yes she got a great tip.   I also ordered the salted fish and chicken fried rice.  Without divulging their secret I asked what type of salted fish they used for this dish.  I know got guts to ask ( l like to cook myself).  She answered that they salt their own fish.  Now that's the sign of an excellent restaurant. Just like the Chinese restaurants in San Francisco Chinatown back in '50 and '60s I just keep coming back because the flavor is superb and this is as real as it gets.  No need to go back to SF Chinatown for me.

TCV3G51FMd8OB6Q1R6uGUw.text: This is one of our favorite chinease reataurent. Busy place, but taste good, reasonable price. Recommend= three combanation BBQ.

i3elCI4zMH-uS-9Hnq2BCg.text: Before going out of your way to this little establishment, remember: CASH ONLY!    This restaurant has the most delicious roasted pork and duck I have ever had!  If anything, you have to try this.  I usually buy it by the pound and bring it home to share because it's that good. I also brought a group of friends here and they said it was better than anything they've had in California, which is saying a lot!  When does Vegas ever one-up Cali?!    My last visit here, I got the Roasted Duck Wonton Noodle Soup which came with Chinese broccoli, a heaping nest of noodles, wontons, and a generous portion of roasted duck.  For $8, it's a steal!  They really now how to make something as simple as wonton soup, stand out.    The servers also speak Chinese and Vietnamese, which is definitely a plus if you speak either!  I speak neither, but their English is fine too.  My friends and I were ordering in all 3 languages to our server, which I thought was pretty cool too.    I came in at 10:05 am (it opens at 10am) with a group of friends and it was already full!  Luckily there were still a couple tables open.  5 minutes into service and they're already a full house?!  That's when you know it's good.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #38 - roast duck wonton soup. Comes with Chinese broccoli and a nest of noodles on the bottom

3zinsqTf-kGsH4BQKFS6OA.text: Beef Chow Udon Noodle Dry and Char Sui was a winner.

dChZrTC9EoHFrXobygxARg.text: This place is always busy. Very good food. We came here so manu times. So today I was order to go , beef noodle and bbq pork , crispy noodle. And i ask the lady with short and curly hair. She was doing cashire can i get extra spicy souse. And she said NO!! One dish only one. So you have 2 dish for to go you only got 2 spicy souse..  and i was like really?????

sBavY90jZtzHsf4D0qspSw.text: Whenever my family and I go to Las Vegas, we always always HAVE to go to Asian BBQ & Noodles, and it's not because of my parents' inability to be deprived of Chinese food for too long, it's because it's legitimately the best roast duck and roast pork I've had in the US (and I live in a very Asian community in SoCal)!   Although it hasn't happened to us before, we've been warned that some times they may run out on roast duck and roast pork (GASP I KNOW THE HORROR!) so I'd advise to call ahead if you're worried about missing out of bbq heaven.   Each bite of roast pork is actually the perfect combination of crispy skin + juicy meat + guilty pleasure of fat. The roast duck is also such a winner of marinated deliciousness. We always order a side of plain, wonton noodles, dried style to complement the sauciness of the roast duck. It comes slightly oily from the sesame oil, but soooo tasty and it soaks up the sauce from the roast duck REALLY WELL.   Food: Hands down, 5 stars Service: Quick but not always the friendliest because they can get super busy, 3 stars  But really, the deliciousness of the meal overrules any sub-par service!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork belly - crunchy gooooodness
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodles - perfect to pair with the duck!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck!!!!!

-Dp89zfZRNURMunIxwAouw.text: The only place I know where you can get bbq duck, charsiu, fried rice and jook at the same time. Definitely keeping this resto in my backpocket.

7WTgJvSO_xUQhdnYri8dMQ.text: My FAVORITE place to go to for Crispy Roasted Pork, Roasted Duck, BBQ Pork, and Wonton noodle soup. We've been coming here since they first opened and haven't been anywhere else for these yummy dishes since.   Crispy Roasted Pork - Has the light crispy skin roasted to perfection. The seasoning on it is spot on as well  Roasted Duck - When they first opened their ducks were always plumped and meaty like they were on steroids. Now it's been a hit or miss but is still perfectly roasted and seasoned  BBQ Pork - very moist and seasoned well. Love the fatty parts lmao  Wonton noodle soup - wontons are perfectly made and not under seasoned. Noodles aren't over cooked or under done. Comes with Chinese broccoli and the broth is seasoned good unlike other places  Place is great. This place is pretty small so is always packed!! For to go orders call in advance. For crispy pork make sure you call if your coming late at night in case they're sold out. It happens pretty often. Don't forget to bring cash since it is CASH ONLY! Enjoy!

6kEG8D4PqLI2fcRcFg7qWg.text: Aww man so so so so disappointed in this place.  Read all the good reviews and 5 star reviews. Arrived at 10:55. It was packed! Waited until 11:45 before finally being seated, ordered our food.  Good char sui (bbq pork) they surely make it different by adding either cumin and or cinnamon. They were sold out promptly by 12.  Beef chow fun had a burnt taste to it. Epic failed Combination pan fried noddle had this funky taste in the sauce= nasty Congee was ok. I had better in vegas at yum cha.  Wonton noddle- meh. Very mediocre Seriously, not sure what the hype is about. But seriously ain't never waiting this long for food with 2 little ones in tow

NVNmiB_eYbwBCS4yM5gOEg.text: My go to place when I crave BBQ pork. The price is affordable compared to its high quality food. The space is rather small and you have to pay cash, despite that, everything else is perfect.   They have very great chysantheum tea too. Everyone should try it out!

_HpTKOBAcOzkXIxB7mUeuQ.text: My favorite roast duck place in the whole city! So affordable,  and the meat is so juicy and flavorful, the skin is perfectly crispy, and the fat just melts in your mouf. The pork spare ribs and pork belly are great too. Just make sure you bring cash, as it's cash only. The only place I come when I want the D(uck)!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love this duck!

oydLrUz69FepXu-sJ9IMsg.text: This is hands down the best place for Chinese Bbq meats in all of Greater Las Vegas.  The one drawback is that the prices are,  imo, way too high,  inflated only because of greediness by the owners.  (i.e. they can charge it and we will still go since they really don't have any competition in this town).  They are opening a new branch on Spring Mountain soon,  as I hear,  but am unsure when.   The place is always jam packed,  and yet the service is quite good.   So yeah, if you have no problems with paying $13 for a combo plate of 3 Chinese bbq meats (as compared with Boston's price of equal substance and quality at $7.50 ) then you must go here when you crave it in Las Vegas.  The roast duck is excellent here as well,  but again the price of $12 for half a duck and $24 for a whole duck is expensive even compared with Boston pricing.   But for new transplants like myself from the Boston area,  I have no choice!  The restaurant itself is tucked into a corner of the mall,  across the street (Jones Blvd) from the famous Chinese supermarket 168, and is almost a typical hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant,  but with super caring attentive staff running around in this madhouse of a restaurant.   Again for first timers,  beware that it is cash only and is closed for business on Fridays.  Come and enjoy!!!!

Z90HIUT_AXzsn3gZdNvhWQ.text: Took my mom here to eat some authentic Chinese food and they did not disappoint. Food was excellent and price was great. Ordered too much food that we had to go it. Everything here was delicious. Only thing is this place is small so it was a bit tight.

Lu5y2XO-pwA7T8el2vbQ6w.text: Love the duck, pork, & chicken bbq. Very good. It is a busy little place, food is very good & service too, very surprise for a Chinese place. We were in town for 3 days & we came here for 2 meals. It is very fresh & good.

OgKv1ofYAo3ewkMfBGvqiA.text: Authentic Hong Kong style noodles and chinese bbq!!  Everything we ordered was fabulous!!  What we loved the most, as other yelpers have already pointed out, is their roast pork.  The skin was perfectly crispy, but not too hard and crunchy like some other restaurants.   The meat was perfectly seasoned and very tender.  Some places might have decent skin, but the meat may come out tough, dry, or bland.  This place literally perfected their roast pork!!  The roast duck was also notable.  It was very flavorful and had slightly crispy skin on.  The char siu, although decent, was our least favorite.  All our noodle dishes were very good.  I loved their pork intestine, beef innards, and wontons.  The noodles itself had really good texture to it -- slightly "bouncy" like how HK style noodles should be.  The broth was good also, although I've had better elsewhere since it lacked some depth.  Even as busy as they were, they were able to provide excellent service to us.  This is a difficult quality to find in a Chinese restaurant, especially where I'm from.  We enjoyed this place so much that I had to come back on my last day of vacation to pick up some takeout for our flight back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all that yummy Chinese BBQ meat!!!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry Fishballs
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig&#39;s feet &amp; Stuffed tofu noodles

7cfyY7UU4vVTroQ-N8OULQ.text: Probably won't come back because the staff was rude and it was an unusually long wait time for takeout. My takeout order was put on hold for half an hour to expedite everyone who was dining in. I was received with a grunt of frustration when I reminded the staff they left some of my take out items. The reviews were glowing for this place but I didn't see those glowing reviews when I was here. Cash only.

bCYvYXmfBHANHrqApRnMCQ.text: Best spot for Chinese noodles in Las Vegas! The wait can be insane on weekends during lunch time. I've waited 30 min to an hour on Sundays for a table...usually if this is the case I'd just leave but my grandma absolutely loves this place.   This is not the nicest chinese restaurant that you'll find in Las Vegas but the food is great! They serve the usual entrees that you would find in most Chinese restaurants but their specialty is their delicious noodle soups and BBQ entrees.   My go-to order here is a bowl of wonton egg noodle soup with the thin noodles with a side of chinese brocolli that is served with oyster sauce. These items sound simple but always leaves me satisfied and happy as can be. Their roast pork is delicious as well. I usually would avoid eating the skin of pork but that would be a sin here.  Most of the employees speak both Chinese and Vietnamese which I found pretty impressive. Their English is for the most part...broken..so be patient...you won't regret it. The food and affordable prices will have you coming back time and time again.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So hot so yummy.

9IhSdpWqTGGA-uwOkGdJ-w.text: Minus 1 star because they closed on last Saturday! I am very upset because I drove there and found out they close on the 18th and so disappointed because I wanted to bring a roast duck home, not sure if they close on every saturday. I was there on Thursday and was told they close on friday.   So I was there on Thursday for lunch/dinner around 4pm. I got half roast duck to go and super thrill that the duck skin stay crispy after I get back to my room. a good bbq rib would has the meat fall off the bone, as well as this roast duck. I didn't take much effort to bite the meat off the bone. No msg proven by my tongue. In the duck sauce I can see the cumin and star arise!!! legit cantonese style roast duck!! i ate the half duck all by myself and my stomach was not upset. Too bad I cannot drive 257 miles just for the duck and really hated that they close on saturday without notice

f1rZNcVRM_cw4aJlf4hcnQ.text: I'm from San Diego, CA and I love this place.  All of their roast meats are delicious.  I ordered pick up over the phone, it was easy and fast.  There could potentially be a long wait for dine in as the seating area is not too big.  Plenty of parking available however.

kuNyVA_7arduy-O9ZryaEw.text: If you lookin' fo fancy, dis ain't it!  If you lookin' fo ono, cheap grinds.....you've come to da right place!

2N1axxNjr9YLNoEUHSfVbg.text: My boyfriend loves this place. Food are fast and fast service. Nothing to complain about. I always order com ga hainam ( steam salted chicken and rice). The meat was very juicy, not dry. CASH ONLY! If you don't know

Lm0rbMVew9vvKmd2D6YYhA.text: I love this place.  Every time I'm in Vegas, this is a must-go.  They have great Roast Duck, and BBQ pork.  They also have a large portion of Chinese broccoli that's just flat out amazing.  Service is great and the food portions are awesome.  It's cash only and closed on Fridays :(  But otherwise, you'll love it!

im6cVankTOvAobBf-sNnEQ.text: LAY HO MAHHHH. Okay so i may be THE most white washed ABC, "american born chinese", but I know good Chinese food when I taste it. I've been to Hong Kong and had the best won ton noodles ever.. Nothing will ever compare, but I will say Asian BBQ & Noodles produces a very delicious product in fact it rivals the best i've tasted in Hawaii. So, after 2 filling days of pigging out, my friend and I decided to cut back on the binge eating a bit. Since it was a bit nippy out, we ventured for won ton noodles and roast pork. We sat down and instantly I knew it was gonna be a winner. Everyone around us was speaking cantonese. NOT A WORD OF ENGLISH. NOT ONE! We looked at the menu, thank goodness it was in english and ordered 2 won ton thin noodles and an order of roast pork. Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup ($.4.99): yelp.com/biz_photos/aD0E... Order of Roast Pork ($5.99?): yelp.com/biz_photos/aD0E... Very very very good noodles and amazing won ton. I haven't had similar quality won tons since my trip to Hong Kong last year. Roast pork is crazy crispy. Not just crispy, CRAZY CRISPY. You won't chip a tooth, but you will definitely feel the crunch. BEST ROAST PORK I have had in a long time. The restaurant was VERY clean, the wait staff struggles with english at times but definitely know enough to take your order, and the best part of all our lunch was $20 TIP INCLUDED.. My friend said the other dishes are awesome as well. If you have a hankering for Cantonese chinese food and are on a budget, this is definitely the spot for you.. You know what they say, "when in vegas, do as the CHINESE do." :)

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Won ton noodle soup.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Really crispy roast pork!

nVeXh80grWr9Z-lW1_X0jA.text: For Vegas, this is pretty damn good. My mother even approved and nothing is EVER as good as her's!  She usually likes going to Cafe Noodle House and now she has a new favorite!  She even said it compared to noodle houses in Hong Kong! Guess that says it all...  I've been here a few times now and have compared the wonton noodle soup (my comfort food) to other's I've had in Vegas and they are hands down the best in the city.   Even their roast duck and roast pork is awesome.  It is always packed and is a cash only establishment but well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My comfort food..roast duck wonton noodle soup!

j-P9wFOgfw3XGl3SZs7-rA.text: Food is good, don't get me wrong. Ethics are horrible. Did you know they built in 15% as tips onto the bill after adding the tax and not telling the customers! Of course we paid tips over the total amount, so the total tips would be over 40%.   We have been going there for years and trusted them. It was only discovered recently by my guest. That is cheating in my books.  So please check your bill, especially if you have a big party.

tGYgCP4jjxF_3OPUitFobg.text: If u like authentic Hong Kong style noodle and bbq, this place has it...get the 2 items over rice, roast pork and roast duck, you will love it...place is kind of small, always crowded, on the noodle, u can pick different combinations of items into it..and u can pick different noodle too, I also got half roast duck to go, very tasty and yummy compare to other place, price is a little high, but it is worth it...NO CREDIT CARD     CASH ONLY...!!

03mG0G7bzfMZrFN4ZU-UNQ.text: Great food but the lady at the cashier is the worse. She must be the owner. Not even a smile. I hate order to go and have to pay with her. The worse, absolutely worse.

WjzLGTO2Zzo7nezK0ip6Yw.text: Best wonton noodle soup - broth is really delicious, perfect noodles and wontons. Other Cantonese favorites were great too - rice soup, beef chow fun, fried rice - but note that this place does get packed, doesn't have big tables (mostly 2-4 people tables), abundant parking (located on corner left of strip mall)

gkxH97PpGzAWAJfKVLYN6w.text: Crispy duck and belly pork are the best anywhere. Very fast service.I had to come back again the next day and like it more.  One may be turned off because the place is very small abd located in a not very clean and unattractive strip mall. But great food makes you forget that when you are full and happy.

UtwZem-JnMijjZJSzOwSmw.text: By far the most flavorful roast duck and roast pork I have had. The shrimp wontons were loaded with whole shrimps, bbq pork fried rice had that hint of burn flavor that only a seasoned full fire wok wood have, chicken chowfun was good, Chinese brocoli with oyster sauce, why not.  For two people again so much food and plenty take home to the posse aka kids. Bonus, the bill was only 40 bucks.   Definetely coming back and trying the other side of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything was on point

2phmlnAhC2B9kcijLJL_ig.text: Who doesn't love BBQ!?  Who doesn't love Asian Style BBQ!?  Who loves to pay CASH ONLY in a rated Top 100 Chinese Restaurant?   Who doesn't like to fight for a parking spot and having their car dented by other patrons!?  This place came highly recommended from a friend whom I trust with places to eat.  As I entered, I noticed the food hanging in the display as well as other prepared items.  The smell was very welcoming.  I wanted to try everything.  It was one of those moments where my eyes were much hungrier than my stomach...    We weren't too hungry and were actually planning on dining late late night afterwards so we decided to share a huge plate of combination fried rice and Roasted Duck as well as Pork.  They were both thinly sliced and sauced but prepared to perfection. Both were packed with flavor and very satisfying.  A side of two sauces were provided as well.    The color selection for the walls were odd and unique but didn't bother me.  The dining area is laid out to fit the maximum amount of guests.  The service is great and quick.  I'd be back again in a heartbeat, if I have a craving for quality Asian BBQ.   You have to try this place at least once if you're in Las Vegas.    You can thank me later.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy action

KDvbqlpZQB7euNOrSY8vng.text: Cash only and closed Fridays!!  We came on a Sunday morning and thankfully didn't have to wait but if you're going during lunch time, make sure you get there a bit earlier because the parking lot and the line could get very busy.  BBQ 3 COMBO PLATTER ($17.99) - their roasted belly pork was SO crispy and now I know why they're known for that. It actually surprised me how crispy it was and the person sitting next to me could hear the crunch. This is a must-get when you're here, whether you're getting a combo platter or the roasted pork by itself. The BBQ pork was thinly cut, different from the kind that I usually see which is a bit thicker. Their roasted duck was good as well. They give a sweeter sauce for the roasted duck and another that I think was just hoisin sauce.  PAN FRIED NOODLES WITH BEEF ($11.99) - I was craving pan fried noodles so I was really excited about this. I thought it was okay; the noodles were crispy and had a decent amount of beef in it. It wasn't anything too special but still solid.  SHRIMP DUMPLING NOODLE SOUP ($7.99) - the shrimp dumplings were very tasty! I put a little bit of hot sauce in there and it just brought out the flavors even more.   This place is not too far off the strip if you have a car so it's a nice place to go to when you're leaving Vegas. I definitely want to come back here when I go to Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ 3 Combo Platter ($17.99). From left to right: BBQ pork, roasted duck, roasted belly pork
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp dumpling noodle soup ($7.99)
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan fried noodles with beef ($11.99)

JDEb0HbeVYy4H1jUOmLsgA.text: BBQ and noodles? Don't hold me back y'all.  I wanted to introduce some variety into our Las Vegas dining adventure, which largely consisted of venues on the Strip. The boyfriend loves roasted duck, so this place was a no-brainer. BBQ, noodles, great prices, and across from 168 Market so that we could pick up some water, Asian pastries, and sake. Perf.  There were a few parties ahead of us, but we got seated within 2 minutes of writing my name down. Service is fast, which is crucial if you're friggin' hungry. Per Yelp's advice, we brought cash for our meal.  We ordered #23 2-combo BBQ plate with roasted pork belly and roasted duck for $13.99--delicious. I also got #38 roasted duck wonton noodle soup, $9.99. The shrimp & pork-filled wontons were fab (I love wontons), and the thin egg noodles went well with the salty meats. My boyfriend got #40 chicken vermicelli rice noodle soup, $9.99. The shredded chicken meat seemed a bit dry, and my boyfriend admits that he should have gotten what I ordered.  BBQ on fleek.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #23 2-combo BBQ plate with roasted pork belly and roasted duck, $13.99!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #38 roasted duck wonton noodle soup, $9.99! So good!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #40 chicken vermicelli rice noodle soup, $9.99! Was aite.

aG21-51jhR9STcWC0IXtNg.text: THIS IS A CASH ONLY RESTAURANT  Definitely worth the Uber ride from the Vegas strip and to wait in line.   I went at an odd hour-maybe 4pm. They weren't too busy, but busy considering the time. I got the roast pork and salty fish and sausage fried rice.   Roast Pork - 4.5/5 - absolutely delicious. Everything you'd want for roast pork. Crispy skin and flavorful meat. Took off .5 because it seemed like it sat there for a little bit. It wasn't fresh fresh.   Salty Fish and Sausage Fried Rice - delicious! Great wok flavor and plenty of salty fish and Chinese sausage in it. Plenty of flavor and great portions. - 5/5  Overall 4/5 - Service was good. Portions were large and place is pretty cheap.

kwY4vnl1vN-bjqV0xjVsww.text: This place is always a must for me when I go to Vegas. The atmosphere and the food brings an authentic vibe. Also, CASH ONLY! Reason for the four star, is the service is lacking. Although, I think that adds to the authentic vibe. Roast pork, scallion chicken and Peking duck is a must!

Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KJnMXXW0VazJ8km2fZIkbA.text: We've been back a few times since my original 5-star review.  Since then, prices are up and quality is down.  Today, we ordered a combination chow fun.  I asked the waitress to order it with less bean sprouts.  Instead, we got beef chow fun with a lot of bean sprouts.  When another waiter brought it to our table, I pointed out that we ordered the combo with beef, chicken and shrimp and that perhaps this was for another table.  He said that it was ours and that it was noted on the order.  We ate it since it was already prepared and I wasn't sure what they'd do to our new order in the kitchen if they had to redo it.  The BBQ plate of roast duck and roast pork was ok, but not as good as we've remembered.  The duck wasn't as flavorful and the skin on the pork wasn't crispy.  Too bad since we always stop here to eat when we're in Vegas.  Guess we'll have to discover another new place.

bx08sXe3e9vFX14k12aRmw.text: Called and ordered Chinese donuts ,i wanted to make sure it's Freshly made by the chef , not the frozen package from the grocery store . The lady answered my inquiry on the phone was very promising but after I picked up , they were obviously fried from the frozen package of 4 that you can buy from the store for $3.49 . They had charged me over $9 for ONLY 3 pieces !!  This is not the way to do the business , honestly is a key to success . This happened at their newly opened restaurant location on Spring Mountain Road . I looked around their dining area , there was NOT even one table had customers . All wait staffs were looking at me as I was talking to the cashier about the issue. But too bad , they had collected my money so i wouldn't get a refund ! My loss but will never go back there again . I have coworkers had the same bad experiences !

GRuretGOCJF7JSdP-l7toA.text: I love this place! They've really nailed all of their flavors and I've yet to order anything here that I didn't like. If you're coming here for the first time with a group, I'd recommend getting the BBQ 3 Combo Platter with Roast Pork, BBQ Pork, and Duck. It's a great way to sample three of their amazing meats. If you're not a fan of pork, the Soy Sauce Chicken is very good too. My favorite fried rice here is the Chicken and Salty Fish and you can't go wrong with their Wonton Noodle Soup.  Something to keep in mind is that they are CASH ONLY, so plan for that. Also sometimes if you eat in, the service can be kinda meh. I don't speak any Chinese but sometimes I have a pleasant experience and other times it's hard to get anyone's attention, but honestly this place is a great hole in the wall and I come here for amazing food, so the service doesn't really phase me. Another thing to note is that they're a fantastic option for takeout. I always see them get tons of takeout orders when I eat there and I also call in to pickup orders here when I just feel like having some BBQ and rice at home.   The best takeout options in my opinion are the BBQ on Rice options on the menu (items #1-8) and also the Wonton Noodle Soup. They are such a great value, with the BBQ on Rice items being $7.50 - $8.00 each and the soup being even cheaper than those.   Last note: The restaurant itself is located in the corner of a very popular plaza with a handful of other restaurants such as Ramen Tatsu, District One, and Chubby Cattle, so parking here during prime hours can be difficult.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Salty Fish Fried Rice
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Noodle Soup

063VHWneFOfZBlKmb-8U1g.text: I really don't know what the hype is for this busy little place located in a strip mall. The staff ,well let's just say they are overworked and probably underpaid hence the no nonsense attitude. We ordered the 2 combo bbq platter , duck and pork. The duck was cold and fatty no where near the crispy skin I craved. The pork was fried pork belly , I dint get why it was called bbq pork. We ordered beef chow fun and it was ok , but no better than my local take out. Maybe my expectations were too high.

gUg6P7LPeOo2akx8sm-uXQ.text: Cash only Folks! Had a late lunch conisiting of the 3 meat plate with steamed rice and a diet coke and the total came to $22.50! Wow really expensive for a little hole in the wall noodle joint.  I ordered the roast duck, BBQ pork, and ginger chicken. The barbecue pork and duck were top-notch. The ginger chicken however is served cold which was kind of a turn-off for me because I guess they just coach the chicken leg and boiling water with ginger in it and then put it on the plate so it almost feels like you're eating a raw chicken leg when you look at the boiled skin of the dish. Stick with the duck and pork and you won't be disappointed!

VAV7KyCi_jzC7QDlgj6b1Q.text: Don't ruin ur night like I did...closed on Friday...wtf what res taurant is closed on fridays...curse this place

A4gzi-L-eU13QZwirx-mAw.text: 5 stars for food 2 stars for service  Love the clam congee and all their meats. Really delicious!  They silently put 15% tip on their bill. You may double tip if you don't check carefully. The waitress is helpful but they are super busy so the service is far from decent. Seating is small and restaurant is packed.

tNx6HSOy_yy3ZnllxXuZ0A.text: This is your one stop shop for all things Chinese BBQ. The centerpiece of the restaurant is that brightly lit display case full of beautiful roasted meats, all waitin' for your pickin'. What will it be? The succulent roast duck seasoned to the bone, that sweet sticky char siu, or my personal favorite, heavenly juicy roasted pork with crunchy skin? A combination plate with a side of refreshing palate cleansing pickled radish is the answer for those who want to try it all  But you already know that. This restaurant is named Asian BBQ and Noodle after all. What you may not know is that you're forgetting the latter "noodle" half of it and you're missing out. The noodle and rice dishes here are equally as spectacular as their meats. Yes, flip that menu over and enter into a whole new realm of carb heaven! Carby delights ordered this visit include the salted fish and chicken fried rice, Chao Chow style rice noodles, beef chow fun, and tomato beef on rice  -The fried rice (10/10) was absolute perfection from taste to texture- miles away from your average down the street Chinese spot. Don't like the salted fish scare ya! It's not fishy but fragrant and aromatic. Always good and def one of the "must have's" here. -The rice noodle rolls (6/10) were so soft and silky and a perfect companion to an egg batter and hot wok. The "Chao Chow" style just means with shrimp and bbq pork sticks. I found this dish a bit dry and bland, so add some chili and soy for more flavor! -Beef chow fun (7/10) was ordered dry. There's a known saying that you should order this if you want to gauge a chef's cooking skills, since it's so easy to mess up. The chow fun here is much less oily than other places but that also means a bit of the "wok hei" is sacrificed. -Tomato beef on rice (8/10) is one of my childhood favorites. Clearly, it still is. Sweet and sour tomato sauce with silky scrambled eggs and tender beef on top of hot rice. What's not to love?  Delicious, filling, and cheap are all words to describe the food here. Although it's terribly busy here at peak hours, and the seating is tight and cramped, and although that tasteless lime green wallpaper may bore a hole in your eyes (maybe that's just me), this cash only joint is without a doubt worth seeking out an ATM for. Only thing bad thing about this place is they're closed Friday's  They've also got a new location that opened just not too long ago and not too far away from this one. I'll have to check it out sometime

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauteed Tomato Beef w/Egg over Steam Rice
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Chow Fun, Chao Chow Style Rice Roll, Salty Fish &amp; Chicken Fried Rice

ENu-z2loIflv81AqCOeXgQ.text: Food and service was good. The chow fun was lacking in flavor. We ordered the beef stew to go and you hardly see any meat in there. It was more daikon.  Their bbq is top notch definitely worth coming back for.   Just a heads up,  this restaurant is cash only and closed on fridays.

HYdXNOqHTkIqfTiNPZwqsw.text: I came in to this restaurant since I was craving some authentic Chinese food and I regret this decision. Let me tell you guys the reason why. While I was waiting for my half a duck to be cut, the lady cutting it saw the waitress walking pass her with an empty entry and put literally OUR CUT PIECES OF DUCK into the damn tray. Usually I wouldn't mind if I didn't order half a duck, but to witness her giving away the duck I'm going to pay for is ridiculous. While handing us the food, we stood by our grounds and spoke up for ourselves. The lady tells us "I don't understand what you're saying" in Cantonese. Excuse me? We are from China so it's funny how you suddenly don't understand and then before we left she said "well that's the boss so she can do what she wants".   From my experience, I just want you guys to know to beware of their shadiness towards their customers. They aren't going by their words and are clearly cheating their way with it. I hope you guys witness this and NEVER COME BACK HERE.

QZljf70OjB38Fx8ynqoGNQ.text: THE FOOD IS SO DAMN DELICIOUS!  I ordered: 1 pound of crispy pork (14.99/lb) 1 pound of BBQ Pork (11.99/lb) 1 order of Salty Fish and Sausage Rice (8.99)(different but great!) 1 order of (Dry) Shrimp Chow Mein (11.99) Totaling: $54.00  Not bad at all for the Best Asian Food I have ever Tasted!  This is my Favorite Asian Restaurant. Make sure to ask for extra sauce (BBQ Sauce)!

Y1xrosQz5b3hJC8fGIK8VQ.text: After a trip to Valley of Fire State Park with one of my former students and his family,we came here because his wife had been told that this restaurant had the best BBQ pork in Las Vegas.  They may, but you couldn't tell it by me.  The place is very small and we had to wait about 10 minutes before they put two tables together so the 5 of us could sit.  I think I may have simply ordered wrong.  I got # 71, BBQ pork chow fun (dry style).  It was good but there was nothing with the BBQ pork that stood out.   I did however want to grab one of their Peking ducks and run out the door quickly.  They would have stopped me I'm sure.

7LBfv08f6FaJ9WQcc1yoTQ.text: This place had all the markings of a real find. Looks quite authentic, menu in English and Vietnamese, roasted pork belly and duck hanging in a case, all very enticing.   We came here especially for the roasted pork belly, which by all accounts was worth the trip. Nice staff, and they helpfully directed us to the nearest ATM. Like a lot of places in LV you need cash and will have to run to a janky ATM machine (and pay $3+ fee for the pleasure).   Ordered the roast pork belly with rice and the combo bbq, roast pork belly & duck. Served with a big mound of rice, Chinese greens and some pickled carrot and daikon strips. The pork belly tasted nice, and there was a pleasant dipping sauce, but the skin was so hard it was difficult to chew.  Really enjoy a bit of crackling, so this was a real bummer. The duck was chopped into perfect chunks to pick up with chopsticks ant pop into your mouth, but surprise, still attached to some pesky bones. That was a bit frightening! Tasty though.   Slightly disappointing, but maybe my expectations were a bit high. You're spoiled for choice in Chinatown, and if you're looking for a place that is a hidden gem and knocks your socks off, keep looking.

lGy8i9g-OWxfrbpYvRfRFg.text: Went there again last Wednesday night, I heard they open a new Asian BBQ  noodle called NEW Asian BBQ noodle just around the corner off Spring Mountain Rd. Place was pretty quite but, better for me.  Ordered the 2 BBQ meat combo to go. In and out in less than 10 mins.  Got back to my Hotel and chowed down.. I definitely recommend this place, not sure if I want to go to their new place, maybe next time when I go to Vegas...

PrVk6UEo4BAt3qFQVxXayg.text: Asian BBQ & Noodle.... just like its name, simple, direct, no frills.... Our short stopover at Las Vegas (before moving on to our Zion vacation) means we need to seize every moment and be very selective on where we have each of our meals.  This is our first meal after arrival because I just can't say 'no' to delicious BBQ and noodle soup.  Hubby and I ordered a combo dish (crispy pork and soy chicken), wonton soup (hold the noodle, need tummy space for other stuff), spicy cold pig ear appey, and then a whole duck (mainly to-go to enjoy later in the hotel).  The food was delicious.  Crispy pork certainly has that nice crispy skin.  The roast duck and soy chicken were both very flavorful.  The pig ears are certainly spicy and has that crunch texture I am looking for.  Wonton warms my heart and soul (my comfort food).  It was a very happy first meal.  The service, like everything in the restaurant, is direct, efficient, and no frill.  This is exactly what I had expected for a good satisfying meal.  No fluff, just good delicious food.

SZVQU77sOQzP9Z2N19PnBw.text: We got the 2 meat platters, crispy pork belly and barbecue pork, both meats are really good and the platter comes with rice and vegetables. We also got chicken porridge due to my wife has a toothache, surprisingly the porridge is really good, you need to put soy sauce and a little bit of chili sauce for the kick. The last thing we got was wonton noodle soup, I personally enjoy that the most out of all the dishes, the soup is tasty.

O_xnoXp1DGBbQmo2BxvCxA.text: Thumbs up for their noodles!! Proberly the best noodles I had from any asian restaurant in the States I tried so far.  Love the roasted pork and roasted duck, the skin is so crispy! And their chili sauce is great as well !!

57oj2-iZJM7FDe40DcFByg.text: I've been meaning to try this place out for such a long time. I actually stopped by a couple of months ago in the middle of lunch hour, and it was so crowded (even for to-go ordering) that we just couldn't stand to wait. I'm so glad that I finally made the time to come back.  You'll find a lot of awesome entrees in English, Chinese, and Vietnamese (some of the employees speak it, actually) on the menu. Noodle soups, congee, chow mein, and fried rice options abound. Large trays of meats are available for advance order. There's even various pig parts to order if you're into that kind of thing.  However, for my first attempt, I had to go for the "BBQ 2 Combination With Rice" for $6.99. I had the roasted pork belly (aka crispy pork) and the roasted duck as my options, and I have no regrets. These two meats actually bring back childhood memories from when my parents used to order trays of them from a local butcher and we'd enjoy them at home with some rice that we'd cooked.  Every table in the restaurant was taken - go figure - so I got my order in a to-go box. Instant nostalgia with the pork and duck laid on a bed of rice, plus a healthy side of Chinese cabbage. I just had the time of my life sitting in my car eating these delights. The pork was chopped into very manageable rectangular portions, each with perfectly crunchy skin, a layer of white, and a layer of dark meat. The duck pieces had lovely golden brown skin and a very anise-y seasoning on the bottom. Make sure to expect bones if you order the roasted duck, and you'll just have to kinda slice or bite them off to get to the meat.  I'm already plotting my next trip back. Maybe I can sit down and enjoy a nice noodle soup next time. That would be a great winter lunch, mmm...

_zJr2ro88PgrQc8yBdltMQ.text: Yup, I finally got to try this bookmarked place. Long line. Crowded. But when got the chance to sit, the waiter was courteous, gave us forks, and even gave us an estimate for the cooking time of our order. The yang chow fried rice was very good and meaty. The beef chow mein had too much sprouts but still tasted ok. Overall, 4 stars is appropriate.

-9tONqIHgMuIu9lQu01vfw.text: After a day spent hiking through the Valley of Fire, our group was in desperate need of something to re-energize us. What better way than some bowls of Shrimp Dumpling Wonton Noodle Soup, Roast Duck Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup, Roast Pork / Cha Shu / Char Siu, and Crispy Pork. Everything was tasty, service was prompt and it was fun to contemplate if we should take some roasted ducks back with us. Definitely worth another visit the next time we are in Vegas :)

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Wonton Noodle Soup

tnz6ehYiQNNmSfmsG6jAlg.text: I usually don't write reviews but when i do it's usually a good thing or a bad thing. Well mostly good   First off, I came here because of a coworkers recommendation so I decided to finally check it out.    When I got here it was packed but I went for take out. I noticed the duck and pork hanging and I was in awe and drooling over it. I love roast duck and roast pork. You know your in a good Asian restaurant went you smell like the food. I ordered the bbq 2 combination plate of roast duck and roast pork. My uncle got the same plate but with bbq instead of the roast pork. Now as for flavors, the pork has a good balance of Chinese 5 spice and cooked long enough to be tender to the teeth. The duck was awesome also. Love that skin and flavors on it. Just what I'm looking for when I roast duck.   Now my only gripe to this place and why I gave it 3 stars was that while I was waiting to get my food, I seen a couple of flies roaming around and at least one flying in the steam table. As a person who works in the restaurant industry especially in the back of the house, that is a red flag. That is no Bueno. Not good in my eyes. Other than that, I'd give this place 5 stars because of the food, the flavors of the food and the price I'm getting for it. No doubt I'll still go back. Just don't want to see any flies again.

dxDB6rwl4kcgopz8QRws3g.text: This place has the best roast pork.  It's always super crowded and if you don't make it in by a certain time, the roast pork is gone.  They only make a certain amount each day so go early.  The other item you should order is the fried xo rice roll.  It takes a little longer to make but well worth it.  I don't think you can find this anywhere else.

pWaYuHy3x02RApQ2ypmIsQ.text: My brother in law recommended this place so my husband and I decided to give it a try. And we are so glad we did! It was a different twist from the original flavors you find around LA. Their wonton's were especially flavorful! They added a bit of sesame seeds in them to give it that flavor. Would not have imagined wonton's ever with sesame seeds nor did we ever think works well in a wonton, but it did. Their noodles are a bit different from the traditional (darker yellow and curlier) type noodles. They are lighter and more vermicelli-like but surprisingly still el dante in texture which makes up for it. I prefer the traditional way on this one, so depending on your taste buds you may or may not prefer the noodles. The soup is also different (not your traditional or as genuine). Basically, a different twist in flavors (more from my home town then my husbands) but still good. Generally, I would give the wontons a 9/10, the noodles/soup a 7/10, giving the dish an 8/10.   We got the duck and bbq pork with rice too. They were yummy too especially the sauce they put on the rice! Note that its probably made with the duck fat so it would be cholesterol up the ying-yang but so yummy. The curry fish balls and pork ear cartilage were yummy too. Perfectly seasoned!  Ambiance: Its in Chinatown, a mom and pop. Don't expect it to be fancy and if you can not stand a whole duck with the head and all and other meats hanging around, then you may not want to eat here. Take it to go or face the other way if possible.   Price: Fair. Although portion are not the biggest which can make it a bit costly if you want to look it that way. We ordered 3 items for the 2 of us. So go figure.  Parking: Plenty

CFlwFZIW1w01InOBLmtgxw.text: We've visited this place time to time. The food is delicious, amazing, and worthy for a return trip. However, there is always something missing. Originally, a couple years ago, the service was terrible, but they've slowly  improved and are actually nice. This is more traditional Chinese food and not American/Chinese type. Great food, but they need to figure their stuff out.

cOGovUpkCnL_0DbganoDRQ.text: Can't believe my husband & I found a Chinese BBQ place just as good as home! We ordered a 3 meat BBQ combo and beef chow fun. Ended up ordering another half duck. Almost killed the whole thing. It was so good! Their roasted pork was yummy too. I really enjoy it when restaurants cut the pork all nice and small, I enjoy it more. All in all, I'd come back when I'm in town. It's a hole in the wall spot that delivers.  It's like any other Chinese restaurant, not that great of service and you really have to hunt down for someone. I'm just there for the food. If you're big on service at these types of spots, good luck. Just get it Togo.

91EWeMf3A86maBnYL1lZhA.text: The roast pork is definitely worth the wait. I've only been there twice but it's becoming one of my other must visit before I leave Vegas places. The lull occurs between 2:30 and 4:30 and you can probably get a table in under 10 minutes otherwise it can be anywhere from half an hour to an hour for a table during the lunch and dinner rush. I've tried the dumpling noodle soup and the roast port and both were excellent but the roast pork has wonderful crispy skin and the pork not over roasted to achieve this so that it is still moist and tender.

qqkk8bTYEKdwwB5EHzWmtA.text: Items Selected: Roasted Duck, BBQ Pork, Roasted Belly Pork Combo Roasted Duck Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup Roasted Pork and Preserved Egg Congee  Seafood Dry Noodle  Located in the same plaza as Chada Thai as well as China Mama, and on my 'to-do' list since a few days after relocating to Sin City, it was finally on a Saturday evening that I met a friend at Asian BBQ & Noodle - the only two Caucasians to set foot in the place between the hours of 6:30 and 7:45pm proving to be a very good thing.  Tight yet tidy, with a Cash-Only policy that proves no issue as items trend far cheaper than one might expect when considering the quality and quantity of the food, it was at the last remaining table that the two of us squeezed in and navigating the concise menu it was to the amusement of us both that the waitress' eyebrows raised as preserved egg porridge was ordered, not to mention three additional plates.  Waiting mere moments for orders to be prepared, several to-go customers popping in and out as my friend sipped potent iced tea while I opted for water, it was first the aforementioned cauldron of congee that arrived and almost as if to award our "adventurous" order the creamy bowl of rice was absolutely chock-a-block full of both crispy pork and blackened egg, each bite a new adventure with baby bok choy, chives, scallions, and mushrooms also joining the mix.  Next brought the barbeque plate, a bountiful trio of meats with crispy belly pork outperforming supple flesh of barbeque and excessively bony duck, it was an interesting contrast to see the same fowl deboned in a steaming bowl of soup fare much better, the skin softened only slightly by broth while long-style noodles were springy and plethoric, a half-dozen tender dumplings fully packed with nicely seasoned shrimp.  Well aware that we had over-ordered, but happy that my friend would have a couple meals the following day at a grand tally of $60 inclusive of tax and tip, it was with a substantial plate of dry noodles that the meal would end, and although the seafood was undoubtedly frozen and rather par for the course, it was the melange of mushrooms that helped to prop up the plate, each featuring a distinct earthy flavor that worked in concert with the vegetables and gravy to offer a flavor both savory and a touch sweet, a nice compliment to the otherwise rich dishes more rich with fatty cuts of meat.  A bit disappointed by the duck and seafood, though universally impressed by the pork, portions, and price there is little question as  to why Asian BBQ & Noodles remains a local favorite, the frequency of return limited only by a somewhat limited menu and several more Chinatown spots to explore.

Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H-5P8TiW_g9SI8shPNDLRg.text: I agree with the consensus here. The roast pork is phenomenal. The perfect balance of crispy skin and juicy meat. It is little angels dancing in your mouth when you eat it.   The BBQ pork and duck are alright in my opinion, good but nothing to go crazy over.  If you order a two meat combo with rice, you get your money's worth. No question.   I have only ordered off the menu and not off their a la carte buffet. I want to but with the language barrier I am sure it would be too difficult.  However, as much as I love this place I haven't been as much as I would like because sometimes ordering can be very frustrating here. I swear I think they understand me but choose not to. Last visit, I wanted to scream. I was that frustrated. Because of the ordering I have to give this place a 3 star. I feel that if I walk away from an experience more annoyed, then something is wrong.
