rlZphf2a_kvLvXPdcB-5UA.text: Small setting with a large number of fans. This place delivers great tasting food and whenever I walk in during lunch time it's always busy in one form or another. We decided to eat here on July 4th (today) and it was packed; had a line going out the door.  Got our number and waited approx. 10 min before being seated: -Half a duck -Hoi Nam Gai Fan -Noodles w/pig skin & intestine When my dad got his plate, we could just hear in the background that they lost our check.  It was kinda funny really, the chaos of a packed restaurant as well as the waiters yelling back and forth of where the check mysteriously disappeared to. (The matter was solved in the end.)

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Packed on July 4th (packed any other day)

jTSaS-Dl1SB_AjBTWfRuhg.text: This is a small hole-in-the-wall restaurant that always seems to be busy. CASH ONLY. I would give service 1-star but food 4-stars. Let's break things down.   Service: The servers do not pay much attention to you. If you have questions or have any requests, you have to get their attention as they are moving all around the place. When ordering, we asked a question about the menu, and we got a loud and rude response back. I asked our server for some extra sauce, and her response was, "They are too busy back there. Can't you see we're very busy? Maybe next time." So, I asked a different server and got my sauce.   Food: The food is good. I highly recommend the BBQ pork and roasted pork belly! The meat is tender and the skin of the pork belly is crispy! The presentation for most dishes are decent (for those who enjoy taking photos of their meal like I do). The prices are very affordable, and the portions are satisfying.  Atmosphere: It is a fast-paced environment with tables getting constantly moved around to accommodate various party sizes. It does get rather crowded and noisy sometimes but definitely tolerable.

040vHm1RoDtLfmgnmn3HJw.text: Definitely is thousand times better than Wendy's kitchen. Wendy kitchen is so bad that I barely take a bite. Then I walked to this resturant. I would say 3.5 stars. Food Is okay. Value is okay. Not the best Cantonese food, but I guess it's alright in Las vegas.

CVrXQbve2NKhIdN6TJig6Q.text: This place is Da Bomb! Okay that was super cheesy and super 90s, but there are no other words to express how delicious this place is.   Five stars purely because their roast duck, & roast pork is freaking amazinggggg. It is seriously one of the best roast ducks I've ever had (and I'm Chinese American, so that's a lot of roast duck I've eaten in my lifetime).   Other dishes: the shrimp dumpling soup was okay (I've had better), and honestly I don't remember anything else we ordered bc I was having a duckgasm. (That might be flagged for inappropriate content, sorry Yelp).  The restaurant itself is kinda small, seats maybe 50. There's a long table in the back with maybe 10-12 seats, and you have to squeeze by them to get to the bathrooms. But i kinda love the restaurant's small size because it feels like an awesome neighborhood joint.   This place gets busy and stays busy. My party of four went at 2pm on a Saturday and we didn't have to wait bc we took the last open table. The party that walked in behind us had to wait a few min (10min) for a table to open up.   the service is also pretty good! Nice servers, came by often to refill our drinks, clear away empty dishes, got us our specific requests promptly, etc.

ccNDX4fQTdQ6bDNMfWpM_Q.text: Came here for dinner last night. I ordered the choy sum with oyster sauce, BBQ pork, and beef fried rice. The food was 10/10. The portion was enough to get my boyfriend & I full. The flavors were amazing.  The service was 9/10. Food took awhile to come out. They weren't super friendly but most Asian establishments are like that.  The food made up for the customer service. I just wish they still had roast pork when I went.

CngeEHmCI6IHlyLmNr3r5Q.text: I love coming here every time I'm in Vegas.  Everything I've ordered taste great.  Won Ton Noodle soup is delicious; the white chicken with flavored rice also very good: I'm not a fan of the roast duck but my parents love it.  I also always order the roast bbq pork, it's a must if you come here!

98Nf3107CydL_ZtUXhz3Hg.text: I absolutely love this hole in the wall place. A couple days ago, my husband found this place for us to grab some lunch since we arrived too early to check in our hotel at the strip. We ordered the roasted pork belly and OH MY GOSH it was delicious! The texture was perfect. It was crunchy on the outside and the inside was so soft. It came with steamed rice & this sauce. The sauce was so good!! It also came with a side of soup. Although the soup was bland, I understand why. It went perfect with the meal...since the meal itself had so much flavor. We loved this place so much that we went back today before we head home. And ofcourse we ordered the same meal & we tried the pig ears...& ofcourse they didn't disappoint. It was delicious as well. We will definitely come back here if we're in town again!!!!

9gp73R1_tcTGjJ2WNObsfw.text: I came here with my family from California for lunch. We were a big group of about 12 people. This establishment was very accommodating and had our two tables set up for us when we arrived. The servers here were attentive and made sure we felt comfortable to enjoy our time together.  We ordered plenty of dishes, but the crispy pork and roasted duck were amazing. The crispy pork had just enough fat and a perfect crisp to it. It wasn't dry or over salted like most places. Same goes for the duck, which was flavorful and nicely glazed. I would definitely recommend these dishes.  The noodle wonton soup was not a standout meal, but fresh nonetheless. The wontons were freshly made but the soup was lighter than what I am accustomed to and the noodles didn't retain much flavor. This made the dish mediocre for me. Maybe next time, I would order just the wontons!  Overall, I would recommend this restaurant if you want authentic roasted duck and welcoming service.

t6IBSIplASCyyrs5zV8F0A.text: Food here is great especially the pork belly and roast duck! Service is nonexistent, you have to flag down the waiters! Went in at 11:40 and there was a long line and it was packed inside. Go in first to put your name down on the waiting list but they don't seat you on the order you come in. rLU1dE0ZKztL1xbhONPYBQ.text: We tried this place for the first time tonight as we wanted to try something new and at some point I had bookmarked this restaurant. When we walked in the first thing that hit us was the smell. Immediate mouth watering commenced. The next thing we noticed was how bustling and busy the restairant was. These two things were good indicators, because we loved our food. I got the crispy pork belly plate. The pork was hot and the top was deliciously crispy. It comes with steamed rice and chinese broccoli, which were both dressed with pan drippings, so tasty. My boyfriend had the wonton noodle soup. It is a huge bowl, pho sized. The broth was light. There were plenty of wontons and noodles and the flavors were just right. I can't wait to go back and try some of the other items on the menu!

vSbk7EN7KEOLwndAyS2E8A.text: Another Yelp find. This restaurant is definitely authentic in Chinese cooking. Not a pretty place, but definitely a place to have food that is excellent. The service was great and our server Kassan was a joy. She Mande great recommendations. We had the BBQ plate with 3 meats, order of wide noodles with pork and a shrimp dish. This a fun place to eat

5F3W1sgFT9-3R0Dx6igg1A.text: Every time I make a trip to Vegas, which is about four times a year, this place is a must stop for the roast pork and roast duck.  The roast pork is probably the best I have ever had... and I grew up in NYC's Chinatown area and now reside in the San Gabriel Valley area of SoCal... tons of Asian restaurants... I only get the BBQ stuff and only get it to go. So can't say too much about their other items on the menu or for their dine in service.    The waiter and waitress I have dealt with have always been nice, and I always seek out one of those two to place my to go order with.  The couple times when I had my disabled son with me, the waitress told me to just go wait in the car and she would bring it out to me. Which was really nice of her....so I can't complain. The cashier lady, I was told is not the nicest ...she does seem very standoff-ish... but I only pay her and that is it.  My gut feeling is that she is one of the owners of the restaurant.... the wife. My five star rating is based solely on the BBQ food and it is very good, at least for the roast pork and duck.

QqoM5yJeUgYbPn2cVctASQ.text: One of the very few good chinese BBQ places left in vegas. If anything, in my opinion, its the best in Vegas.   First of all..... CASH ONLY ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! Make sure you have cash, otherwise no yummy food for you ! Applies for entire restaurant, not only the BBQ. Wells Fargo, Chase, and Bank of America are down the street, less than 1/4 mi away.  Ok now that's over. This is a nice little place, in the opposite corner (NE) of the same center as Q Karaoke, HK Star, Cue D's, and China Mama. Quite busy during lunch and dinner hours and they close early.   They have a variety of foods, that you would normally find in a traditional chinese BBQ place. Noodles, rice plates, fried rice, veggies, etc. Some of their popular dishes would be the "Noodle Soups" with a variety of noodles and toppings or the traditional wonton () or shui jiao () dumpling.   One different thing about this place, that sets it apart from the rest, is their "Cart Noodle" (). Originated in Hong Kong, it was originally sold on carts. Noodles were freshly cooked to order, with your pick of toppings ranging from pig feet, pig skin, pig stomach, pig intestines, pig blood, etc (continuing on to beef and chicken parts as well).   This place, gives you a choice of a variety of noodles, and your pick of either 1, 2 or 3 toppings. My favorite combination is Thin Egg Noodles with Pig Intestine, Mix Beef, and Pig Feet.   The noodles will be cooked to a chinese style of al dente (when its done right...) It should NOT be too soft, but not undercooked hard. It should give a nice bite.   Another popular item would be their "BBQ on Rice" ranging from Roasted Pork on Rice, BBQ Pork on Rice, Roast Duck on Rice, Combination of Two on Rice. As you can see, they have fresh roasted items avail, hanging and cut to order.   Their Roast Pork is one of my favorites. Priced at a little less than $11/lb for a to-go order (price is different if eaten there), but its a good deal. This is one of the few places in town, that prepare only the belly, vs the entire pig. No bones. All same sizes. Better bang for the buck, right? Crispy bubbled pig skin, wonderfully seasoned, nice proportioned meat to fat ratio, cut to bite sized pieces. Good to snack on (yes ive bought this as a snack) or eaten with your meal !   The guys who cut the items are actually fairly accurate. If you want 1 lb, they will be fairly close on it.   Their roast duck is also a good item to order. Crispy skin, meaty and flavored nicely. Good combination to be eaten with rice or noodles. Can be ordered to-go in half or whole duck.   If none of the above appeals to you, their fried rice and noodles are nicely done as well ! Good "wok hei" as what chinese would call it. Its like an extra flavor that appears when you use a high flame and a wok to cook things. Almost imagine it as, maybe a smokey flavor?   Great place for a quick bite to eat or with a few people, or even to go and bring home for dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Pork
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig Intestine, Mixed Beef, and Pig Feet Thin Noodles

sFhJMBfJMy99oWJcTNs0RQ.text: Growing up, my dad had a side job at a meat shop in Chinatown and I was spoiled with the slight burnt, sticky sweet ends of char siu whenever I stopped by as my mom did her grocery shopping. My favorite was when my dad would bring home roast duck though. Just thinking about it makes my mouth water..so succulent and meaty, dipped in a sweet soy sauce that I would drizzle over my rice. I've had authentic Peking duck from Beijing as well, and although delicious, it doesn't trump Cantonese roast duck for me.  We got a half order ($13.99) of roast duck, and I felt like there were more pieces with just skin and fat than there were meaty pieces. It was sitting in a pool of its oily juices, which they could have done a better job draining. The plum sauce (I think?) was thick and I preferred the sweet soy sauce variety. Overall, it satisfied my craving for roast duck, but it doesn't even come close to my dad's. We also got a side order of choy sum and gai lan with oyster sauce ($4.25 each), not knowing that our beef chow fun with gravy ($11.99) would come with a lot of bok choy. Gai lan stalks were still crunchy.  Main reason for the 2 stars is the service. My friend's boyfriend politely asked one of the guys what the difference (implying portion-wise) was between $7.99 roast duck and the half order of it. "One is more expensive, $13.99, one is cheaper $7.99, so more expensive one has more. So simple!" The way he said "so simple" screamed "are you stupid?" and I immediately felt bad as I was the one who dragged them here..especially when the same guy explained something nicely to another Chinese lady right after. I know FOB Chinese people are usually very blunt, but he could've handled it soooo much better. Plus you have to flag them down for everything, and no one refilled our teapot even though we left it open on the edge of our table.  Prices (CASH ONLY) and food are just average. The rude service on top of that? No thanks.

2cQK78CEbczTMApQ2OwVqA.text: Off the bat, the place was packed with Asians. If you visit a restaurant that is filled with the culture it represents, it speaks a world of wonders! Simply put, the food is going to be as good as it is well received.   For the past 4 years, Yogi and Booboo have made a Christmas tradition of feasting on some duck; roasted, pecking or in a soup. We bid twenty seventeen goodbye with the roasted duck served over this divine sauce that yielded a moist, tender, roast duck. The skin was crispy which is always a plus but the honorable mention is the sauce. It is savory, aromatic, and full of flavor. I love how they provide you with hot tea after you are seated and it is a bottomless serving. My partner in crime gives our meal 4.5 quacks and a tea plus (justincredible).   For every good honorable mention there is also a MEH! We also ordered wonton soup over noodles, it needed more flavor but I respected the dish all the same by finishing it. I will give it another go the next visit maybe it will taste better.   The service is speedy quick and pleasant. I hope to have the same experience every visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Duck

s7S5XdzFMSne2m2B0_89zA.text: I. Absolutely. Love. This. Place. Whenever my family and I go to Vegas for a mini-vacation, we ALWAYS, always come here to eat at least once for dinner.   This place offers a truly authentic experience, both with food and atmosphere.   The restaurant itself is on the smaller side, the floors are a little sticky, people are densely packed at their tables during dinner hours. There's always a long line of people waiting to get in, with some standing right next to the tables of guests who are eating! Keep in mind, this place is also cash only. But that's how you know the food is going to be some good stuff.   The waiters who take your order are quick and to-the-point, which is understandable considering how busy they are during dinnertime. Admittedly, it is a little difficult to get their attention after you've placed in your initial orders, as they are rushing around to get everyone's orders out.   The food is delicious. I don't know how else to word it to be honest. I always get the soy sauce pig ear as an appetizer, as something flavorful to crunch on before the entrees and rice are brought out. The roast pork belly is tender, with skin crisped to perfection. My favorite dish is the pig intestine, which is flavorful and juicy, with the ideal level of chewiness.   The pricing is pretty decent for the portion size you get, though I have noticed an increase in pricing over the years.  Overall, I would highly recommend this place for those who are focused more on a good, homely meal, rather than a fine-dining experience.

7cFYPEWj8lITps4A5EUYag.text: Wow, the food here is absolutely amazing.  I always come here every time I'm in Vegas.  I've tried their roast duck, pork belly, duck wanton egg noodle soup, Chinese broccoli, spicy chicken feet, spicy pig ears, char siu, and house fried rice.   The duck is absolutely amazing.  I'm going to step out there and say that it's the best duck I have ever had and I love duck.  The meat is moist and tender, the skin is perfectly cooked and the flavor is very balanced.  The ratio of crispy skin and fatty meat of the pork belly is to die for.  The char siu is so savory and tender.  Definitely get the three meat combo, you won't regret it.  The price is very fair so there's no reason not to try it.  On my last trip, I brought back a whole duck because I couldn't get enough (carry-on back to Raleigh lol).    - The Grasshopper

i4DgsSFOkAcO2Urc1UrlQQ.text: Authentic and delicious. We were so happy with the execution - crispy roast pork, sumptuous soup dumplings, tasty Hainan chicken. Nothing was too salty or too oily; everything was just great. Will definitely come back every time we're in Vegas.

JyDBLWbsU66r9_XszhmxMw.text: It was all so good! Where do I start!   So this little place was little....  What I got Chinese sausage and salt fish fried rice - it was good. A little bit too dark for me (too much dark soy). Sausage pieces were a little bit too tiny...  Seafood pan fried noodle - was good. Good amount of seafood variety. And the noodles were crispy and nicely pan fried 3 plate combo (double duck and bbq pork) - duck was on the salty end for me. The bbq pork was good! I wish it was a bit warmer 2 plate combo bbq (pork and bbq ribs) - WE GOT A SECOND PLATE CAUSE THEY HAD ROAST PORK! We thought the pork was done for the day but they brought out some so we HAD to get it! And it was worth it. Not too fatty and not too lean. Almost like a 5 layer... ha. Wish it was a bit more warmer.  Garlic veggies - was good. Always love me more veggies!   Environment This place was small! Like it gets busy! It's on a strip plaza, parking can be crazy during busy hours which is around 6-8p, that's when we went at least.   Niceness  It may be the busy-ness that they didn't have time to entertain new comers..... there is menu but really they don't have time to entertain questions. You just have to know what you want. Once you have that down, they are great!   Dollar $ Relatively cheap compared to Orlando at least. OH AND IT IS CASH ONLY PLEASE  Yes? Yea I would definitely go again! Would try the noodles! Seems like it's a street side cart style noodle place where you can pick and chose! Should be interesting!   #WendyTakesVegas #WendyWanders #ALittleLate

xjl0sAWunBgyFziMkWPN8Q.text: Don'ts: -DON'T go with party bigger than 4 people if you're not willing to wait. -DON'T expect great customer service. -DON'T order fried rice if you're not willing to wait for 30 minutes.  GO HERE FOR THE GOOD BECAUSE IT'S REALLY DELICIOUS. I highly recommend duck over rice.

PlquhfaXj0_b1xZ9s9kmLg.text: I had ordered pick up catering for my 2 yrs son's birthday. 1 order garlic gai lan(chinese greens), 1 seafood vegetable, 1 chicken chow fun, 1 roast duck. 3 trays/1duck = $200.00 I asked why is the garlic gai lan $50? Why I was  over charged? The cashier/manager ignored me, pretending to not understand English. But yet she knew how to speak English when she gave me my total.  I found a Vietnamese waitress, I asked her in Vietnamese why am I being over charged. She said a tray of gai lan is $50 and seafood/vegetables is $75 because seafood is expensive. It was not much seafood, they stuffed it with a whole brunch of bean sprouts and more gai lan(chinese greens) and sprinkle seafood on top.  After getting nothing resolved, I paid for my orders. I will not come back this place again. Very rude & horrible customer service. This is not how you keep customers from coming back. My chinese friends told me $200 was way too much for 3 tray of food and 1 duck.

WyJDMDE8pyDlo-GoD0C7Ew.text: This place reminds me of Cali and NY Chinese food.. I travel so much that I eat everywhere.. just decided to start reviewing sum of the spots I have visited many times around. This is more a Togo spot.. Foods good..   Must try!

zBFnOI29GDPD4wa30GKrGQ.text: After dining here for the third time, I can confirm that I like going here for cheap and delicious bbq meat and rice plates.   Pros  Roast Meats: I've only had their roasted duck, barbecue pork, and their crispy roasted pork and I l always find myself ordering the same items because it's that good. The meats are tender and juicy and there's so much salty or sweet flavors going on that you didn't even need the dipping sauces which they include in all rice plates. If you get the rice plates which is a great deal, they'll pour some meat juices on top of your rice with a side of bok choy. I've had my fair share of Asian barbecued meats but there was something magical about their meats that keeps me coming back.   Price: I'm still amazed after all these years with how inexpensive and delicious the rice plates are. There's actually a lengthy number of items to choose from which is great for family style dining but the bbq meats and rice plates are a hit here. Of course prices have increased throughout the years but still a satisfying option while staying on a budget. You'll notice locals, tourist, families, couples, and a bunch of people all dressed up for partying dining here under one roof.   Service: I've never had issues in all the times I've ordered from here. Not as personal but they get the job done and communication is easy with them. They also come by frequently to get your drinks refilled.   Cons  Wonton Noodles: While their wontons noodles are another popular item of choice, I thought it was bland compared to their savory barbecued meats. Shrimp wontons are good but you need some type of condiment for more flavor and the noodles and broth are just okay. However it's still cheap for the price and if you need something warm, order it to share and they'll bring you small bowls if you ask.

bC1ugttYgjbd4nuJw2ooTA.text: We came Dec. 26th around 4pm. There was a line but not a long one.  It didn't take long for us to be seated but it did take a while for the servers to take our order and serve.  There were plenty of servers but they seemed to be avoiding us.  They were busy cleaning tables.  There seemed to be only one guy seating people and taking orders.  Maybe because the others didn't speak English???  Service during this visit wasn't good.  They even made a mistake with our bill. The only redeeming factor was that the pork barbeque and pork belly we ordered was really good.

wCHgxznmwYPAZ6bxnvrbYQ.text: Food is so good, I keep going back, every single time I'm in Vegas  What I ate: - BBQ Pork: Super tender and tasty - BBQ crispy pork belly: That crispy skin! OMG, so good - BBQ roast duck: Really great! Crispy skin, fatty, juicy meat.  - Wonton noodle soup: This is always a great standard if you're craving noodle soup. The broth is light - Seafood chow mein: This is not your typical chow mein from your local chinese joint. The seafood is all super fresh, tender, not overcooked. I'm usually not a fan of squid in most seafood dishes because they tend to overcook it and make it rubbery. But this place knows what it's doing. Everything is cooked to perfection and the skinny chow mein is great - Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce: Get some green in you! Cooked to perfection   Pros: - All the food I've had here has been cooked to perfection. Like superb each and every time. That type of consistency just can't be beat! This is why I keep coming back! - Price is right. I think on average it's about $15/person? Maybe $20 if you get greedy.  - Service is actually really good for an Asian restaurant. Everyone is friendly - Food comes out fairly quickly  Cons: - That wait! Coming at peak times can mean a wait, so be prepared. My friends came in for a really late lunch at 3pm on a Sunday, and that's been the only time there was absolutely no wait. If the wait is too long, just order to go! - Fairly small. Nearly all the tables are 4tops. A few 2tops, and a few tables could be squished together to make 6tops. So try not to bring your nine foodie friends - What kind of restaurant stay closed on Fridays?! Apparently this place is just doing so well they don't need to. So, just be aware of their business hours  Would I come again? YES!

bV2HNROjO0t75fuaghVcYg.text: Came here for the roasted pork, and price is about $14 per pound. So I got 2 lbs to bring home. Was excited to try this; nonetheless, this dish is somewhat underwhelming & salty (and I love salty food) compared to the Asian BBQ joints in Cali (comparing since they post every where the place is one of the top ones in Vegas?)   Also, when I went to pay I noticed they didn't include sweet/sour sauce in the bag so I asked for it. The lady cashier puts in one reluctantly, and I'm thinking one is not enough for 2 lbs. So I asked for another to which she  said "one dollar" and I thought, really? The container is half full and it's cheap like ketchup. So service sucks but the 2nd star is for the girl who speaks English who was very helpful and nice, at least. They only take cash.

mvllMiGhn9GsRRFlp3a96w.text: Foods are good ! Service is fairly acceptable  But this place is a little inconvenient because they won't take credit cards . Cash only  at this restaurant ! That's the reason I can't give it better than 4 stars

Friends and I ordered half roast duck again the next day. This is my go to place when I want roast duck in the restaurant and even take out.

xGgBJjOLne3jJvUVvGTOfQ.text: BEST chinese food in town.  This was the only place that can cook Chow fun without breaking it into a million pieces.  The wonton is delicious!  As the BBQ pork it's one of the best places to get it in town.  I've ever eaten a piece that wasn't crunchy.  I've gotten food for 6 dollars here before!  Great price and great food = me coming by once a week. I you're not chinese (which I am not) the place can seem a little intimidating but it's totally worth it for the food.  Also, they don't accept cards so bring cash.

s4UsH-iyJ_X60wCG02Cpzg.text: Very good taste, inexpensive. This place is packed since it opens. The noodle is very authentic. BBQ duck is a must try. Ended up dinning here most of my stay in Las Vegas.

I called and complained, but, all of a sudden they couldn't understand me. I can't believe I drove 17 miles for this.

thQj74dEhwGBj1fQFZDY3Q.text: The roasted duck soup is the real thing! I used to get the same dish in  Hong Kong during the early 1990s' while on business trips. The manager, Tony, was delighted to find out that his place has received  so many great reviews on this website. I told him, I shall add my own. Voila, here it is!

0ltSD40mLA6RxqNq-BkfeQ.text: Great place for chinese BBQ noodles and rice plates.  Place is busy each time I go there.  Avg prices around $5-$6.

Umwz7sW2mWjX7tsy9Agpxg.text: Let me preface by saying that I am not Chinese or from Hong Kong.  I have however grown up in So Cal eating lots of Chinese food.  This place looked like it had a lot of promise and was packed with locals.  We had the mixed BBQ plate, BBQ pork with crispy noodles and wonton soup.  Everything was solid except for the soup which is what I was looking forward to most, given the reviews.  The wontons were good, but the broth was a little off.  Maybe that is the way it should taste and I've just grown up on Americanized flavors.  Either way, tasty but a bit of a let down.  Good value though.

ckaj_8AtM9R2Lkm6W4hdDw.text: Everything I had here was very good - Roast Duck and Shrimp Dumpling Soup, Fried Rice, Roast Pork Belly.  All of the staff, from the waiter to the counter staff to the cooks and butchers were very friendly and aimed to please.  Very clean.  Cash only.

oYrJjJPLW42kb5PeuZBA5Q.text: worst costumer experience ever! besides the food being delicious, the costumer service was unbelievable. our waitress was very rude since me and my two friends got here, it was two hispanic and one black person. She sat us in the back, was very rude taking our order, did not offer us any drinks and never asked if we needed anything else, just brought the bill and left. It's very sad they treat their non asian clientelle in such a fashion .Never felt so discriminated in my life, the food was good but not enough to feel unwelcomed here.

RuPluTG4WVFA1WljcZPGkA.text: I love this place! My favorite is the duck with white rice. Not at all healthy, but if I go here I simply do not care. The place is CASH only so be warned! 15No_NZfnBWOuwUFKOyn8g.text: The pork belly, roast duck and barbecue pork were absolutely amazing. Combination fried rice and wonton noodle soup were also incredible. Service was amazingly fast, but cash only!

i3NxtgAmiFZ7U-9sckNn_A.text: This place is a scam. Do not ever come here. Food wasn't good anyways.  Since it's Chinese New Year, they decided to charge their customers 18% tips without specifying on the bill.  How shady is that? I understand if they wanted to charge their customers premium on a Chinese holiday. However, you have to TELL people!!!!!! I am sure I am not the only victim here. So I ended up paying 30% tips for bad services.  On top of it, they didn't think it's their fault and blamed on me. I had to literally confront them to get a "sorry" from them (but whoever talked to me wasn't sorry at all). Btw, they don't keep records of their business since I asked them to check their records. My guess is this shady Chinese restaurant who probably invades taxes big time with no business records. Hope you get audited soon!!!!!

uTIHLP65mbiewvqmQugFiQ.text: This Chinese restaurant lives up to its name. Although the interior was slightly small and squished, the food was overall superb. My family ordered the beef chow fun, and HOLY MOLY. It's the best chow fun I've ever eaten. The sauce wasn't too oily and it wasn't overdone with MSG.  If you become indecisive about which of the many dishes to order, give the chow fun a try!!!!

owKLlyg3wgurI2VH7AHenQ.text: 5/5 Food! Ive had the roasted duck, wonton soup, roasted pork bbq, roasted duck and wonton soup. All were awesome and so so tasty! TB_AunMl_-3I_lj726mvmQ.text: Coming here twice in the last week just for their pork must make it 5 stars!  I took Janel's advice in her review and went with the double order of the pork for the BBQ combo the second time around.  The crispy juiciness of the meat mixed with the fat was phenomenal.  I've neglected Chinese spots with hanging meat for too long.  I used to eat this stuff at least once a week.      The duck is also tasty but I recommend asking for a breast cut.  Some pieces of the thigh were straight up skin and fat.  While some people appreciate it, I am not one of them.  I also had their chicken chow fun which is something I'll certainly order again.    The service is also pretty friendly compared to most Chinese places around but it's all about the pork!

pGcG51tw6V9V3m0ph5QTtQ.text: First off, CASH ONLY (what a shame) so be cash-prepared. They're very well known, it seems, and they're also usually quite busy, especially for dinner time. On my third visit, I came during dinner and it was busy enough that I had a horrible experience with their service. Took like 3-4 tries to finally order something because they didn't have what we want but she didn't make that clear the FIRST time just exactly what was all out.  Aside from the mediocre service (it's one of those where it doesn't really matter too much, I guess), the food is excellent! I simply adore the crispy roasted pork. Yummy crispy-ness.  Definitely give the food a try -- lots of yummy BBQ food! They've got a variety of combos to try out but they do run out of their BBQ stuff, so watch out.

SdyorX5uxt8qk5b1RJGi6w.text: When I first entered the restaurant I thought, "Wow great another one of those small, cluttered restaurants." Personally small, cluttered restaurants (spaces in general) are not my thing, so I was a little skeptical. They first put my family of 5 at at a small table that originally fit 4 people, but one wait or eventually moved us.  Service was decent, and actually not so bad. I was happy to see that one of the waiters laughed at a joke my sister cracked (which wasn't funny at all in my opinion) demonstrating that they're not actually bad waiters. One of our other waiters was very confused, and gave us ice instead of rice. Even though she was very confused, she still was very patient with our family.   The reason I gave the restaurant a five because the food was DELICIOUS! I'm not a fan of Chinese food because of the abundant amount of MSG/oil; however, this place was absolutely my favorite Chinese food restaurant. We ordered the roasted pork with rice, congee, mi xao don, and seafood chow foon.   If you're looking for good Chinese food, and don't mind the small, cluttered space than I highly recommend this place! It definitely owns up to its title of being 8th out of 100 Chinese food restaurants in the USA!   CASH ONLY!

The food was ordered and turned around super fast too. Each dish ordered was delicious. Roast duck, roast pork belly, curry noodles, beef chow fun, porridge, beef stew, house pan fried noodles.

rVI_4ofTgTercFj-RGH0TQ.text: Been here a couple times and I've quickly learned that their BBQ meats are the only thing worth getting. Don't get me wrong, their BBQ is probably the best I've had in town, but the other items on their menu? Not so good and I would not get it again.  First thing you'll notice when you walk in are the BBQ meats hanging from the window by the back counter. Their roast pork belly with the crispy skin is to die for and their BBQ pork is really good as well. I haven't tried the chicken or duck so can't comment on it but from the looks of everything hanging in the window, it looks pretty damn delicious. You can order meats as an order or rice plate combo. If ordering to go, everything is by weight.  The other items are another story. I've tried the congee, BBQ pork chow fun, Chinese broccoli and a combo soup noodle w/ pig feet and curry beef tendon. The congee was meh, so-so; I've definitely had better at dim sum places. The BBQ pork chow fun was the only thing good out of this group and probably only because it had BBQ pork. The Chinese broccoli was all stems and very little leafy parts which was disappointing and the soup noodle was terrible because the noodles were clumped together which made it difficult to eat.  Because this is a traditional Chinese style restaurant, service is not very good and it'll take a while to get someone's attention even though they have many employees roaming the restaurant at any given time. Also, don't bother speaking to them in Mandarin because their English is definitely a lot better than their Mandarin...they'll just look at you like they understand and then they'll disappear and you'll never get what you asked for. We spoke to 3 different waiters in Mandarin trying to get our check and to go boxes and 1 by 1 they disappeared and were never seen again. After waiting 10 min and speaking with 3 waiters, we ended up going up to one of the ladies and speaking to her in English and magically we got what we wanted. If they didn't understand us then why wouldn't they just say so? How rude! Definitely 1 star for service based on my most recent visit! But their BBQ is good and I'll continue coming back just for that, but not anything else though

erL05JxhhgtOm2RuwgYrNg.text: Im a won ton soup connoisseur....I give this place a 9/10. Their Won ton soup is very authentic and came out extremely quick. Water tasted good so I knew the food would be too. Although the soup was so good I'd hate to say anything negative but I do wish flies didn't interrupt my meal every five seconds. (Simple fly paper should do the trick).  A little too close of a dining space but the food made it manageable. I really hope this places delivery is just as satisfactory because I would love order takeout regularly. Definitely recommend.

LXwR3gQxRcxTnOHoAziM2A.text: We saw their ad in a newspaper. We decided to give it a try while visiting Las Vegas. First the parking situation is a challenge and awful. We drove to the shopping center next door which has ample parking spaces. It is just a 2 minute walk.  We were seated right away because it was still early, 7 pm. We ordered roast pork and duck combo with rice, choi sum with oyster sauce, and sizzling beef with tomatoes on fried noodles.  The roast pork was a bit dry but the duck is crisp and tender. The choi sum was soft and plenty for a $4.25 plate. The sizzling beef on fried noodles was not disappointing. The sauce was the the right amount not to make the fried noodles soggy.   As usual we did not expect good and attentive service. The servers were doing just an adequate job of taking the order, bringing the tea (instead of water as we ordered) and dishes, and giving us the bill at the end. So, 4-star is awarded.

h3E1xxmBYlldso4pkKfw_g.text: The only place I come to get the roast pork belly. It's so good and not fatty like some places. It's always busy here and they only take cash. But it's always worth the drive for my cravings.

7T9WqHUysJnG5v6Qm3OIwA.text: Amazing flavors. The egg yolk noodle wonton soup is piping hot, with a generous garnish of tender gailan stalks. The won tons in the soup, so flavorful and hearty. And the broth has a deep savory essence which warms the soul. Side dish of BBQ pork and duck were the perfect accompaniment to our lunch. Unnecessary because the soup (at 6.99!) was completely satisfying and generous, but who can resist the BBQ!  Those who kvetch about the service, I guess I don't need to be catered to quite as much. Our server was friendly and efficient, the order was correct, dirty plates cleared promptly. No further lording over required.  Enjoy this place and remember CASH ONLY CASH ONLY and CASH ONLY. (My only annoyance here, in this cashless age!)

yDrOCqBE93-4qSUr3e4jOw.text: Authentic!  Yummy!  Delicious!  I have wanted to try Asian BBQ for years ... however, my wife's favorite ramen place is right next door - Ramen Tatsu ... and we usually end up there.  However, this time we wanted something different (and cheap). We were shopping across the street at Jones Market and said let's try it.    We get the ultimate parking space - right against the front door.  Good start.  Then the scary words on the door ... CASH ONLY ... say what?!?!!?   Yep, CASH ONLY!  My wife and I dig through our wallets and find a $20 bill ... OK, we will see what we can share.  2 item combo with rice (BBQ pork and duck) - side of Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. 2 free soups.  Out the door for $14.51 -  after tip - $18.00.  Took the $2 chance and went back to Jones Market for some Eastern European ice cream.   Good value - friendly service.   Ignore the sign that the bathroom is out of order - it works fine.

We ordered the bbq combo plate $11 and the quantity is pretty small (looks big in pictures).  Their rice was not cooked soft enough. Pretty disappointing steamed rice for it being an Asian restaurant; I mean c'mon guys, it's rice!  They take cash only. Pork belly is served room temperature, which is not ok in my book. The duck was warm, flavorful, and crispy. The bbq ribs were mostly bones and crispy, no meat on the bones and it was over cooked.  Mediocre customer service and below average food.  Probably would not come here again.

opHxt7ci2vfzB2uHegfexw.text: Just as a heads up THE DUCK IS PREPARED WITH PEANUT BUTTER. Granted it was good, my throat and tongue started to feel itchy. I've never had Chinese duck that's made me allergic before so I didn't expect it and I was surprised when the waiter confirmed it. It's unfortunate, but he didn't say sorry and was kind of being a jerk about it. More like I was being reprimanded for not asking first. I just paid and left. There is no allergy info for anything on the menu, so just be careful. Lucky for me my peanut allergy isn't that severe, but for others it might be.

tq-x8SPNt-sRBOGlXOBS8Q.text: This place is awesome! I came here for lunch on Wednesday . This place is SUPER PACKED! I have to wait around 15 minutes. That's totally worth! I order the combination BBQ rice with crispy pork belly and roasted duck. It comes with side white rice and soup. The roasted duck is EXTREMELY CRISY! The sauce come on side is very good too. I can tell the way they made the food is very TRADITIONAL and just hit the point. Their roasted duct run out very fast.! When I just sit down they still have couples. But by the time I finished they all gone. During lunch hour they were very busy but the staff were very friendly and organized. Definitely will come back when I come to Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck and crispy pork belly rice. Yummy!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck and crispy pork belly rice. Yummy!

QhPiNDlqbz-3df2M3amedg.text: Almost every time I am in the Vegas area, I will stop by here to eat. Certain food choices are pretty good. Some of their soups are a little bland but it is still decent. The thing that really wins me over is their fried breadsticks. It is always fresh and hot when they are served. Only problem is that they are not always available. It is always a hit or miss and lately it has been a miss. Also, the restaurant is pretty small and usually busy so it is always overcrowded. There is usually a wait before being seated as well. If you are in the area, I do recommending coming here and trying their authentic Asian food.

VgFORVFzx1-oHOszfwJfLA.text: The absolute best place for roast pork (pork belly), bbq pork (char siu), and soy sauce chicken. The duck is very good but a little more on the lean side which is what most people prefer. I prefer them on the fattier side but the flavor is great.   The wontons are also very good. They have different noodle options so you can order it traditional with egg noodle but can change it to udon or flat rice noodle if you want a change.   My usual order is a 3 bbq platter and a wonton soup.  Service is good for how busy they are but don't expect Michelin star service. This is a great local spot I've been going to for close to a decade now. Hopefully they never change how they do things.

RAAYXPQb-CiSy2U6xKdBng.text: We ordered a Roasted pork & BBQ pork rice plate and roasted duck with wonton noodle soup. My favorite is the roasted pork very crispy. I didn't care much for the broth in the noodle soup. Not the clear broth I'm used to in Hong Kong Style wonton soup. The wonton itself was very good. The roasted duck was very good but not much meat. Cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pork and BBQ pork rice plate
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Duck Wonton Noodle Soup

_2hO_1l3Mq4oZ9WhE8Dj5A.text: This place has amazing food at amazing prices and surprisingly great customer service...lol...I say that only because good service isn't really expected at these small places. But everything was so good here.  It was a. Recommendation of a friend so we caught an Uber fro our hotel to check it out.  We were all so happy with everything that we went back 2 more times this trip.    Cash only...so don't be caught off guard =)

zk04i8c5jB3x6uyHjf6Qtg.text: Best pork belly ever!! Not over salted, skin extra crispy. Place is a bit small, but for a party of 15 that wasn't a problem. food is spot on!! If your looking for authentic Chinese come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lUcSng36uKdQqcAelYEeQg.text: I really mean it when I say service is horrendous.   I try my best to avoid this place until I absolutely crave good quality Chinese food. This place has the best Chinese noodles and Roast Duck, but it's just not worth it with such poor service.  I hate leaving a restaurant grumpy and annoyed and this place does that to me every time because staff is just so rude.

T5phpcuMXzgEj-aigfoDQA.text: The service is quick and the flavor is great. It definitely has a feel similar to Maxim Cafe if you're familiar with it in Hong Kong. My only gripe is that the venue is small and if you have to wait, there's no sitting area. You sometimes have to stand awkwardly for a table at the front of the restaurant while other patrons are eating around you.

xi_4YkFbyeZCkMZePOfYzw.text: We found this restaurant from Yelp. Mmm.. So yummy and authentic. We actually felt like we were in Hong Kong. All the dishes we ordered were great, but I especially like the roated pork and BBQ pork. Milk tea is great too.  When we are tired of the buffet from Vegas, this is the place we go. For good food and great price!

h8GOW2fmAlBgo_3Fx4p-_w.text: you can find all your favorite HK BBQ items here - roast duck, roast pork, BBQ pork, dumplings, noodles, porridge, etc.     +super clean  +roast duck dumpling noodle soup +beef chow fun (dry)

EobpezmEkmNPNV-03zMZfQ.text: Mmmmm.... this place is pretty awesome. Its a really small resturant with a very nice staff. I came here with my hubby and 3 year old daughter. We got the sampler pork belly, duck and...uhh something else delicious I forgot. My daughter ate everything I love introducing her to new cusine. The only complaint I have it that the duck was a little cold. But other than that I will be returing for sure. p.s dont waste precious tummy space with  anything but delicious mammal flesh.

wGafyy_nhyZyzg8CO__-Cw.text: Love this place service is great food is yummy! Will b back again when I visit Vegas next time.

s4Fm9lr-hzZ57IgQi26aIg.text: Such a nice surprise, Hong Kong style BBQ at its best. The duck was tasty, the roast pork was crispy and delicious. Very nice servers, which is a huge surprise for these types of restaurant. If you like Sam Woo, this is better plus nice friendly servers.

7Vz4GWsO833Km3Y_Igflsw.text: I came here with a friend, lured by beautiful pics of glistening duck skin and great reviews. I've had many impeccable meals in LV Chinatown. This wasn't one of them.   Tea: great selection and quality.   Friend ordered combo (repeat COMBO) BBQ stir-fry: unlike this dish in china, it had no meat and no BBQ.  My order: duck plate, likely cut by a blind butcher... Lots of spitting and cursing. They were cheaply cut like inverted and twisted pork ribs-from a professional wrestler named wilbur-but had great flavor. Too much rice.  Our side of oyster sauce veggies was fantastic and there were many awesome soup options. Maybe I was too American in my selection?... I might be back to try soup and pork-something. Maybe I'll try the half-duck they offer, b/c I enjoy pain.  Service was fantastic!

vdc0S3707kLvAO7iAhbp2w.text: This place is so yummy! I love their shrimp dumplings, bbq pork w/ egg noodle soup and the crispy bread sticks. But pretty much everything looks delicious. They're always busy here(that's always a good sign). The service has always been pleasant, and the prices are very reasonable.

rSJsPiG4aTcyPUrSoSL-oA.text: not bad for chinese food around las vegas area...i think there is a lot of MSG in their food but i dont care it still taste good..i like their roast pork...the chicken rice was good too with the sauce..  CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

jIaD2998DxvS-OIwth6Kpg.text: The roasted duck soup is delicious and only $5.50 a bowl. Swimming in the delicate broth are fresh shrimp wontons, Chinese broccoli and egg noodles Which makes a perfect treat after a day of snowboarding! All items on their menu has an attractive price that will leave your wallet full!   It's a cash only and tiny hidden gem that reminds me of most places in Hong Kong which is now my new home away from the office at noon Or evenings like this after shredding down the mountains...as mentioned above!

j99pquABq705VfVSWIn5_Q.text: Love their roasted pork. their roast duck is nice and juicy...im not a duck girl but it was flavorful. their fish balls with curry... OMG goodness. by far  my Favorite chinese food place to go.

Cf979Vbgr_EY0r_Ih1UUOA.text: Extremely clean and pleasant for a fast food chinese spot.   The star here is obviously the BBQ.  They have a bunch of noodle soups and stir-fry noodles.  I like getting the side dishes in the cart next to the BBQ (stewed pig ear, pork blood, tripe)  All yummy stuff....The orders are small and only 2-3 bucks so give it a try.    The tripe and stewed pig ear is a fraction the cost of China Mama and definitely gives it a run.  If only I could sneak in the fresh noodles from Noodle Palace, this place would be a 5.  Still, it's a great cheap spot that has good food and looks nice.

tKkbhEsr53o3qamFlBbmMw.text: Very tasty n crispy roast pork.  Good prices n good services.    Plan to go again tomorrow! :D

C2r__0E_xvq0pADVgyNz2g.text: Best wonton noodle soup in Vegas! And for the price of well, everything!, is amazing! Their side pork wasn't too fatty and it was still very crispy despite the fact that we showed up 30 mins before they closed.  We didn't realize they only accepted cash, so one had to leave and find the nearest ATM. I can't wait to go back!

XO4OVEovdGpWqQao8nVovA.text: This is by far the most authentic hong kong style noodle place in Las Vegas . The restaurant is medium size but there are many helpers, hence your orders are taken immediately. We tried the char siew noodles, duck rice, friend noodles, green vegetables and they are absolutely of High standard and quality.. the char siew noodle soup has very delicious soup base and the char siew is tender and yummy! the fried char idea noodle is filled. With crunchy bean sprouts and the noodles are just right..chewy and  simply delicious. the portions are in my opinion very generous . I highly recommend  this place as a must for Hong Kong style noodles!

Wx4AI_2-FW3rAGEQml4dKw.text: duck and pig ear taste authentic and delicious! Fast service and friendly people. What else do u need?

2HIyEfjPqnT6RXn3r-6Xnw.text: Great little place for quick lunch with excellent authentic Cantonese style food.  Excellent roast duck and other bbq items.  Be prepare for longer wait for big party of 5 or more. Otherwise, a hidden gem!!!

C9xZ5rL9q3ehhSW_Bx-Bbg.text: For those of you in the know, PHO is usually my choice the morning after a rough night...Still, w/ PHO having become so mainstream, I'm having a hard time dealing with all the PHO restaurant waiters and waitresses who are now too good for the morning eaters...haha, jk!  In all honesty though...I can't get enough of the rich, warm broth from Asian BBQ & Noodles Roast Duck and Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup. In a lunchtime world filled with burgers, fries and any other quintessential American Grease bombs, Asian BBQ and Noodles offer some ethnic fare that blows away the lunchtime competition off Spring Mountain.  Word to the wise...Cash only and be sure to speak English slowly! Other than that, you're golden like the crispy skin of a perfectly roasted Beijing Duck!

i0ydwyrZvgXwA2MA2M1A9w.text: Small restaurant tucked in a corner of a strip. A great place for wonton soup. Roasted pork belly is a must try.

MXxmug0Jpwsz63VcS9bRIg.text: Thanks yelpers for the reviews. Spot on and this place was awesome. Get here early, there can be a huge wait. Food was awesome and for a typical Chinese BBQ place they comparatively have great service and can even explain parts of menu to you in English even though I speak Cantonese. Folks for frequent places in Chinatowns know what I am referring to. Coming back for sure

9v6uHZDntd-DdyOrBfAJVQ.text: The food is delicious, however the restaurant doesn't look as clean as I'd like it to. Employees change their gloves often so I guess it's not too bad for a take-away option, even though I had to wait so long for my food to be ready.

JqLK2z9vwdP7ZFBdloRR5w.text: This place is a great find. My fella and I have had our eyes on this place for a while so one day while we were craving noodles and bbq we checked it out.   The location is small and pretty clean. The food is affordable and there is so much variety. The food comes out swiftly and we were very happy with our meals.   My fella and I shared a noodle soup with dumplings and bbq pork. I had some pork belly as well. It was all delightful and the service was good. The server came back to check on us often and refilled our waters regularly, which is a must in my book!  I'll be back for some more cheap eats.

cwWxy4KfIe1KbpDw6EAaxQ.text: Cash only. Everything was very good. Especially shrimp wanton and duck noodle. Portions are reasonable for the price.

X4BVYlPJWvHw9tGJ0Bvc1A.text: The food here is very good. They also have good service. The price is fair. Although the space should be bigger. It does feel squished here.

SoTBCe9iwtWReDqmCGEm4w.text: Best in Vegas so far for comfort Cantonese dishes. My fave: bbq noodle soup. Other great dishes: pig feet, curry fun noodle soup w beef tendon.   Cash only. Pretty affordable place!

YN7ehT5cCAe5oqEmOn-pEA.text: When we want real Asian food you've got to head to Chinatown. And when everyone is still closed at 10:30 am this Cantonese outpost is open! A True value for price menu. Get your Chinese noodles dry, crispy, and/or with gravy. Get it vegetarian, with various meat choices, or my favorite---seafood combo..depending on the day I order crispy chow mein with a gravy mix OR chow fun done with seafood combo gravy.... I always order a rice dish with beef & black bean sauce or delicious tomato beef & egg...other times it's half a roast duck with rice. Yum....

JjKqJ5X0HDXGIgzvBmUC3g.text: duck was delicious -lines out the door pricing higher than competition, and the ratio of bones to meat indicates they use a one minute old duck--

zu082K5XyikpnujpS6OBmg.text: HATE  Nothing.  DISLIKE  Our first, traditionally unfriendly first server. Duck tasted a little gamey. The dingy bathroom.  LIKE  The seafood crispy noodles. The preserved tofu Chinese spinach. The roast pork.  LOVE  Our main server Tammy who was upbeat and had great suggestions. The reasonable pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork and duck with dipping sauces
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood crispy noodles

lBQPhY_bX8uHf20ox24Sgw.text: Best chinese BBQ place in town. I guarantee it! Do not go anywhere else.  instead of a long paragraph I'm just going to tell you what to order  DO ORDER:  - 3 meat combo (crispy pork, roast duck, BBQ pork) over rice *** THE BEST*** - won ton noodles (you can choose type of noodle and if you want meat in it) - fried noodles with vegetables on top - chow fun (beef, pork etc) - porridge (w/ thousand yr old egg is my favorite)  NOW GOGOGOGOGO!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AdUVFDZd2j_YJ5Axf8gd7w.text: Love the food! Everytime when I want to get Roasted Duck, they always have it. I love how the juicy meat of duck goes into my mouth. The service was good as well even on a busy day.

mqc0q5ZvKBFIIQtz5QZn3w.text: Wanted something cheap, good and quick so we stopped in for lunch.   I've heard so much about their BBQ so we ordered up a 2 BBQ combination rice plate. The roast pork has a awesome crunchy skin and the bbq pork is juicy and succulent. Definitely good for the price and I would order BBQ from here again. They also give you a bowl of soup, this was beef broth with potato and carrots.   We also got shrimp wonton soup with thin egg noodles. The wontons were quality with shrimp, black mushroom and pork. I realized the more I have simple Chinese broth soups the more I feel they're sort've one noted. Just a personal preference, but I think anyone who wants a good wonton noodle soup with some greens will be satisfied.  They serve complimentary tea, which was sort've odd tasting. It tasted like moth balls to me and the BF said it was like spinach water.  Servers was friendly when we were ordering, but I wouldn't say there was much service at all. We weren't ever checked on or refilled, we went to the counter to pay.   BBQ definitely quality and I would order some to-go of this sometime. It's just one of those places that isn't bad, but didn't impress either. It's good for all the things they do and makes for a good cheap work option.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 meat bbq plate - bbq pork, roast pork
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp wonton (thin) noodle soup

fpmbYlWFUGN1lrIvdzumSA.text: The HK comfort food here is on point. Excellent Cantonese bbq, which can be ordered a la carte or on a plate of rice plus some vegetables. The pork belly () had crispy skin and equally sized tender portions of fat and meat. The roast duck () was super tasty and also came with a good portion of meat.  They also seem very good for soup noodles (), and their menu has a nice guide for customizing your noodles and meats in the way you see fit. Three items are definitely a hearty portion, maybe even two.

Uo05uGBLdF-hrS8cl6H4PA.text: Great place for food and the prices are really affordable.  Just be ready for the crowds!  It's not a very big place, especially with all the people trying to get in or out, trying to not run into people seated!  Efficiently run system...

21zPJH3IZPpKrjuCebInjA.text: 2 words...... Roast Pork!!! The skin was so so crispy and the meat not too fatty. I also tried the BBQ pork, the salted fish fried rice, Dumpling noodle soup, and the duck. Everything was pretty good I have to admit. I wish there was more places in SD that have the crispy roast pork like here.  Wait was not too bad, only about 15 mins or so

XCSHcwFl58tdSwY9TDmOPw.text: Service( waiter and waitress) are good, but not the food, too much bean sprout and soy sauce for chow fun, doesnt taste good overall. The ladies who told the waitress which dish to which table is bad, they give the dish whichever table they want to.

wLpi3NTxEXue-hA-9zjxog.text: If you are hungry and want excellent Chinese food at affordable prices, this is the place to come. It's not the typical fried rice, kung pao, orange chicken fare, this stuff is legit Chinese food.   The most popular dish ordered by non-chinese is the #7 BBQ 2 combo with rice. It comes with peking duck and crispy pork belly that has been deliciously flavored with Chinese five spice powder. Also included is a side of bright green steamed Chinese broccoli. It all sits atop plain white rice that has nicely absorbed the marinade of the duck and pork. It's a complete meal, with your protein, carb and veggie for $7.99.   The pork belly is something to talk about. It has an excellent balance of crunchy skin and moist meat. There are great flavors here with the salty, briny meat and hint of anise which is strong but not overpowering. The duck was the usual and not much to talk about there.   Cash only. Crowded.  The staff who have excellent command of the English language are really friendly, welcoming and approachable. The ones with minimal English are not so friendly and in American terms could be considered to be downright rude. It all is to be taken with a grain of salt. I attribute their rudeness to their inability to communicate. The super friendly demeanor of the English speaking associates help make up for their non-English speaking counterparts.    Located across the street from Wendy's noodle cafe and 168 market. This is one of my favorite little blocks to eat while in Vegas.

8h-6DcxMSz56WT56dWH1sg.text: I was in search of a place that served filling food for my brother during his TKD tournament. 11am on a Saturday and this place was packed to the brim!   A combo plate with two choices of meat comes with a heaping amount of rice and Chinese broccoli. I opted for roast pork & soy sauce chicken. The skin on the roast pork is soo crispy and delicious. Chicken was very fresh and marinated perfectly.   The quality, price and portion puts Sam Woo to shame. A solid choice - will be a good option if I'm ever in LV.

cXplK2Df09ZIUoG_AyQyng.text: The best bbq in Las Vegas, we always come here everytime in Vegas. Their food always fresh and taste good.Try to come early so don't have to wait too long. Roast duck also good and not too much fat. All time favorite is the roast pork belly. Not much fan of their noodle or noodle soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ DUCK
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qBCujm3AM4XERjF3ux1SkQ.text: If you are in the mood for roast duck or wonton noodle soup or Chinese style BBQ pork, you should visit AB&N. Because of the high turnover, their roast duck and BBQ pork are usually very fresh and juicy. The price for noodle soup is very reasonable too.  Now for some reason, I don't like any of their chicken dishes. The portion is usually too small and there isn't much meat attached to the bones. On the other hand, I think they have the best crispy pan fried noodle in Vegas.  Now for some bad news. If you order noodle soup to go, they always give you a small styrofoam cup of soup, which is not enough to fill up the noodle. I always have to add half can of chicken broth to fully cover the noodle. Second, I'm suspecting that some of the ingredients they put in their soup and sauce might not be healthy if you consume their food regularly. My co-workers used to eat at this place weekly and we would get stomach ache if we ate more than once a week. As for the crispy pan fried noodle, the sauce smelled really funky and strange if you reheat it my the microwave.  By the way, they don't accept credit card, so remember to stop by the ATM on the way here.  Overall, I still come to AB&N when I'm craving for roast duck noodle soup or roast pork, but I try to go here no more  than once a month.

e_ozy2-QE7ktTYQ_dHFrMg.text: Wow. I think I could eat here every night except Fridays because they're closed. Extra crunchy pork belly omg! Friendly staff, cheap food, and clean bathrooms.

WkFF0ynAkn0hqdBfkkLa_w.text: I went to this place with my friend. It was hands down the best Chinese restaurant i've ever been to... I got the beef chow mien  and  it was so tasty and satisfying.  The only reason for 4 stars is cuz of cash only. I wish they would accept card

YfEtPzfDtJcyhropX1CAiQ.text: Love this mom and pop place. They have authentic Chinese food here and it reminds me of Hong Kong when I'm here :) Food is delish and price is great too!

crvfMDVr6VSzhEesPnL5lA.text: super good food!!! this is trul the best HK style bbq food in Las Vegas. They are famous for their belly roasted pork, make sure you try that!!! or the combo bbq items on rice or make your own noodle soup!!! i'm drooling just writing the review! the staff was super nice and friendly, we came in almost closing time, and they were still willing to served us!!! highly recommended!!!

IibL8WJD4WAi9f56Kx2N2w.text: Ooh chinese food...ooh yes!! Must come and eat pork belly.. noodles with duck and wontons.   This place is happening. . Come early...this place gets busy.  Overall the food and service deserves 4 stars.. I will come back soon.. enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ooh duck n noodles...pork belly...

Ahg0gm5BIMsVmsxTUngIRQ.text: The BBQ meats are delicious and inexpensive. I also tried the curry tendons with my friends and it was tender and flavorful. The place is pretty small and it gets pretty packed. So be prepared to wait a few minutes for a table.

jUL3y2QSBS6Yh2FSNnMWyQ.text: CASH ONLY~~~~Hole in the wall, great cheap spot for Noodles and BBQ... The duck wonton noodle was pretty delicious.. it was a good portion with a lot of duck and wontons.  the wontons were very fresh and and big.. Wish I also ordered the pork belly or pig..it looked soo good and crispy- I definitely have to come back again next time... they have many options: porridge, yellow noodle soup, fried noodles, chicken, pork, duck..etc..and you can order these items to go too.. all the dishes range from $5-8 depending on the type of meat you choose..if you dont want meat, you can get noodles for under $4..

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck w wonton noodle soup

Bu9bJ3Nmf1VzK6SFo-q9rA.text: Love the fact that this place has char siu, roast duck, and roast pork, hanging in a glass case like back in Hawaii. The menu revolves around these items so you can get any of these meats with noodles in soup, on rice, or just ala carte. THey also have really good chow fun. Heads Up -- CASH ONLY. Other than that, food is awesome and a great little gem in Vegas.

2u7hJRBk-s6XH6ckquxQgQ.text: Excellent place! Everything was so good and tasty. I didn't know what they all were (this intenstine and that gut lol); my father ordered them all. Every plate has distincitve and delicious flavor. Love!

09XN6G1LKpO3fe-qn8c3WQ.text: I really love this place!! every time I come to Vegas I eat here at least twice!! the char Sui is exquisite!! Chinese broccoli the best!! other things look awesome too!
