TkzhWLo1BuE2GQw7WFFi3Q.text: Vegan as I am, I declined the BBQ- which looked delicious. A full house can attest to that. My bud had roast pork and duck- and he knows meat. Says it's delicious. Considering how busy this place is, the staff is courteous and friendly. Really tasty stuff here.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork and duck. Really tasty.

6susBRGBF8zK22uDO0o-3Q.text: This place has the best bbq pork!  It's tender, juicy and I love the fact that it's not that red color artificial stuff they normally use.  Also loved their roast pork and duck...so tender and flavorful!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq pork, roast pork, duck and chinese broccoli...delish!

8-FdwKio1j6YUv72b9yA9A.text: First found out about this place from a friend who religiously visits Vegas every year. Knowing the lack of good Peking duck places in Atlanta, he highly recommend that I eat here when my hubby & I first started visiting Vegas 4 years ago.   The roasted duck is a must order. The duck is super flavorful, with crispy skin. that's exactly how the duck should taste and it doesn't disappoint. No wonder it wins top 100 Chinese Restaurant in the US.  We ordered roasted pig and it's also pretty good. But I think my favorite meat here is still the duck.  It's not the best duck place we've ever been to but it's pretty damn good. I mean, we do stop by here and eat every time when we're in town and this is Vegas.

o6g6gwke1cvE-tpQimF95Q.text: I was looking for a new place to try and this was on my radar and bookmarked for awhile. I just happened to be driving around the chinatown area after running some errands and decided to give this place a try. The restaurant is tucked away in the corner of a shopping plaza on the corner of Jones/Spring Mountain. Walking in, it reminds of me of a Sam Woo BBQ that I used to go to in Monterey Park - not a huge place, but enough seats if you want to sit and eat, but I did notice most people were getting plates to go.  The first thing you notice when you walk in is that familiar smell of chinese roast bbq and you can see the hanging meat in the glass case full of roast pork belly, bbq pork, and duck. The next thing you notice is the big sign that says "Cash Only" so make sure you hit the ATM before coming here. I sat down and ordered a 2 item BBQ combo and got the roast pork belly and duck - it came out with a small side of vegetables and rice. For $6.99 this is definitely a great deal for what you get. For $3 more you can get a plate of chinese broccoli to satisfy your veggie intake for the day. It was so good, I even ordered one to go for my lunch the next day - another 2 item combo of roast pork belly and bbq pork.   I would like to go back and try their wonton noodle soup and other specialties.

tcvcnEZEY9k83U3bUrw0vQ.text: I could have given this restaurant 4 to 5 stars. The BBQ and noodle dishes are pretty good. I don't know if any one noticed that this Restaurant automatically added 15% tip to your bill without letting you know. I have to asked the cashier to find out the additional charges on my bill. We're only party of three. I don't mind leaving 15% tip and I was going to do that anyway, but it should be optional. I don't know whether this is legal or not. Please check you bill before paying for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My bill.

wHU4dRW7EdxI_EgFWuQTUA.text: Good Chinese BBQ and noodles restaurant.  Cash only.  Portions are reasonable but not huge for the price.  Casual.  Definitely a local place.

yvzyEigi0geOqcW0LEAt_A.text: Phenomenal! One of my favorite Chinese spots for viddles! My favorite dish is combination rice, duck wonton, roast pork and duck....

uURyo3N4Gdus7b9GUb3HXQ.text: Feeling a bit adventurous, my wife and I decided to venture down to Chinatown for lunch and follow the Yelp reviews to this little gem.  Right as we walked in, we realized we were in for a real treat because we were the only white people in the entire place.  Following the recommendation of our server, I ordered the BBQ pork side dish, and boy am I glad that I did.  The taste of everything we had took me back to my visit to Beijing.  Very authentic, very reasonably priced, and very delicious!

i0epyF2rrStcmvZV-i1SAA.text: This place was pretty amazing, and inexpensive too! After a weekend of Las Vegas Strip fun, my girls and I really needed some authentic asian food. Yelp to the rescue of course! We dragged our blurry-eyed butts out of bed and headed to ChinaTownLV haha.   It's located in this strip mall so there's plenty of parking..already that's a plus since parking is a pain anywhere on the Strip. It's not much to look at when you walk in but it's surprisingly clean and almost has a Thai feel to it..but it's definitely Chinese. There's Cantonese music in the background and all the workers were speaking to each other in Cantonese as well. Ahh I knew good food would be coming.  Definitely get the roast duck, the skin is so crispy, it crackles when you take a bite. No gross soggy skin here folks! Now if you're a little hung over like I was, I'd recommend getting some kind of soup. There's lots to choose from so just pick a noodle and your toppings and you'll be good to go. If you're lucky enough to be there when they have suckling pig, GET IT. I actually haven't had it but..I'm sure it's amazing as well :D  Service was..well Chinese haha (I can say that because I'm Chinese, I know how we are). Most of the waitresses are hard to flag down and if they're busy, rather than say they'll be right with us they'll just put a hand up and go about their business. Their English is limited though so that may have something to do with it. There was one guy, maybe he was the owner? He was actually very nice and personable. He chatted with people, made sure we got our orders, etc. He should maybe show the other waitresses how it's done.  Anyway, this might just be a LV hang-over tradition for me from now on ^_^

w35ntH15eB-LeBxzChXABQ.text: I am still amazed how little we paid for the nice food we got. I am a chinese, and I will tell you the food is delicious! and their special menu price is so low, I couldn't believe it. I ended up to go 4 dishes on second day, so I can have some at home. Those ice drinks are tasteful also.

1PR5nP-fZm2JVbL02z8dHg.text: Let me start by saying...WHO goes to an Asian restaurant for service? When I go to one I expect bad service..it's just how it is..if the service is good that's just a bonus..Don't make this a racial thing..I'm Asian and they were rude to me but do I care?  No.  Just give me my damn delicious food!!! With that out of the way, this is my new FAVORITE restaurant in Vegas!!! I've never wanted to go back to a restaurant the next day but I did with this one.  I was dreaming of their roasted pork belly, roast duck and BBQ pork!!!  I understand why they were voted as one of the 100 best chinese restaurants in the US!!!  Can't wait til we eat again!!!

sP8N0FyB4ksMLEm8ui-G_g.text: CASH ONLY.  I tried this place last weekend and got the BBQ 3 Combo Platter, which is a plate of 3 meats of your choice.  Just an FYI, it's only the meat, if you want rice or anything it'll have to be ordered on the side.  For my meat I chose the chicken, duck, and roasted pork belly.  I originally wanted the bbq pork but at the time it wasn't going to be available for another 2 hours.  Out of the 3 meats that I chose, the roasted pork belly stood out the most.  The skin was nice and crispy, and the meat was nice and tender.  The combination of both textures just made it taste so good.  On the side they give you dipping sauces based on whichever meat you choose.  My girlfriend got the wonton noodle soup, which was decent.  There was nothing special about it.  Service is OK, you can expect the same type of service as any other asian restaurant.  Parking is plentiful except when it is later in the afternoon, that's when the neighboring restaurants get most of their customers.    Next time, if I come back, i'll just be getting the roasted pork belly!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton Soup.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ 3 Combo Platter (Chicken, Duck, Pork).

L_5pNXzXKlCwhfkyBdSk6Q.text: This is my favorite pork belly and roasted duck joint in Las Vegas. The pork belly skin is always cooked to a perfect crispiness and the flavors are bold and scrumptious. After one bite you just want to keep on going and when you look up from an empta bowl of bbq Duck wonton noodle with a side of roasted pork belly  and choi sum later, you feel like a chubby pig because you forgot to save half for later and now you're overly stuffed a feel sick, guilty and there are no left over for later so you have to get a few Togo orders for later. It always happens when I am at this place and I can't understand why

EtlsBgF2oefrmB08tmQMOA.text: Really good Chinese food for las Vegas been there a bunch of times. Congee is tasty. Pork, duck, pig and chicken on rice or in soup. Different types of noodle dishes. Always busy mostly asians. Parking sucks food does not disappoint.

GFu-o4XMiF5K51TymKzFCw.text: The roast duck was juicy, and well seasoned but the BBQ pork did not impress. The pork used was a cheaper pork meat instead of the cut that  is typically used for cha siu. If you have had cha siu in SF or HK, you can distinguish the difference in flavor and texture.   We waited at least 40 minutes for our pan fried noodles and beef porridge to arrive. We finished the Chinese donut before the porridge got to the table. Also don't order the porridge if you are expecting Cantonese style congee. This one was watery and had very little  rice. It also had white mushrooms which is really unusual. The seafood pan fried noodle dish was equally disappointing. The noodles were cut up as if the restaurant didn't have enough noodles for the dish.   If you come here, stick with the roast duck or BBQ meat.  You'll get your dish a lot faster.

lHG-ptS6mNTSvYHdaML4_g.text: Damn this place is delicious and so very authentic.  Down to the dude roasting the whole pig and chopping it behind a glass case.     I always get the 3-item for $18.99 and a bowl of rice to share.  They give you so much this is easily enough for two.... Or add one more dish for 3.    Add a noodle dish and this place is heaven.

0P5Vzh27YvD9UEis9IKBGw.text: Combo BBQ was good. Rude service; tossed plates and water on table.  Had to wait 5 minutes to order.  Meal would have been better if we didn't have to fight off the flies.  Maybe it was their version  of Vegas entertainment.

oZfMrlfEulkhez34r1GSiQ.text: On our last visit toLas Vegas we found Asian BBQ& Noodles !  Lots of seating but this place gets busy and fills quickly!   We ordered the tomatoes & black pepper Hong Kong style crispy noodles and a BBQ rice plate with belly pork and duck! Everything was awesome!  Starting with the noodles- fresh sweet tomatoes w/tender slices of beef with black pepper gravy over crispy fried noodle - what perfection !  We'll order this dish again -  a little sweet and a little spicy a great combo! The BBQ meats are very good -  the pork belly with it's xtra crispy skin and perfect layers of meat and fat!  Served with a perfect sauce.  The duck was crispy with lots of flavor and nothing was left behind! We really loved this place with lots of choices for every one.  The service folks are quick with taking your order and delivering your order.  Great for a quick Lunch or dinner or takeout.  The place is busy even at 4pm but they are quick to get you in and out!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 BBQ I teams with rice $10.99
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck -  hot and fresh
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gYplWqFb9Ij_ML9_dl6IFg.text: OMG!!! This is seriously my favorite spot for lunch/dinner. The BEST Chinese BBQ in Las Vegas. I come here frequently and never get sick of this place. It's not a huge place but the service is fast so you'll get your order in a few minutes. Prepare for the wait though because they are super busy and I always have to wait long but I don't mind because their food is always great.   My favorites are roasted duck, roasted pork belly and ginger chicken. They are absolutely delicious and juicy, perfect balance of texture and flavor. They are so flavorful and the crispy textures are just perfect. The combination plate comes with a side of steam rice, veggies, fresh picked radish, soy dipping sauce and onion ginger sauce. They have a lot of options to order different plates. I also order the whole roasted duck and 2 pounds of crispy roasted pork belly for togo and their fried rice is so good too. I always have a positive experience here so definitely recommend it. If you want to eat excellent Chinese bbq, this is the spot.

eVDVIBwetNXchfi5IzsDgA.text: Okay. Been coming here a lot for the past 8 yrs. love there egg noodles and bbq pork. There water is gross but the food is good. I always carry water in my car anyway so I don't drink their unfiltered tap water. Services is a bit meh, but all Asians r like that. Cash only though. I don't always carry cash so I don't visit this place as often as I like. The food in this location taste better than their new location on Decatur and spring mountain. This restaurant is always busy so I like to go before dinner hour and after lunch to avoid huge crowds. Food is worth it though.

PDD-kPqhJaPeV5sggCJbLQ.text: This place is quite small, tables very close together. On this visit, they had a good number of people dining in, the wait staff is good and friendly. The food is okay and needs a little bit more flavor. I love chicken feet but the ones here were very chewy, it was difficult to eat. The pork ears were nicely spiced but again a little chewy. The pig intestines were tender but needed more flavor... Their 2-meat combo ( I had pork belly and roasted duck ) was okay... Their prices are very reasonable... I will try and come back to see if things are better...

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken feet, spicy pork ears, and pork intestine... Chicken feet was very chewy, had a difficult time with them. Same with pork ears....
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Same 2-meat combo
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef soup ... I didn&#39;t try it...,

g2ypmnV50zv-Q-O5aNm9pw.text: Went in on a Sunday afternoon and there were 3-4 tables with families seated when we walked in. We decided to order our food to go because it was a little stuffy in the restaurant.   We ordered the roasted pork plate and the beef chow mein. 2 items and it took nearly half an hour to receive our take out order, which is pretty bad considering the roasted pork plate only has to be chopped and put in a container with rice. As for the food itself - the roasted pork was really good. The meat was tender and juicy, though I would've liked the skin to be a bit crispier. The beef chow mein wasn't great. There were only a few thin pieces of beef in the dish and it was fairly bland and a little too greasy. Probably wouldn't order it again.   The staff was just...meh. We kind of just stood in front of the cashier for a couple minutes until she finally acknowledged us and took our order. Maybe not the best experience but would possibly come back some time to try some of their other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow mein glistening with grease.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pork plate. So much meat!

1u9MCdSG0fROL18ZKep5hg.text: Heard through the grapevine that this place is better than Sam Woo and restaurants alike back at home. The restaurant was packed at 11 AM with a line of people waiting for their to go orders. Noticed the hanging pork belly was midway through and knew it was a sign.   For people ordering to-go, head straight to the counter and place your order with the cashier. If you're hungry, order the one option with rice/noodle. If you have a bigger than typical appetite or want to have leftovers for later, get the two options with rice/noodle. Either options come with a small portion of Chinese broccoli.  The crispy pork belly had perfectly crispy skin with tender pieces of meat underneath. Easily one of the best I've ever had. While the roasted duck was just your average duck, the bbq pork stood out to be one of the better ones. It was not overly sweet nor smothered in sauce and while it had relatively no fat, it was still tender.  It's a cash only establishment so come prepared.

5UUGcFZqIaGWKcktYhlWiw.text: Food here are Awesome. One of my fav spot in town. I will definitely come back and recommended to friends.  Wonton soup: 5/5 BBQ Pork and belly: 5/5

9A-FFOAewcD4YA2FjHa9iA.text: CASH ONLY. We ordered a 2 plates combo of roasted pork and roasted duck, along with spicy pig ear and wonton soup. My fav was the spicy pig ear with a strong satay flavor, and the crunchy texture was just perfect. The roasted pork was flavorful with crispy skin. Roasted duck was my least fav as it was too fatty and the skin wasnt as crispy. Wonton soup balances out the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SjMgy22Bkyzq-7x-x98c2g.text: Best cantonese food in the area. I cannot find something as good as they are in LA. Always pay this place a visit when Im in Vegas. Good price. Great food!

kK462Jf-V7qbYEZSs9kV1A.text: Restaurants with genuine Chinese cuisine for me are the ones that are purely about the food rather than interior indulgences, so I did not get put off by a rather humble decor at Asian BBQ and Noodles.   We have ordered Roast Duck with shrimp dumplings in a broth and a combo with pork skin, pork feet, black mushrooms and dry noodles that also comes in a broth. The total price for both dishes (without the tip) was 21.63 USD (a killer deal for the quantity and quality of food that you get). Oh and - important - it's CASH only restaurant.   The broth was pure joy - fragrant, delicious, well-balanced. Pig feet - collagenous, with melting in the mouth bits of meat. Next time I probably will not opt for pork skins - soggy and drifting in the broth is not my fav. Otherwise it was a super yum bowl of food.  I will happily come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fTxQWG1leEsT56IScnIafA.text: Another place added to my must go to when I'm in Las Vegas for Chinese food. The food here is pretty close to Hong Kong style cooking. The roast pork and the roast duck or excellent the charts you which is roast pork was also tasty. You know this is a good Chinese restaurant when 90% of the patrons here are local Chinese

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closed on Fridays,  Cash only
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QuPfqcKAbL2ug2uz4GC00g.text: Loved this place in LV that serves authentic Hong Kong BBQ and other dishes.  My parents from the old country approved.  What else is there to add?

k4mO809GkZM99Ro3oq3WSA.text: Food: Asian bbq and noodles duh! That's pretty much the extent of their menu but they do it well.   3 combo bbq (crispy pork belly, duck, bbq pork) Shrimp dumplings with noodles soup Singapore noodles BBQ pork fried rice Choy with oyster sauce  Standout is the BBQ pork. This is the best I've had. Usually places have these weird, dry, radioactive red colored pork, but this was seasoned and cooked perfectly moist and not too oily. Also not weirdly red.   I'd get everything again except the Singapore noodles (too dry and too spicy) and the fried rice (too dry but hubby liked). For the noodle soup I'd try the wonton and noodles next time. The shrimp was more like a fish ball and not whole shrimps.   Service: they speak English and Cantonese but there was one guy that spoke Mandarin and communicated with my FIL. Pretty friendly for a Chinese restaurant and they even gave us extra bowls without us having to ask.   Ambiance: it looks ghetto on the outside, but inside is clean and basic with plenty of tables and the meat on display.   Location: parking can be challenging at peak times since there are a lot of Asian food places in this plaza.   I'll be back when I'm hankering for BBQ pork, otherwise Big Wong's noodle soup is seasoned better.

sSg8zsdIZ0zXpiB6B54IPA.text: It was referred to us from a friend back home, so we took Uber as soon as we checked in our hotel. We were hungry for good roast duck. We feel at ease as soon as we saw the entrance, simple but beat up entrance. Once in, no fanfare table settings, another good sign for good chinese restaurant.  And yes, roast duck and pork are really good, the skin is crispy and fresh. The wonton soup is good but not really Hong Kong standard.

wnwLkgHnwNUgjdMnbTrENg.text: Came by the other day since it's been awhile. Was feeling nostalgic for Hong Kong's Mak Noodle and this place is the closest to authentic wonton noodle soup I can think of in the States.   Decor and service remains the same since the last time I was there. No fuss, in and out, cash only type of joint.  Sadly there has been a change since our last visit: Price has gone up ($6.50) and broth and noodle has gone down. The soup was lackluster. Noodle was slightly overcooked and bland. Quantity of the noodle seems less. However, the wonton remains the same: full of flavor!  Still not too shabby.

fCVJGZyk1VjY6ZM7LEvvPQ.text: So I decided to try this place because yelp had them rated 4 stars. Omg what a bad decision I made... I ordered by phone ... Then had to repeat my order when I got there. House fried rice,  beef chow fun, and wonton soup.  I was excited thinking wow this place is busy.. Looks very busy because its a small place.  So I get home within 5 minutes... I open the tray with the house fried rice and said to myself, this sure doesnt look like house fried rice... It had bits n pieces of chicken , with tiny fragments of egg. Just a pinch of green onion. So I take a bite and wham....its spoiled. I called immediately and was told at first that they were closed... 8:55pm.. So I explained that my rice was not what I ordered n that it's spoiled. So now I go back tomorrow and try again lol... Oh boy... Let's see what happens.

WCMKslw5CycuW-QZvfYSow.text: Always awesome. Just be patient with customer service. I recommend everything except #75, the dried fried seafood chow fun, more bean sprouts than noodle. Also, recommending the long wait if eating there. Best if ordered to-go, which we do anytime returning to Vegas.

H91oaKC_kfHP4A3N9fY3RQ.text: I would make the argument that this place is most authentic Cantonese BBQ in town. You can find your favorite Chinese stir-fries and bbq in here while you admire their unique taste of wallpaper. (You'll understand when you go there) They offer your favorite noodles and meats and are all available to go. They also have a steam table where you can order ala cart items per pound.   The service is very Chinesey: very quick, do not look for super hospitable servers because you're looking in the wrong place. Depending on the type of food you order, the time it takes for it to come out may vary. Stir-Fried dishes take the longest, while BBQ rice places are the quickest.   About the food: After spending about a year trying to find my Cantonese favorites in LV, I think this is my go-to. The barbecue is not the best I've ever had, but its good enough to remind me of authentic Cantonese BBQ. The stir-fried noodles are executed well, and they have the Asian-ey vegetables that I look for when I go out to eat Chinese (Pea Sprouts, Mustard Greens, Baby Bok Choys, etc etc...) I included a picture of their homemade hotsauce, which i wish i can just 'take' every time. The flavor of their sauce reminds me of a hot and spicy hotpot: super fragrant, super depth in terms of spices, and numbing peppercorns!  Recommended Foods: "Kuai-Fei" Chicken - poached whole chicken served with Ginger/Scallion sauce Stir-Fried noodles - Chow fun, crispy noodles BBQ Duck, Cha-Siu, Roasted Belly (salty though) Asian vegetables Curried Tendon (super small portions though) Hot Sauce  Reasons why it didn't get the 5th star: Quite expensive for Chinese BBQ while not delivering top quality Cash Only Closes too early @ 9PM CLOSED ON FRIDAYS

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Duck/ Roasted Pork Belly. A tad salty but great with rice!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Housemade hawwwt sauce. (Very Szchewan/SiChaun with a lot of numbing peppercorns)
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Pea Sprouts.. Yummm (super big portion of veg [veg for 4-6] but $15)

t38L80IveA8mshWsxp1GVg.text: Holy crap! This place is amazing! I would've never found out about this place unless my friend took us here. This is literally a hole in the way that serves Chinese food. No, not the typical Chinese food that everything things. But the one you would find in China in the streets!  I was somewhat hesitate at first but I wanted to try something new. I looked over the menu briefly but talking to my friend. I gave it back and gave it to the pro to order. I took his word for it and about 5 dishes came out.  I wish I knew what they were so I can order them again if I was ever in Vegas.  I know I had BBQ pork, Wonton soup, vegetables on the side, and a couple other dishes as well. The food was really well-made and you can taste how good it was. I honestly am not sure how else to describe. It's one of those things where you have to go there and find out for yourself!  Will be back in the future!

RqY3ufHzg2MCLpEThHfBKg.text: Omg one of the best Chinese spot in town! This place is super tiny and cash only but soo worth it! I love having their wonton noodle and porridge :)  they give a good amount of everything which is great. They also have meat that they given plenty of! I will continue to keep coming back for more even if I have to wait in line :) tip: try to go when it's not lunch hour cause that's when it's the busiest!

qIinNfnD2i01E6_jUxhV_Q.text: Horrible HORRIBLE service from wait staff to cashier. The cashier's attitude is disgusting. Its a norm to not always receive the best service at a Chinese restaurant but this place doesn't even understand basic human decency and courtesy. The cashiers attitude is disgusting and unprofessional. I don't understand how this place stays afloat. Their cash only policy is a scam as well. They should pay taxes like the rest of the businesses.

lkZFvgiPNbFr6m8nRvgVAA.text: YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(154/365) "Duck, Duck, Goose...I Mean Pork Belly!"  Better late than never,right? After an afternoon of ingredient shopping for Panang Curry across the street at 168 Market, I was tired, hot, and hungry. Rather than just grab something at the 168 Deli, I wanted to try a different spot.  I pulled up the Yelp App on my phone and Asian BBQ was one of the choices and was just across the street. I've never been there, and heard nothing but good things from Yelpers. I saw the first picture and looked no further. I said to myself "Self, that's what I want, and that's what I'm gonna get!"  It looks like nothing from the outside but when you enter, this place is packed with people getting their grub on. Right away, I order the 2 choice BBQ Plate Special ($7.99) of their Roast Duck and Roast Pork. As I peruse the menu, I see Hainan Chicken, and I contemplate on getting a third choice($10.99) The lady taking my order starts giggling because she can see my "eyes getting bigger than my stomach" look, and at the same time, I hear R. Kelly...R. KELLY!?!? Yes, R.Kelly, and he's singing (as in the Bump and Grind intro) "Your mind's telling you NOOOOOO.......But your stomach, your stomach's telling you YESSSSSSSS!"(Its a BIG sign of hunger when you start hearing things!) I block it all out and stick to my order, and I'm so glad I did because their take out portions are HUMANGOUS!  I get in my car, and it smells SO GOOD, I gotta just have one bite...which turned into another bite, and another one,  and another one! I finally pulled myself together,  turned up the A/C and headed home.  The duck was very juicy and that liquid Elixir of duck love that they pour over the duck and rice is pretty bomb. The pork was crispy with just enough fat and tasty meat too. I ate half the plate for lunch and the rest for dinner.  Can't wait to come back and try their noodle selections which they also have many choices for! Fast, cheap, and delicious, seriously one of the best deals in town.   ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  5  CASH ONLY and closed on Fridays FYI....

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Suckling Pig.....need to order ahead of time
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all that goodness....; 9
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside

QCjS3nU-33E3v0x36fDlUA.text: My favorite place for roast duck and crispy roasted pork in Vegas, better than SamWoo.  Cash only.  Cleaner than SamWoo but not by much.  The parking here is a little crazy since there is an unusual number of excellent restaurant in this little Plaza  (Hachi izakaya, China Mama, HK Star Cantonese food, District One Vietnamese to name a few).  You can either select items from the heated pre-made bins (with street style food) or order plates off the menu.  Again, the star here is the BBQ, so while there are fried rice and noodle plates, those are 3-4star dishes compared to the BBQ.

433kPCGDb4XU0Qw80RaNzw.text: Holy roasted pork belly! This place blew my mind. Man...talk about flawless! These people are Chinese BBQ experts! Their roasted pork belly was tiptop extreme crispy perfection and the moist BBQ pork was also fanastic!  Right when I walked in, the ladies working the front eagerly waved me down and started convincing me that I wanted a lb of everything. It reminded me of walking into a car dealership and approaching the wave of commission based salesmen. Be sure to stay strong or you will succumb to the glorious pork that's glistening right in front of you and end up buying more than you intended.   Initially I was planning on purchasing a half lb of each, but I easily couldn't resist and ended up buying 1 lb of each - roast pork belly and BBQ pork, all for $27.20. They weigh each kind of meat (majority of the time it's a little over what you intended to buy) But, I honesty don't regret buying a little over (unless I was on a strict budget). Make sure to request a copy of your receipt if you need one, they don't give one typically for BBQ take-out orders.   I took one bite and was astonished on how crispy, juicy, and flavorful the roast pork belly was. Wow, can I just say mouthgasm? Nothing in this world can beat an expertly roasted crispy pork belly skin. They make a wining one here with an indescribable magical crunch. They also provide a small container of plum hoisen sauce to dip your pork belly in. They pair perfectly together - perfect harmony of salty and sweet.    As I expected, The BBQ pork was expertly prepared as well. Tender, moist, seasoned well and not over salted. It would be amazing in sandwiches (banh mi), with rice, in egg noodle soup...or hell, served in a boot!   Make sure to bring your cash and your self control! You might need it in here...

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top restaurant awards and banners all over the restaurant
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of the menu
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Come way before closing, they always seem to sell out of BBQ and roasted pork

j1Y7_UtRQM3l_FJnOBLZEg.text: The BEST BBQ in Nevada! Each time we visit Vegas, we always have to make a stop here for some BBQ Pork and Noodles. So yummy!

A8lorh36RB8xBaM3uFSdEQ.text: I was not overly impressed with this Chinese restaurant.  I tried the the crispy roasted pork and wonton noodle. The roasted pork had a thick amount of fat that it destroyed the whole dish. My noodle soup had a bland and flavorless broth.  Cash only!  Will not be back.

90VyIXXrfXLKl5yyO1VYig.text: Decent Cantonese style BBQ and noodles, but not great.   There are lots of signs about "top 100 restaurants in the US" from 5-10 years ago, but maybe something has changed -- not a bad place, but nothing special, especially given how many truly great restaurants are in Chinatown within a few blocks.  Cash-only.  Not particularly inexpensive, either -- $10-25/person.  One upside is they open at 10am before a lot of other places.

EBOT3Xr30ywf8MAJCLu4Pw.text: Food is excellent here! Place is kinda small so seating is tough when they get busy, which is mostly late afternoon and dinner time. Bring the green stuff as they do not accept credit cards.

pdk12gUEhFJrWjwituyEbw.text: If you find yourself in Vegas, I highly recommend coming to Asian BBQ & Noodle. They put SO much love into their food. They're vegetable fried rice is so colorful & delicious!! The roasted duck....SO JUICY & KEEPS YOU WANTING MORE even when you're SO FULL!! The rice porridge with ginko nuts, is my absolute FAVORITE!!! This has to be one of the best Chinese restaurants I have ever been to. Can't wait to come back again. The staff here are so attentive and such hard workers. The atmosphere is homey, it feels like being in my grandma's kitchen...eating, laughing, great energy!

ZKgsy06kOvo-nwUvM5tS3w.text: Two Words: MUST GO!  I have probably been here 20 times. It is THAT good.  I am lucky enough that every time I go, I get a seat everytime. I have drove by where I see a line forming outside (yikes!).It is not exactly a "take-you-out-on-a-first-date" atmosphere, but it is more of a hole-in-the wall.   There are an array of dishes and one can easily order one too many dishes! So, I will provide you with my ALL-TIME Favorites:  Roasted Duck - Crispy skin and thin meat Chicken Rice Porridge - creamy bowl of congee Combination Chow Mein BBQ Pork  I have tried many items on this menu and I can tell you that their dishes are high quality. This is not exactly healthy, but the food here is very authentic and consistent! For the quality of the food, it is quite inexpensive. Trust me, I have been here 20+ times!  Service is great and fast! If you come here and there is a line, go next door for some happy hour drinks or just wait!   Additional Notes: Parking: At peak hours, you may not find parking at night. You can risk parking across the street (you may get a ticket). Cash Only! Closed Fridays

amtAgEMdTh5CLLwEl0N9Jw.text: This place has very good food!  It is located in a strip mall and parking is free! This place is cleaner than I thought and there was a line outside after I sat down.  I am originally from Hong Kong and I really enjoyed their HK style soup noodle (the thin kind).  I tried the soup noodle with 3 toppings (intestines, curry fish balls and briskets) and ordered a rice dish with 2 toppings (bbq pork and duck).    Highlights: 1.  The food was good and priced reasoanbly.   2.  The bbq pork and duck had crispy skins!  They were still hot and tasted very yummy! 3.  Noodles were thin and chewy.   4.  The curry had a kick in it, just the way I liked it!  But, I felt like the fish ball was just OK.   5.  I ordered the milk tea and it was just meh.   6.  The customer service was surprisingly good!  They speak perfect English and Cantonese.    Overall, I think this place provides very good food.  For future improvements, they can definitely try to improve their drinks.  I'll definitely come back here for more authentic Chinese food in future.  Last but not least, the bathroom was clean as well!

iaGFnHLjIHR6lR8dxR7ZlQ.text: Great bbq dishes! loved every single bbq meat they had there but the service could use a lot of work. Which is expected at these type of restaurant

-2p6Gqa8voSzRvsW73EZIQ.text: Who would of thought great homestyle noodle and rice chinese shop in Las Vegas. It's Truely authentic! Great roasted meats of roast pork, cha sui, roast duck, and wonton noodles.   Go for the wonton Noodles with roast pork or the roast pork and cha sui over rice. Huge portions. Definitely enough for 2 meals. Also had their poached chicken congee wich chinese rice cruller (yau tew) So authentic. Fried up perfectly and soft and bready on the inside.  Truely a authentic chinese restaurant gem in Las Vegas with great prices. I'll be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zzKMuHJRIbTrbdQFJfYClw.text: Always come here when I want a quick lunch. I have tried a lot of their items:  Wontons with Duck - the wontons are so crispy and the broth is hot and sweet. Perfect on a cold day.  Chicken and Salty Fish Fried Rice - huge portion, definitely big enough for two. Add a little of their chili and its to die for. Crispy Seafood Noodles - again very big portion but I eat the whole thing by myself because it is that good! Again add their delicious chili and its extra delicious.  I have also tried their porridge, very smooth and perfectly seasoned, their bread sticks go really well with the porridge.  I also usually get an order of their signature Roast Pork, Mixed Intestine, Curry Fish balls.  I have tried other items but these are the ones I also go back to!   The place gets very crowded, not great for large parties.. they only have the middle section where they can put tables together but if you come with a party larger than 8... chances are they do not have enough tables to put together.  Typical service for a place in Chinatown but the staff are great, they are quick with cleaning tables, quick to bring out drinks and quick to take orders. They are very organized, staff are always on top of cleaning tables and seating guests.   Will definitely continue to come back, for the great food and for the price!!

wRP45KKvK88_MZVGgMf8eg.text: Noodles, wonton and rice with bbq pork and roasted duck here are yummy. I love bbq pork and they had one of few best ones i've ever eaten. My friends had wonton noodles and they looked so yummy. I will get it next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ Pork &amp; Roasted Duck w/ rice

gbQf_jEdztJqjVqvsbEwdA.text: great place for cheap Chinese food! I always get the char-siu pork and the pork belly - super spot on. the skin for the pork is crisp and the meat is tender.   I can always count on this place for a quick takeout meal!

DyGP15BXycweCibHH4XqCw.text: First timer, arrived 20 minutes after opening and this place was packed.  My husband and I both had the roast & BBQ pork combo with rice for $7.99 each (more than enough).  It was good, but not as great as the restaurant I eat at in Cali, but one of the best here in vegas so far.  Only downfall is this is only a cashed based restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork and duck....

Q53RwhN8JfponrZ97nX5kg.text: So glad I got to dine here for lunch & even more glad that I beat the mad lunch crowd.  About 10 mins after we sat down, a hoard of people showed up & just hovered by the door, waiting for tables.  I felt bad for the folks sitting near the door because they must be feeling the pressure to eat quickly... We ordered a plain wonton (not so good), Hainan Chicken - white meat (delicious), char Sui & roast pork (very good).  The comfort food really hit the spot & the prices were very reasonable.   Too bad they only have iced milk tea because I preferred the hot milk tea.  I will come back.

aD4gcObmng3Vn2W2imjc6w.text: If you're the kind of person that judges a restaurant's "authenticity" based on their customers, you'll love this place. There wasn't a round-eye to be seen anywhere. People starting filing in around 11 for lunch. I ordered the roasted pork belly over rice. The portion size was large and it was everything I thought it was going to be -- tender chunks of fatty pork with crispy skin on top of a huge helping of rice. It was excellent all the way around.  It's CASH ONLY! and it's also closed on Fridays. I thought I had enough cash on me but was a dollar short. I read other reviews where the dish was $5.50. Now it's $6.50. So, I had to find an ATM. Luckily, there was a Bank of America a block south.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. roast pork belly over rice
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ptlaw24Lswo88Gkd__bfgw.text: Best Chinese BBQ spot in Vegas.  No fancy gimmicks or nice decor. Straight to the point good food.  The broth always comes out extra hot and their pork belly and duck are always a hit for me.  Noodles never come out over cooked like other places I've been too and they are not shy with the portions.  Its just always so busy there (which is good for them).

TcSRYaAL00WohTfg1ocCew.text: I love eating here. Reminds me of home cooked meals. Not a fan of their small portion sized meals. But the food still taste great! Best place to get a roasted Duck and porridge. They only take CASH. A little packed in restaurant also.

c7_Wt4a6Z689bjIxxLRzMQ.text: I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this place yet. It's a hole in the wall restaurant, but all locals know about it. Serving authentic Chinese food from roasted duck/pork, fried rice, and noodles. This place also won't break your bank...especially if you lost your pants off in Vegas. A party of 6 usually only totals out to 40 bucks so it is very affordable. Favorites are: duck noodle soup, 2 BBQ choice with rice BBQ pork and duck(ask for extra sauce for the rice you won't regret it).

Oq1juxPEoRZf8Wk5MddfxA.text: I had a plate with roast duck, roast pork, rice and veg.  This place is like a quick service place.  Everything is fast here!  You get a table fast, you order fast, waitresses move fast and people eat fast.    I like the prices too.    The roast duck was good - I am not expert but I liked it.  The roast pork was so damn good.  I almost ordered more!  I have never had that before and I can say I want to go back just for that.    This place does what they do very well.  I appreciate a place that knows what it is and does it well!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UmvUBm804ZvO8aPv7b_kZA.text: Very good Chinese BBQ!  It's a good place to eat with family & friends!. The inside is small place, but people keeps on coming.  Wow,  the BBQ Pork Belly is so so good & very very crispy & crunchy!!

7ohLXpjhWzKy6-meNGFWNA.text: So great. Excellent Hong Kong style BBQ duck and pork. The staff are super helpful and  suggested sauteed pea shoots as a vegetable. It was the best. I can't wait to go here again.  Cash only. Place is super clean

5kZSlmuaHkJLpN5E8RFIBw.text: Can't go wrong with fried tofu, roast duck and xo noodle. Everything is so favorable reminds me of China town Honolulu.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Xo noodles

8R2PwmBm_0GPmihndww-WA.text: It's good! The cha siu (BBQ pork) is one of the better ones I've had in the States. The pieces are smaller and more tender. The downside is the sauce is more like traditional soy sauce rather than the thicker cha siu sauce that other places have... and you don't get enough sauce on the rice. Not as good as HK or Vancouver, but better than many of the places in LA. Definitely would come back!

kgq67kCXW7zRwQOYP0uxGw.text: If you're looking for excellent roast pork, bbq pork, or roast duck, this is the place to find it.  The roast pork is cooked well, the skin is crunchy to perfection; while the bbq pork has just the right flavoring without being overwhelming or seemingly artificial.  The roast duck also is just perfectly juicy and delicious without a hint of being gamey or even tough.  Be aware, this is also your typical chinese spot.  It's also very busy.  At best it's like a zoo, at worst, a complete cluster.  If you can, I suggest a to-go order.  But if you're brave and willing to give it a shot, snag a table.  Sure, someone might jump ahead of you in the queue but that's par for the course.  Service is utter crap but you're not here for fine dining and to be treated like royalty.  You're here for the awesome meat to feast upon and then get out.

IOHopMZjZnG2_n-IoZjqHw.text: Wow, A  rare find in Vegas. Authentic Hong Kong BBQ Cuisine at a very affordable prices. The gem of Las Vegas Chinatown. It's small, but clean, the wallpaper is green and yellow which makes it kind of cheesy but yet it matches with their theme and framed art. Down the street , Orchid Garden Chinese restaurant wanted $6 for a small plate of Chinese greens! Here at Asian BBQ, it's only $3!!  Delicious roast duck, bbq pork with crunchy skin. Pan fried udon was delicious. You can order their small plates of items for $3 a plate. Hainame chicken rice is so yummy, you'll hate that it's a carb. Wonton noodle soup,   Friendly customer service unlike (BBQ King= customer service is horrible), delicious food and Cash Only. Thanks LV yelpers, due to your high ratings we found this place! No more BBQ King!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dfWKl7sdFfZrC1NECO_DQA.text: One of the best Chinese restaurants I have been to! We went based on Yelp reviews. The restaurant is clean and staff are efficient. They have a great display of freshly made bbq roast pork, roast pork, roast duck. We ordered kai lan with oyster sauce, thick egg soup noodles with fried fish balls, a plate of bbq roast pork and beef on crispy noodles. Everything was very fresh and well presented. The chef who chopped the bbq pork appeared to take great pride in making sure each piece was chopped equally and arranged perfectly on the plate - he even came out to check we were happy. The restaurant clearly takes pride and cares about its food. Definitely worth a visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq roast pork
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef with crispy fried noodles
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thick egg soup noodles with fried fish balls

MZyxLDL3gkG0ZrtFveChBg.text: I came here with my fiance for lunch while on vacation in Vegas.  I found this place with the help of Yelp.  I saw the great reviews and had to try it.  This place is cash only and small.  Once you walk in you can tell you're going to have a good meal because everyone is chowing down and smiling. I decided to order the roasted duck and roasted pork combo with veggies.  It was delicious.  The pork was nice and crispy and the duck had a lot of flavor.  It was nice eating a simple meal.  My fiance had the wonton noodle soup with bbq pork.  He said his meal was enjoyable also.  Thanks yelp for helping me find a great place to eat while on vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck and roasted pork combo

_Fd9uG8w-lXPoCguKQNC5w.text: Everything I imagined from a HK noodle shop.  I'd say better than Sam woo.  So glad we stopped by.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Busy Monday at 1:50pm

N85OBDKndcaPHnaFaaz1qg.text: Roast duck and Roast pork are to die for! love going when I am in dire need of chinese BBQ!

54zj8UWc7GvVrmYZ2cn6LQ.text: Yummy food! Great for catering events. Last time they were two hours late making our catered food. We'll see how they do this time. Ordered roasted pork belly, combination fried rice, soy sauce chow fun, BBQ pork, and Chinese broccoli.

2K5XSgwBJA5q-SFJ_emX1w.text: This place failed to meet any expectation I had based on others' reviews. The roast duck was too greasy for words; came to the table literally drowning in grease (and I know duck is a greasy protein, this was ridiculous though). The won-ton soup tasted like fish, which is a first for me in any won-ton soup I've ever had. The pork belly was decent, but came out only lukewarm. The dry beef chow fun was the only edible item we received, and that was greasy and lacked flavor.  Maybe I just don't "get" authentic Chinese food, but the food here was just NOT good.   Based on the reviews, I thought I was in for a treat. I thought the same thing when I saw we were the only non-Asian people in the place. This place failed to live up to the hype, and I would NOT recommend it at all!

KxPp5GfbOhoWUah7x2Z2IA.text: Good comfort chinese food. When I'm craving for simple chinese food, this is the place to go. Simple combination fried rice, combination fried noodles and the best crispy roast belly pork. This place makes the best. You need to have cash cause they don't take credit card, close on Friday and it can get jam pack on the weekend but the wait is well worth it. The price is very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy belly roast pork!! This is the best
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination fried noodles
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination fried rice

uEUMY8H3YcbA2tJT8Mqh2Q.text: Extremely affordable, delicious meals.  The dish to order here is the combination 2 bbq plate for ~$7. I chose bbq pork and roast pork belly for the combo. The bbq pork was well flavored and the roast pork belly had a perfect crispness to it. The plate also came with veggies and rice with a sauce on top of it. Overall, a very nice deal.

kNUbmb2KGjfNS0II_dhrEw.text: My 3rd try at takeout from this place. I think I have it figured out. Do Not try to order from the cashier. She will not take your order and she will just ignore you. I don't think she can even speak English. Do flag down one of the waitress' as they swoop past you numerous times.  Their roast pork belly can be hit or miss. It usually is a hit and very good. Last time the roast pork was very fatty and not so crispy skin.

2JqPEZKCxcQMPoUAUpGt3w.text: How can you not love this place?  Other than the Somewhat brusque service, the food is delicious.  Perfectly prepared duck and pork belly.  Greens were excellent also.  Pricing

LJWzdlyI8zsLxP1xZlckhQ.text: In short, this place is AWESOME! We tried to go there on Monday but it was closed, but because of the recommendations we tried the following day. They speak both Vietnamese and Chinese so it was interesting for us to order in both languages and have the server understand both! Their roast pork is great as well as their Chinese broccoli. The seafood pan fried noodles were fantastic as well as the Roast Duck. The atmosphere is what I am familiar with meaning: loud conversations, hearing the kitchen chatter when the doors were moving due to the people transiting between the dining floor and kitchen. Overall, I really enjoyed eating and stopping by this establishment. I hope anyone who likes Chinese food stop by. No stereotype American Chinese/Vietnamese food here!

nKInS9ir0mOv7hRrr55qiA.text: Service is fukin Terrible . Foods is great !! These waiters and waitress don't deserve Tips at all !!!!!!

eFtb6pnVhzyojwkJfBTaIA.text: OMG!  The closest Restaurant that we go to in Chicago.  Hands down the only place that we've gone to that the food was as good as Seven Treasures.  And you know its authentic when all the customers are asian.  It'a very clean and staff are friendly.  We will definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chow mein
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun with gravy
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken with egg noodle soup

fAflbIGMjzOhtzLcnkVbsQ.text: You are a fool if you like Chinese food and don't go to this place.  BEST CHINESE FOOD in the US.  PERIOD.  You don't come here for the service or ambiance.  This isn't Morton's.  It's Chinese food at its best.  What more do you want?

O0ZB9S6TdqFKNOVdPa_cNg.text: Food was delicious however the portion is small and pricey for what you get. We ordered BBQ on Rice dishes. Their roast pork is awesome! Their roast duck is ok (taste is good but lack of meat). Service was just average.

6aNOuICmqDmUWtp7f_8bnQ.text: We stop here on the first day of our Vegas trip and the food was great. The duck was perfectly done and the wonton are delicious. Will go here again when I come back the next. Great food at anytime of the day.

Bnq2q7rZW5VPBt5An3yJaw.text: First time we've been here on a Sat at 10:30am. The place got crowded very quickly. Like everyone else, we enjoyed their roasted pork and duck. Their noodle and broth were just okay. We will definitely come back for the BBQ items. Too bad they close on Friday.

zqx4vE_PfphXlVeTmQl8ng.text: Combo duck and pig on rice.  Good, and nice large portion.  While it was good and I liked it I don't think the roast duck and roast pig are as special as others make it sound - well maybe it is for LV.  It tasted about the same as in any good Chinese deli, and I think some of my favorite places are even better.  Still, 4 stars and I'd definitely come here again. And I definitely liked it better than last year.

dcl0LnUVQ0FD0LtyxNe46A.text: So far all my visits here have been consistently good. One of my favorite Chinese restaurants. Roast Pork Belly and dry Chow Fun are my favorite dishes here. Good food for a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1lb of roasted pork belly
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Chow Fun (dry)

ZkPNw9XLwDd0bEmhix1K8Q.text: I have to give it 5 stars for what it is and what I ate. My guy server really didn't understand me and in turn, I have no idea what he was ranting about. Something about fried rice, which I had no interest in at the time, something about a prime rib buffet, Honestly, I do not know, but we got the right food and it was on point!    We originally were taking food to go. Our kind gentleman server informed us that the roasted duck was going to be another 20 minutes, my husband wanted that duck,  Bad! So we waited and ordered food to eat in, in the mean time.   We ordered won ton soup with pork belly instead of duck, we also ordered pork ribs. and fish balls. Before the food got there, I realized we didn't not have enough cash for my husbands hunger and cravings. My husband orders food like he's on death row.  I proceeded to go to BOA , just down the road. (It's cash only) OK, so by the time I came back, my husband and my 6 year old daughter decided since they ate all the pork belly that they needed to order another one before I got there. They were raving about how great it was, my husband was in a pig heaven sort of a trance and my daughter was hoarding pork on her side of the table. Seriously, my husband was in awe of the pork belly. I have never seen him so excited and patiently waiting his duck. "Ingrid, please come look at the pork with me??" "No. Andrew, I can see the pork from here." Look at it, look at it, please!!"? "It's OK, I can see it, Andrew." That was our bbq banter. He finally gave up and decided to go stare at the glass of hanging meat and drool. If you cant tell, he really loved that pork belly!! And he was right to love it. It had a perfect crispy skin, tasty pork and not overly fatty.  The fish balls with curry sauce were good. We had to get 2 orders because my daughter did not want sauce. We ended taking most of them home. They were good, just not great. The soup was a super large portion and was pretty good, clean tasting and the noodles and won tons were not soggy and pretty perfect.   My daughter wanted rice so we got a small side of rice and they brought out some kind of duck sauce. I absolutely loved that sauce and the rice was perfectly cooked. By the way, the lady who brought out the rice was so kind and polite. To go we ordered the 3 meat combo for 12.99, I believe.  Since my husband realized it did not come with rice, he ordered a duck and rice combo for 6.99. Needless to say, yes this is a pretty inexpensive place, but the fact that my husband has no self control when it comes to pork, our bill was about 49.00 dollars, 10 dollar tip, but we had so much food, enough for his late night munchies and lunch AND dinner the next day. It was an excellent value. We definitely will be back. It was yummy!!

PTw9ju63h9bBUdiG0UTAMg.text: This place had everything I wanted in an old skool Chinatown restaurant, you got your roast duck, roast pork, BBQ pork, they even had pork intestines! I was in heaven, I probably enjoyed this place more than my friends, but I didn't care, this was my pick for the trip and I loved every minute of it.

DRe_aiCEQIt7-RoU0dV3qg.text: Tung Ky - Chinese noodle restaurant with average check of $15. They have awesome meats and noodle soup especially the duck and bacon. Their side orders are at a really reasonable price. After all, you can't complain about the food and price, it exceeded my expectation yet the service is really bad. They don't have attitude or anything, it's just when you compare this to other restaurant, service here would be an D or D+ I guess. However, the price and tasty food really encourage me to give this restaurant a 4.

KHHTIE1HXsS7jYZJXrimcg.text: Bomb.com chinese noodle soup. The duck, roasted pork, and other items are good too. The portion they give are (good and cheap). My 2 favorite words. :)

UBH17G2d3-i7LBUWQr8PkQ.text: Decent selection and service. Experienced better but still worth the visit. Be advised this is a cash only establishment so be sure to bring your cash as plastic is worthless regardless of your spending limit.

-vmTHRHb5y41vHeU3ODkyA.text: I think for the price this food was reasonable but I wasn't exactly impressed.  It was good but my date and myself agreed that the noodles weren't as good as we had eaten at other places.  I don't think that it is fair to give it a bad review but I also thought that the menu was kind of hard to understand.  Maybe it was because it was my first time there but it wasn't really straight forward to me.  Service was standard, nothing out of the ordinary.

zLG1LBGHY6i19e6muw0Omg.text: Get the roast pork for sure you won't be disappointed.  Nice and flavorful (unlike some places where the pork isn't tasty and you know they probably parboiled it) and with the good skin.  Char Siu was ok but as a Hawaii transplant it still feels different.  I think  I'm gonna give this place a 4 simply because even though the pork dishes are obviously tasty and well marinated, it wasn't straight from the roaster (as opposed to say if you went to Chinatown and got some fresh roast pork and char siu right before lunchtime...they're still hot and juicy inside.... mm that's hard to beat)  Anyways, we were here for dinner.  we also tried the ribs, ginger chicken,  shrimp fried rice, and some bok choi.  Ok, standard..  Pretty inexpensive tho so overall it's pretty good.  It's clear that the pork is the key here (as if all the pork hanging up in that case with a guy chopping his cleaver constantly isn't a clear sign)    Probably will come back again sometime to try the kau yuk and roast duck.  But if you want some roast pork (maybe you can call or something to see if they just put some out?) then this is a good place to hit up.

M_BVAE3ZoOTvOJLZJWSm_A.text: Roast duck, roast pork, and char siu!!  It doesn't get any better than Asian BBQ & Noodles.  I'm not just talking about Las Vegas, it beats places in Hawaii, LA, and SF!!  I know this is a bold statement, but this place is the best I have been to.  The roast duck is succulent, juicy, and done to perfection.  Even the Jus that comes with the duck tastes awesome.  I don't know what blend of spices they use, but it is mouthwateringly delicious.  The best part is, its not overly greasy and oily like duck from other places.  I don't feel as if my arteries are clogging as I'm eating.  The roast pork is divine.  The skin is perfectly crunch, but not so thick that you chip a tooth (my dad did that once, not cool).  The pork is also seasoned with the same or similar spices as the duck.  First time I've had it done this way.  Adds an added flavor profile not found anywhere else!!  The char siu is very flavorful.  Sweet without being too sweet.  Some of the best char siu I've ever had.  Writing this review is making my mouth water.  There are many other dishes to try, but I have yet to sit down and try one of their noodle bowls.  One of these days, but for now I'm good with taking a duck to go.

jltT7DQ8KcqfkZu52ohruQ.text: Best Hong Kong style BBQ in town! This place is definitely local gem. My favorite dish es are roasted pork belly, spicy chicken feet, roasted duck shrimp dumpling noodle soup, beef porridge, and BBQ pork fried rice. They have the best roasted pork belly I ever tasted.  All their wontons and dumplings are freshly made. They don't make it till you order. Everything here is authentic and tasty with very reasonable price. I lived in Los Angles more than 14 years and I couldn't think of one single place which had better roasted pork belly than Asian BBQ& Noodles.

jR11NKj1MTLyG1kTb0DONw.text: The worst customer service. We sat waiting for 20 minutes and no one even came to take our order. We walked out. It doesn't even deserve a star.

VvV036b2UkB7Y37q165SKQ.text: My kids love this place and i think it is the best Chinese noodle place in Las Vegas. There are several choices of noodles and toppings.

Xvw3V9eztSL304T0VsRfzw.text: Came with my dad and his friends from Vancouver...all Chinese. We had the roast duck, roast pork, gai lan with oyster sauce, salted fish and chicken fried rice, and Singapore noodles. The group agreed that everything was as good as Vancouver's Chinese food and the roast duck was better than the best Chinese BBQ spots in Vancouver!

HBPl21Ziqx262T0UWecpXw.text: This is the place my wife and I visit at least two to three times whenever we are in Las Vegas. The wonton is comparable to Hong Kong. Roast Pork and Roast Duck are must. Service  is good and proficient. Beware of wait during meal hours; always crowded.

QkbxnaETQvhAt_LzAkV6PA.text: This restaurant is absolutely fantastic when it comes to Chinese bbq. When it comes to their meats like crispy pork, bbq pork, or roast duck there really isn't any place in town that makes it better.   Service here is actually pretty good every time I've been here considering Asian restaurants are known for terrible service.

Gh6Qd_vxtqeWHAqs2BVAtg.text: The food is authentic and the menu is diverse.  We had a great time. The staff is accommodating and we will definitely be back.

Yf1PIoMbqoXHNZOHp_WSTw.text: Went there last Sunday since I was craving for Chinese food. Tried this place out bec the ratings. When I came in,the smell reminds me of Hongkong which is very authentic. We ordered the roasted platter. $15 for small serving! I expected more. I couldve just ordered the rice topping for $7+ and get the same amt of meat. Love the roasted pork tho

4_DDSIyRwE2Yoxco12edIA.text: One of the surprise restaurant on our trip to Las Vegas. The bbq duck, and ginger chicken were as good as top restaurants in HK. Will come again! Recommend!!!

vMC65usQtCAQt1UaEOANmQ.text: Wow, this is the best Asian food that I have had in Las Vegas and some of the best that I have ever had in the state. I can't think of anything better right now. It is authentic the duck is excellent the only thing is they only take cash, but that is overlooked due to the quality of the food.

4J9i3VzyxwRouQrKxPae4A.text: Every time we come to Las Vegas, we stop here for a meal before we drive home to LA.  The food is ok.  The prices are reasonable, but they don't give a lot of food.  My husband had the beef stew wonton noodle soup and I had the beef stomach, beef stew with vermicelli noodle soup.  My noodles were a bit hard.  I prefer if the noodles were cook an extra few minutes.  My husband did not have enough food, so I gave him some of my food.   I would come back, but order something else.   Last time, we order chow fun and chow mein.  That was worth the money, but not the noodle soup. The service is a bit slow.  The restaurant was not crowded.  Only 5 tables of customers.  The food should have been out in less than 10 minutes.  We waited over 20 minutes for our food.

Kirpt-gFUF_tdlkCRPiIzA.text: Delicious!  The pork belly was so crispy and the skin doesn't separate from the meat so you get crispy goodness with every bite.  The pig ears were also delicious, crunchy and smokey and perfect to go with our wonton soup with duck.  Makes me want to live in Las Vegas.

yYJ-d4ifiJRGj1X6sBAypQ.text: Overall really good and authentic food!  We got crispy duck and it was solid.  Definitely recommend.

HoxdclvVqC8ZHmUFP0yL8Q.text: This place has a lot to surprise me.  First, I've been residing in Vegas for almost 6 years, yet I just found this place.    Second, when I stepped in the restaurant, I got a really warm welcome and great services, which is totally unexpected from Chinese restos.  Woow, this is a check!  The speed was right.  I did not have to wait forever to get my food.  Also, the food was fantastic.  I had shrimp dumpling soup, gai lan with oyster sauce, roasted duck, bbq pork and crispy pork.  Everything was served at the right taste, neither too salty nor too oily.  The only downside would be the temperature of the pork and the duck.  I wished they had been served at the right temperature.  Whatsoever!  They were all yummy.  The thing that strikes me most about this place is how polite the staff are.  This is not a noisy, yelling-based Chinese restaurant, which gives this place a big PLUS ++++.  I love Asian BBQ!!!

XJkLgA84UOv3AOzqt76jeA.text: This place really made me sad I had high hopes for this place I really did. I got the Roast pork which a lot of people seem to order. When it came out with the rice it was cold, the rice was warm but it was not its like it had been sitting out all day. We got there at 2 o'clock just after the lunch crowed should have gotten out. The crispy skin was nice but i was turned off by the smell of the place and how the food was cold.

B6Z5vbmmlGxkzY0huDZzNA.text: Worst service ever, we have wheelchair lady here. And the old waiter just ignore us let many people in front of us seated first. We told him we are came before those people but he ignore us. This is discriminate handicapped

IJxFtIunTr8XU0D8URaDtg.text: Why do people complain about the service they get, or don't get, when eating at an Asian restaurant?    I don't know either.  What I do know... I don't eat at an Asian restaurant for the service.  No, I go for the food.  I do not expect any service at all.  If anything, I expect to get terrible service.     Ok, This  place is the sheeeeet!!!!!  I have had roasted duck on my travels across the globe... This place has the best!  That's right.  The best "Roasted Duck".  Not to take anything away from the other BBQ offerings, but the duck was a total stand out.  And who would have thought the best duck would be in Vegas.  Impressive to say the least.  But I've seen many great places come and go in Las Vegas.  One spot that comes to mind, "Shanghi Noon" next to Pho Kim Long.  I miss that guy's noodles so much.  I wish I knew where he went because I am sure he's making noodles somewhere.  Then there was the Vietnamese restaurant on Spring Mtn. & kissing the 15.  He had the best cat fish & pineapple soup noodle.    So, moral of the story, enjoy these places while they are around because these little gems do fizzle out, eventually.

3tKJcYwJflvZt9Go3hceUg.text: I have had the roasted duck, pork belly and char siu combo everytime I have come here. Each time the duck and pork belly have really provided the wow factor in terms of taste and texture. The char siu has been ok and I think I get it more out of nostalgia. I had the seafood with crispy noodle. The calamari was tender and the noodle was crispy at the edges and soft and juicy towards the center. The fried seafood balls were ok but nothing special. The seafood noodles had some of the fried seafood balls and it tasted much better in there. The choi sum was cooked perfectly. It had a nice crunch but didn't taste raw. Really though, I got it just to make myself think I was eating a little bit healthy.

j_iD8VSY3Z3j1LzCY3tHvg.text: My brother told me that he found a cheap Chinese dive in Vegas and he is usually pretty good when it comes to assessing restaurants.  First thing you noticed is that this is a walk up counter.  If you are overwhelmed with large Chinese menus, then try doing that when the menu is posted on the wall.  Having said that, we figured what we wanted and made our orders.  I have to admit, it was delicious.  It is better than any casino Chinese restaurant and you'll have to drive to it, but I think you will like it too.

EabnLt2Gca5r5gSoW_u_kQ.text: Asian BBQ & Noodles serves up the best roasted pork belly and duck I've had in Vegas. It's on my monthly rotation and I've rarely been disappointed. Order the combo special (with both meats) and extra sauce on the rice. They also serve up some tasty, perfectly al dente egg noodles dry or soup style.  TIP: They are closed on Fridays.   Gosh, I wish they were open on the Friday! Sometimes a gal just wants tasty BBQ and noodles for date night.

yrnUTc60np0MGehbRJkecQ.text: I would give this place 0 star if I could. 0 customer service. The manager (or owner) only care you already pay or not. I have been waiting over 30 minuets my to go food(BBQ 2 combo w/rice, spicy pig ear and noodles) Wast time and money. NEVER come back.

AYwOJ-5afQq7ShfA34inqw.text: Perfect start to our date night. Crispy pork, BBQ pork, ginger chicken, choysum and beef chow fun- here we come!!

eR31WBeHmgpRMIrCa2mu5w.text: A great find in Las Vegas! Reasonably inexpensive & delicious.  Parking was easy (Sunday lunch time).  We arrived & there were only 2 groups of ppl before us, so the wait was only short (5 mins).  Ordered a combination platter of bbq pork, roast duck & roast pork, wonton soup, wide egg noodle with fried tofu & curry fishball - they were all well above our expectation.  We especially love the bbq/roast combination & wide egg noodle. The skin of roast pork was crispy & tasty, the pork was moist, roast duck was fragrant.  The noodle was al dente & sauce (oyster sauce??) was tasty, simply delicious. Service was fast. It's a very typical cantonese/Hong Kong bbq style restaurant which we love.  Great food, fast service, unpretentious, ohh and it's cash only.
