fpMbR9EApZJR-urWi3McyA.text: Consistently good roasted meats.  Soups tend to be salty.  Beef chow fun almost had beef in it.  Yes, there is msg even in the boiled vegetables.  It's also cheap and tasty.  This is how I like my Chinatown.  PS. I forget that it's Cash Only, every time.  I think it's the msg.

EobMZtdL31cVfmVBfhyLlA.text: Cash only and the place is small, so it gets crowded pretty quickly.  Got the duck wonton noodle soup.  You can choose from a variety of noodles, so I chose the thin Chinese Egg Noodles - they were pretty bland.  The wontons were really tasty, though.  The duck was flavorful as well, but it only came with a few pieces and most were bone.  Friends got different soups as well - they have a combo where you can choose one to three different toppings (but most were things I don't eat like chicken feet, intestines, etc) on dry or soupy noodles.  Do not get the coffee here - it's from a powdered mix and they do not use condensed milk.  I was really disappointed - what a waste of $3.  Overall, a good place if you're craving some noodle soup - the place is Viet/Chinese.

5w097W-iAMStfqV6SBpNgw.text: This kind of Asian restaurants made me regret moving away from Vegas.   My folks were tired of their tourist group dinners after traveling in the US for 10 days and just wanted something light and homey. So, being the wonderful daughter I am, I snuck them out in the dark and off to the Chinatown.   Asian BBQ & Noodles must be a relatively new establishment since I don't recall seeing it in the same strip mall where HK Star is at, which I visited a few times in my Vegas days.    The waitress greeted us in Cantonese without hesitation, and I knew we were in for some authentic Cantonese delicacies. The menu items are similar to what you would get in many great small eateries in the back alleys of Guangzhou or Hong Kong.   To address my folks' distressed stomachs, I ordered boiled baby bok choy with oyster sauce, pickled daikon radish, one of the speciality rice porridges and plain rice noodle soup. They were all nicely done and so very comforting. Since Cantonese Style Rotisserie (or BBQ if you are not too hung up on the strict definition) is their speciality, I could not resist the roasted pork belly and it was near perfection. They ran out of roasted duck before we had the chance to try it.   It was around 8PM on a week day and this place was packed with Asian patrons. Service was casual but very efficient. Cash only.   I have never had a better meal for the tiny amount of money we spent. My folks were so proud of me that they have forgiven me for all the headaches and disappointments I have brought them.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boiled Baby Bok Choy with Oyster Sauce: very limited amount of oil used if any
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Congee with Ginkgo biloba and bean curd skin: enough for 3-4 people
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pickled Daikon Radish

OqxYs8lWiaPzggqdAJL5cQ.text: The ultimate Asian cheap eats joint in Las Vegas that delivers on every level.  Authenticity- here you will find old school Hong Kong barbecue where the meats are hanging off the racks  with oil dripping off their skin like LeBron James sweating in the 4th quarter leaving behind a beautiful glistening sheen enveloping juicy meat-tastic goodness that is sliced to order.  If you are rusty on your Chinese, be prepared to point at the numbers of each food item you are interested in partaking.   Texture- nice chewy noodles in their soups, perfectly fried skin cradling the underside of an entire backside of pork belly, the appropriate amount of spring to their wontons and fishballs, they definitely get it right with every bite.  Flavor-  No dish is subtle as each ingredient provides depth of flavor yet avoids becoming overpowering.  The wonton noodle soup is well balanced in terms of it's fish-stock like broth yet a dash of red vinegar or chili oil is permissible if not encouraged.  The meats are well seasoned to be eaten straight up but for added layers of flavor explosion, virtually all are accompanied by their own appropriate dipping sauce.  Even the rice that accompanies the bbq dishes and the hainanese chicken are packed with additional notes of spice and seasoning.     Value- A friend and I paid 4.99 for a steaming bowl of wonton noodle soup (6.99 to add some generous pieces of duck), 6.99 for a combination barbecue rice plate (seasoned rice, chinese greens, and freshly chopped roasted duck and fried pork belly) and 3 dollars for chinese broccoli coated with oyster sauce.  We had a smorgasbord of street eats before us that left us more than adequately stuffed for less than 15 bucks/person.  With my parents and their friends retired in Vegas, this is their go-to place for a nice thrifty meal or to purchase takeout meats for their potluck dinners.    Come hungry, bring cash, and leave happy.

jMHJPWEbTk1r00ck6HWnCA.text: Walking in, I noticed a slightly small, crammed space still with tables available around 7PM on a Tuesday. In the middle of the space is the magical BBQ window with roast pig and duck hanging behind it, with staff busily shouting and chopping away like in a Chinese market (i.e. if you're looking for someplace legit, you have hit the jackpot without even having to make a bet!!) The staff speak Chinese and Vietnamese, and the menu is in those languages too! We ordered: -"hai san" chicken which is a small portion but appropriate for the low price -roast pork, which is cut up in very small pieces. The taste is not excellent but I will say it is very good and comforting. -congee with seafood. Again like the roast pork it's not excellent but it's pretty darn good for what it is. The portion size is also appropriate with the low price. -chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. For only $3.50 you get a very small, efficient portion which fed my party of three perfectly. You can always order two portions if you have a bigger party. Food was brought out very quickly, with the exception of our congee which our server warned us about wait time beforehand.  A nice perk of this restaurant is that although it reads "Cash Only" outside, there is also no tax added onto your check. I appreciate this gesture as they are passing on their own savings to their customers! I'll be back for sure next time in Vegas.

OAClsh91gjjC_6qKTZw92Q.text: Cheap eats. Had the rice toppings with white chicken and Ginger sauce.the chicken portion was not satisfying since the cut was thin and almost bony. The wanton soup was cheap for $3, has a dried fish taste to it. Would go back to try their noodles. Next time. So much to sample and taste when you are in Vegas.can't be in the same place 2x.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck

um9A0sfMF_hybyZprtZ71w.text: Be prepared to wait if you're going during lunch time.    I ordered the 2 BBQ choices(roast pork and BBQ pork) with rice combo. The roast pork was a little too salty for me.  The BBQ pork was much better in my opinion but it is a little sweet.  The rice was cooked perfectly and they drizzle a little sauce onto it.  They also gave a bowl of soup for each order of rice which tasted okay.    We ordered a side of spicy pork ear which sounds nasty but it was good and definitely worth a try.  The roast pork noodles didn't look too appetizing.  The noodles looked a little discolored.

5jjUO8SFSPXhn53DCcNe-w.text: The family and I decided to come here after reading the Yelp reviews.  Yelpers can't be wrong can they?   When we arrived, we discovered that we went to the 8th best Chinese restaurant in America (for 2011)!   Really?  That is what their signs stated.  They had signs everywhere saying they were #8.   Between the Yelp reviews and the their award for being the #8 Chinese restaurant in the USA, we couldn't be wrong.     The owner of the restaurant is a genius for jumping on the pork belly bandwagon.  This is the only place that I have seen that hangs roasted pork belly instead of a whole pig.  Is it the best that I have had?  No.  But, it was good.   We also tried their duck.  Their roast duck was had a good flavor, but, did not have much meat on it.    Their noodle soups and lo mein (dry noodles) were good.  The soup was decent.  Their lo mein which comes with a special sauce, and costs $1 more than the soup noodles.  Wontons were good.  The only complaint I have is that they do not give enough noodles.  Even my 8 year old daughter finished a bowl of noodles all by herself.  She normally is a very small eater.    Overall, this is a pretty good Chinese restaurant.  Yelpers were not wrong with this one.  When I go to Vegas again, I need to come back to this place.    Edit 4/12/13  Asian BBQ & Noodle is better than the Chinese BBQ and won ton noodle joints in the East San Gabriel Valley.  They beat the Rowland Heights Sam Woo.  Not sure how they compare to the same type of restaurants in Alhambra and Monterey Park.  It might be better than #8.  After comparing it to some of my local restaurants, I am going to upgrade them to 4 1/2 stars.

ncewk9DYZwlgO0FD5sJXrg.text: This is my go to place when I want bbq pork , duck or ramen. Cash only so bring plenty.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mom ordered bbq pork with rice. Seems to enjoy it.

2w-0YpiqnPcs2I_4NVYk3A.text: The food was delicious!   However, if you ask for hot tea be sure to specify that you want it with the kettle or else they will bring it to you in a plastic cup.  I'm not sure if they are trying to save the nice kettle sets, or if they don't understand that hot drinks can not be put in plastic because it can cause a health issue.   Every thing else was awesome!

1s3QJj0usYvyoXG1llkcYQ.text: Came for the roast pig and roast duck. The food is amazing, as for the restaurant itself is no frills. Green wallpaper and a togo buffet counter. Beware this place is cash only.

G0xx9kQp4z8lRNJgccTUdw.text: I came with a large group of friends.  We were all pleasantly surprised from the quality of food.  The noodle soup dishes were amazing, but the bbq items are a must.  The roast duck was also delicious.  The food here is flavorful.  You can't beat the prices too.  Cash only.

2Lz20Sh0yzAHqEpO8SOd0w.text: So I came here because of the good reviews. I ordered BBQ Pork and Duck and the Waiter says there's no Pork. 5 minutes later there is more  BBQ Pork. He didn't even check to see if there was more coming up. Second we get our food and both of the BBQ combination plates were served with cold meat Lol. I had to ask them to reheat our food. Absolutely terrible customer service and the food was not great even mildly warm. You will probably get better service if you are Asian tho who knows.

HYTyrmwaHn-idlPc0vAzCg.text: Best roasted duck in town!! Try many places but this place has the most flavorful duck!. Also try the duck soup yummy!

Lx5XUbUKR_jjNOWNIfaJ6Q.text: If you're coming here for customer service, you are in the wrong place, honey.    That damn roast duck alone is worth my driving ...with a fever....in the rain....to get cash at the ATM (once I learned it was only cash only) 10 minutes down the road and back.   I ordered the duck wonton soup to ease the fever I was hosting that day. And the BBQ pork and duck plate was for my boyfriend.   The soup was fairly salty, as all duck soups tend to be. Won ton was average. But, that crispy fatty duck was soooooooooooooo worth every every single non customer service stares I got that day.   I absolutely loved it.   The BBQ pork was off the hook, too.   Maybe it was the fact that I haven't had either dish since moving out of Hawaii but, boy oh boy...I'm glad I was sick and saw that on someone's IG feed.   I went back the next day to have more duck. Did I mention I was eating alone?  It was that good, I couldn't wait till someone got off work to eat with me. SOLO-DOLO is fine with me when food is that yummy.

n6hYa3e1fGazBk6_7hKDHA.text: Best bbq noodle and congee place in LV. The BBQ pork and roast pork is on point, the best you can get in Vegas. Not as good as LA, SF or Hong Kong, but good enough. The cart soup noodles can be outstanding; you basically choose three toppings and your choice of noodles. If you choose the right toppings, the flavors really meld together nicely.  Recommend the brisket, curry fish balls, pork skin, among others. The congee was tasty. The wonton noodles are just OK. The pan fried noodles were done right; crispy on both sides. I usually come by this place every time I'm in Vegas, and judging by the wait times, others like the place as much as I do.

9Hg-UFwfNGIT9vlvOxvyRQ.text: Definitely THE cantonese style traditional bbq place, with bbq pork, roast duck, fried pork.  It's very authentic tasting and probably the best in terms of taste and quality.  The quantity can be desired though as servings are very similar to Hong Kong!   We're Americans!  We need large portions Please!  (so i can take some home and savor it later)

x4fx8HcZaGoh7voN_coDGQ.text: Sunday Brunch Chinese style!! Order family style with 2-3 plate combo to share. The minute you enter this restaurant, the fragrance of Roast Duck teases your senses and appetite. Well divided menu arranged per style of noodle, soups, and vegetables. We lucked out at 1115 without a wait to be seated. Opens at 1000. CASH only and closed Friday! Staff is friendly, patient with answering questions, speaks English and Cantonese. Taxi from the Bellagio to the door was $18 without tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup &amp; Roast Duck/Roast Pork Combo plate.

GVjx8kF8aSMSco6nsyOVuw.text: I love this place but cash only makes me suspicious on how much tax fraud are they committing. It's 2018, almost 2019 and no one there has heard of a credit card.

GDi_z4z9Gei2U1Ra9oDi_A.text: I have been here more than a handful of times and the food has been great each time. Every time I have to get the noodle soup. So many options, from the noodle choice to the meat choice. I have had the BBQ pork (which has a slight sweetness to it), roast duck, pork belly, and chicken. All were good. I have also had all of them on their own (not in soup).  A bowl of soup will set you back about $10. Always a must is the Chinese broccoli. It is so sweet, tender yet crunchy, and so good for you. The price is $4.50. They are closed on Fridays so obviously don't go on that day, but if you do there are plenty of other great spots to eat in that shopping plaza. They get crowded at lunch time and you will have to wait for a seat, as the occupancy is only 50 people.

udAJWibpjyjMtkCkA16C0g.text: The place was extremely crowded for dinner and the wait was about thirty minutes.  We ordered curry tendon and beef stew combo over rice.  Very skimpy portion, honestly not worth $8.50.   We were told that roast pork was sold out later to find out it was available again much later when the table next door placed the order.  We also ordered combo seafood Hong Kong style crispy noodle but not much seafood and much more greens instead.  Roast duck rice was good although the duck was extremely fatty.  Service was ok.

HmojECDw24B-zL8e0fd-wQ.text: This is still my go to place whenever I'm in Vegas. Their bbq items are tasty and you get generous portions when ordering from the menu. I introduced my brother to this place since he lives here now and it's become one of his favs also! Large menu to choose from, you can't go wrong!

b-7vcwjoYNSAIgAsqBSAKw.text: My chef cousin recommended this place because i told him i'm craving for really crispy pork.  And was actually going to Vegas for vacation so marked it as a must try.   Located in China Town in the corner of this plaza. The place isn't big but sure was crowded. My friends and I ordered crispy noodle, two plates of fried noodles and BBQ pork/Crispy pork. I thought the combination pick two or three was on the pricier side compare to other similar restaurant.But everything else in combine is still pretty cheap especially when you're eating in Vegas.  Crispy pork def did not disappoint me. The skin was nicely roasted, crispy and flavorful. Meat isn't dry at all! Pair with the crispy pork sauce. It fulfilled my taste bud for the month. I regret not to pack some back home.   We got vegetable noodle and seafood noodle. Both were good and not too oily. Thought the portion was not as big but still pretty fulfilling.   Crispy pork was def one of the highlight of my Vegas trip!! I will come back next time to try more + crispy pork when I visit!!!

PDIfPfFtJNpQI1HuUGIZFQ.text: I absolutely love this place! It has been over 3 years since I have come here, and the food is just as good as it has always been.  They are always packed anytime I've come here.  Yes, it is Cash Only and it's about $8-$12 per meal, but the meals are seriously big enough to feed 3 people!  Bring your appetite!

2TKXhb6M4xslSxlQ3c0bew.text: Terrible service. Absolutely terrible. I've come to this restaurant to eat many many times. Today I ordered the food to go because we are going to be watching a show on TV and wanted to have some comforting food. There was barely anyone in the restaurant because I went there early. When the food came out, I asked for 4 sets of Chopsticks and plates since we have 4 people, the lady at the cashier register told me we are too wasteful, why don't we just use the two sets of Chopsticks and spoons for your 4 people.  I ask her how is that even sanitary and it is extremely inconvenient. We purchased nearly $50 worth of food and she cannot spare two more sets of Chopsticks and to go plates? The worst part is she was telling me then don't go eat there.  Wow, really? I feel stupid that I even recommended this restaurant to several of my friends who visit Las Vegas. Their customer service is never top-notch but my experience today was truly unpleasant.

ZGx57h1xD6xxpEHcXrFNdQ.text: I'm so sorry but some of our family got MSG attack from the food. Super unhealthy. My family likes this place, I don't.  Sorry, we decided that we won't be back.

e31S-zGnxLUUltkYY9JAdg.text: This is a legit Chinese BBQ joint! I love the ribs here, it's nice and sweet, just the way I like them!  True Cantonese style.  My family loves the roast duck and chicken, reminds us of Big Wongs in New York City, legit!  They are closed on Fridays and they only take cash.

8cfX7UxiiuMkq5ZQy7Evvg.text: This place has amazing Asian BBQ.  The BBQ Pork and roasted pork is perfection.  The roast duck however was overcooked somewhat, so it was good but a tad on the dry side.  The congee (rice soup) sliced pork and preserved egg was very good and had tasty flavors.  The wonton egg noodle soup was very good too.  The soup base had it going on!  The service was good, especially if you spoke Cantonese with them.  Just one small con - I was barely able to slide into my seat, it was so small.  But def get there early, it is packed and the food goes quick.  Was there by noon and they were out of the fried bread sticks already.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton egg noodles
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork and preserved egg with congee
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish ball with ho fun noodle

EQSQPGQPSwn-RnEw4qujdA.text: My family was looking for some authentic Chinese noodles and BBQ and Im so happy we came here! If you are looking for some wholesome chinese food that feels like home, this is the place to be! Its tucked away in a plaza and is a little small and there might be a wait but its worth it!   Pros: - We ordered so much food here! We had there rice noodle stir fry that was definitely a favorite of mine! I love the oil and grease on it cause thats how its supposed to be served! The beef and shrimp went perfectly with the dish!  -  I love egg noodle soup with wontons so I orders a bowl for myself! Wontons were very flavorful and delicious and not overcooked. The broth was a perfect balance of sweet and salty and the meatballs were tender as well!  - We had order the BBQ pork which was amazing!! I loved the crispy skin and fatty meat which just fell apart in your mouth. This dish is a definite must when you come here! It also comes with a side of sauce which I didnt prefer but give it a try!  - The BBQ duck was on POINT! The skin was glistening from the flavor and sauce and the meat was so tender and juicy! Not dry at all and the skin was light crispy! Loved the dipping sauce that came with it!   Mehs: None  Cons: None  Tip: Being asian, Im used to going to restaurants and having the staff barely talking to me and just keeping it short with the interaction. I dont mind that at all because I just want to order my food, eat, pay and leave. If you don't care about the employees asking you how your day was or if youve ever been here or what not, then yep this is your typical asian restaurant.  If youre not used to that, dont take it personally. they just want to serve you quickly and efficiently!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MxrAsvTa08da18qQmo9cAQ.text: We came here about a year ago with some friends who were from out of town, and they had recommended this place. Ironically, my wife and I had watched Okja the night before so she felt guilty when she saw the pigs and ducks being slow-roasted. She said that she would never eat pork again, but after being pressured into trying the roasted pork belly, she reverted back to eating pork again lolol. Shit, I don't blame her, because it was some of the best pork belly I've ever had! The cuts were thick. The skin was super crispy, and the meat was so moist, tender, and flavorful.  We also tried their duck and wonton egg noodle soup and fried rice. They were good but nothin memorable. But OMG that pork belly. I recently saw a picture of it, and I was inspired to write this review right now haha. For those of you who haven't tried this place, make sure to order the roasted pork belly.   Also, this place is CASH ONLY.

RWj_oSt9lD1iRiSac6PyfA.text: This was one of THE best Chinese BBQs I've had. And to think, in Las Vegas....  If you are with a group, highly recommend getting the combo BBQ. Includes roast duck, cha siu pork, and crispy pork skin. 3/3 were amazing. Not many places can succeed in doing all right!!!  Other items on their menu are standard - fried rice, noodles, congee, etc. If you don't get BBQ here, don't come here.  CASH ONLY.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo platter SO GOOD
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singaporean noodles

zhU-LMDuzxNkNZeEODpJSw.text: Bring cash as this is a cash only restaurant.  Be prepared to wait. They're usually busy but always fast. Lots of employees to handle the crowd.  Be sure to try the roast duck, roast pork, and shrimp dumplings. The shrimp dumplings (note: NOT the same as wontons) are just great. They're hearty and have the perfect crunchy yet soft texture. Take advantage of the hot chili oil on your table. The only complaint is that the bbq can sometimes be overly salty. After my meal I'll be super thirsty, so I don't eat here as often as I'd like.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck with rice
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck + rice dish. About $8

bdq44CASt8_t5y9LLhGwpQ.text: I'm not one to usually post a blah rating, but I guess I have to start somewhere. I placed my  order during the lunch rush, so I understand how there could have been a delay. What I don't get is that my order was relatively simple; fried rice, chow fun and chow main simple - yet I've been waiting 30+ minutes! Seriously, what the hell?! I get it, it's busy as hell,but how are people that are coming in and placing their orders after me getting their food first?! After for what seemed like an eternity, or spending a good time reflecting on my life choices up until that point, the food was ready to go.  Now for the food itself, or what I ordered at least. It was pretty damn good.  The pork fried rice was spot on! Not salty or too oily, much different from any other Chinese food joint out here in the valley. As for the chow mein and chow fun, the balance between noodles and veggies complemented each other very well, very reminiscent of the quality you would get out in San Francisco - kudos!  To sum things up, the food is definitely great and is worth another visit. For my next visit, I'll more than likely dine in and not go when it's not so busy. I'm not willing to go through DMV style wait times because that's what DMV is for. One more note, bring cash! It's cash only!

SByIFqEUfiIeEexi1GYGIw.text: Good BBQ roast Duck. It is much better then Sam Woo. This is tiny place but clean and welcome

GJBFQ_guTG0zy8Oiblxkmg.text: They run out at night time of the bbq pork belly... because it is THAT good! When you go here you kinda need to know what you're in for. They are a fast place kind of place and need to seat and serve the next ones waiting in line. CASH ONLY. Don't forget. Parking is a disaster at peak times.

gnBmsXxkb20oJnJwNwbfOg.text: I think i might have to call BS! The accolades they proclaim are near identical to each and every banner displayed. The engaging signs all state that they made it top 8 of chinese restaurants in America. Humble in the sense that they claimed 8th and nothing higher. But there lies the problem, because the foundation which claims to hold these rankings and oversees the validity...is none existent and disbanded on the worldwide web. Don't fall victim to awards and celeb endorsements as they often mislead us but unless its a Michelin Star which I personally feel has the ultimate validity.   In terms of the shrimp shui gow soup and the fried rice I had...it was weak in flavor. But decently priced. I just have a bewildering time that any restuarant or business would blatantly boast its prestige. If anything they may have been duped. I would try it again but strictly for the Chinese bbq...looks promising.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 identical awards...I believe this smells like fishy and fraudulent like.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp shui gow noodle soup.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Packed house for lunch but if you give them a few minutes it cycles relatively quickly

b9SW1Zh61fd6LtCc0ePnog.text: I've visited a number of BBQ places in different cities. This one is on aggregate fairly average.  The good: it is authentic stuff. The flavor of the bbq pork and duck were right.  The bad: simply too expensive for what you get. $14 for about $9 worth of bbq, at least in terms of what I would get at my favorite place in Atlanta. Duck wasn't warm enough, either.   It is cash only, which is a pain. Overall, a forgettable experience.

BcfxjM3HnAdxsJznskNAHQ.text: It's my first time going there since my friends has highly recommended it.  I tried to call them to place to go order in advance but no one picked up, so I decided to go there directly.  We've waited for almost 50 mins for the fried rice.  Can you believe it? The lady who works at the counter ignored my friend's question on how much more time we need to wait just because she doesn't speak Cantonese.  After I complained, the other lady suggested me to call first, I told her I did but no one answered!   My points were, 1. if you know it takes time for the fried rice, why don't you just tell customers and let them decide if they want to wait or change the order? 2. If you don't pick up the phone, don't suggest customers to call first. 3. Don't be so rude to your customers!!  I'll never never never go there again even though it's highly recommended. I don't care if their pork belly is the best among those Chinese BBQ restaurants.  I bet they don't even care for losing one customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

seSfDfj09vYXN9E2HWhzFg.text: My family and I always refer to this restaurant as the "green room" or the "cash only place". I've been coming here since I was in high school and their food has always been consistently good. I will usually come here for their wonton noodle soup, it's simple and perfect for when I'm feeling under the weather. I also really like their bbq pork, chow fun, and fried rice.   The reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because I don't feel that it is the cleanest restaurant. They keep their chopsticks and spoons on the table to grab yourself and often times, I'll get one that has peculiar residue on it.

z1APCYo3c9avQB1_3sdJrg.text: 90 % Asians...  this must tell you something about this place, 1st CASH ONLY, 2ed CLOSED ON FRIDAYS... they gotta be good  to still be in business with those terms... The roast duck, roast pork and char siu was all great tasting dishes, 2011 rated  Top 100 Chinese Restaurants in the USA... Service OK, it was pretty full, they don't serve any alcohol, free parking in the complex

Food comes out quickly because it's already done and you can see the butcher chopping up the meat - think those Chinese bbq places that have the meat hanging. Oh and the honeycomb tripe! Really good. Clean. I recommend coming here.

g_daVnTwyDXxUaEHenmm4g.text: This review is only for their roasted pork belly! Holy moly it is so good! Juicy, tender, flavorful, crunchy!!! We got two pounds and it came to ~$33 and it was worth every penny.   Heads up this place is cash only so be sure to bring some with you! I am so glad we stopped by and we will definitely be back again when we're in town to try their other menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy roast pork goodness

hp6Pbnxn3fhB1kcIahkowA.text: This restaurant is Cash Only, but that does not stop us from dining here. Food is great & service is pretty awesome. I LOVE the donuts (butterfly bread). it's a small place, so seating can be a bit difficult at peak hours. There's no restaurant name sign other than the decal on the door, so it's a really nice secret find!

muQGe6kf8rVJZCUl_NqT0A.text: First time here and it didn't disappoint! The place is small and it's like a fast paced eatery. The menu is big, and there's more selections.. we didn't wait that long..once we got seated we ordered and the food came in so quickly, the server was attentive and came back twice to check on us. Pretty quick for our orders and it was delicious. I would like to try more of their food next time. The only thing I don't like is that they only take cash.. which I rarely bring cash with me otherwise it was a first good experience for me. And maybe because they have good food they can expand their resto.. it's cramped inside, simple and typical chines restaurant. Their utensils, plates are in the way, so the place is already crowded and small but they still put them in some walkways... that has to be some sanitary issue as well..!. Coz people can bump or Pass by to it. But with food. It's yummy l!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Belly Pork and BBQ pork combination! The veggies are good too

KM316T2Ajew7e7ZvjuNm2Q.text: Unfortunately the service here is horrible. And after waiting 40mins for my takeout order, they didn't give me the rice that came with my meal either. However the food was very tasty.

xnw86wXATkJ5SthcMDVSsQ.text: THEY ONLY TAKE CASH, CASH CASH.  This is probably one of the best Chinese barbecue restaurant in Chinatown Las Vegas. The restaurant is Very small, there's always a line out the door because of the limited space. The service is nice, and fast, the food came out quick, the portion of the food is good. They gat 4 star because the soup for the noodle is a bit too much white pepper for me. Otherwise is perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork skin and beef intestine mix with thine noodle soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tenderloin with wide noodle
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ 3 kinds pork belly, duck, chicken. They are very good compare to other here in Vegas Chinatown.

TdUL-544Fz6Rj1k3Pb4-uA.text: Jean C recommended this restaurant in February 2018 when I met her through Nadine C. She made my mouth water as she described this place. I told her I would be back next month to try it out. She said that if she was in town, she would join me. Lucky me that she was and we were able to dine here together!   When we arrived, they were busy with a line out the door. We signed in the first chance we got and waited. The restaurant was full of Chinese people so that was a good sign. This place is cash only so make sure to have cash or get cash while you wait to be called. Jean gave some recommendations as we looked at the menu while waiting so we went with what she recommended when we ordered.   We ordered Chinese Broccoli w/Oyster Sauce, Fried Tofu (was sold out), Roast Duck Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup and BBQ 3 Combo Platter (Ginger Chicken, BBQ Pork and Roasted Belly Pork). The meal came with hot tea. Table was clean and customer service was good for a Chinese restaurant. I didn't expect this at all TBH.   The shrimp dumplings were plump and duck was good. Noodles had the right amount of chewiness and broth was good. I really liked their saute sauce and added it to every bite. BBQ Pork and Ginger Chicken sauce was good but the Roasted Belly Pork was just ok. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs and we had lots of left overs. Thank you Jean for the recommendation and I can't wait to come back here the next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ 3 Combo Platter (Ginger Chicken, BBQ Pork and Roasted Belly Pork)
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast Duck Shrimp Dumpling Noodle Soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese Broccoli w/Oyster Sauce

rA9GYREHEqr6WzkAh7bxOg.text: I found this wonderful little gem on yelp. I am Chinese American originally from California and this place reminds of chinatown in San Francisco! The smell of Asian bbq is so nostalgic! Great quality, fast service and it's always a great sign that the food is authentic if there are other Chinese or Asian people dining. :D I love the ginger chicken or egg noodle wonton soup! But I will continue to come back to try the other options they have!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginger chicken with veggies and rice

gab-0g4ajj8NkXEtQf96ng.text: Good Cantonese food, roast duck could be the best of all Vegas. insufficient part is cash only.

HOdXewNqgzlD4c4vsAjgUA.text: I remember... when I used to live in Vegas, this plaza was pretty empty and the only restaurant my family frequented was a quick teriyaki take out joint.   Several years later and it seems to have brought in many different types of Asian cuisine.   This was our second great find of EDC weekend. We were supposed to get pho but I stumbled on this page while searching and couldn't resist after seeing the bbq, noodles, and jook or congee.   Being the driver has it's perks such as making an executive decision to hole in the wall restaurants on the whim.   This time we went into the restaurant with a party of 7. They had no problem seating us. Half way into the meal people started filling up the restaurant. It seemed like we just beat the rush.   We sat down got our menus and some hot tea.   The waiters passed by us several times as we were ready to order. We had that foreigner veil over our table and service will seem to be slower than if I were to be with my parents. No big deal, it's something I've gotten used to.   Eventually I am able to wave down a waitress. I exercised my Cantonese and ordered as many of the dishes I could recognize. The waitress had no problem taking the orders in English but dropping some Chinese usually makes the service a bit better. It's not guaranteed.   We ordered a lot of food to share, family style. BBQ pork and Duck, Combo fried rice, Beef chow fun, Seafood pan fried noodles, a bowl of congee, and 1 bowl of wonton noodles for me and a bowl of braised beef noodles for my friend.   The first item to come to the table was the fried rice. My friend said it smelled sooooo good as the waitress set it on the table. And it really was good. Everything was great. But I would have probably skipped the beef chow fun and I felt the braised beef was better than the wonton noodles.   In the end I ordered too much. We still had a lot of bbq pork and roast duck left over so we boxed it up and took it back to the hotel. After a long nap the next day, three of us devoured the left overs like primitive hungover cavemen; in our dark, curtain covered, cave like hotel room.  Sadly they ran out of roast pork just before we ordered. I actually want to bring my parents here to try it next time.

mb8yh5_vE1cfysDG-3UWNA.text: On the first day of Spring you generally think of it being semi sunshiny and warm. However, it was sooooo cold and windy that it was the perfect weather to try this new joint for some wonton soup. It was pretty packed when we got there and there was a wait after we got seated. I decided on the roast duck and shrimp dumplings. The fiance wanted the roast duck and wonton. When it came out, I noticed that my duck was still a bit pink....pretty sure that's ok, but I get a bit paranoid with that kind of stuff...so I didn't eat it. Shrimp dumplings were good and the noodles were ok. Broth didn't have very much flavor and was VERY oily. I was disappointed overall and I think I will be back to try the BBQ pork, but for the wonton soup, Wendy's Noodle Cafe has the best wonton noodle soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck and shrimp dumpling

H7bEkVf3nQ3TWU3kGmJwXg.text: Went to Asian BBQ twice.  The first time I had the Dumpling and wide egg noodle soup.  I liked the my noodle soup.   We also ordered a side of 3 bbq meat combo plate:  bbq pork, soy chicken & bbq duck.  Very good bbq meat dish.  Quick and fast service.    The 2nd time was a bit of a hit and miss.  It was at around 6 p.m. and it was hopping busy.  We managed to find a table in the far corner of the restaurant.  Relieved to even get a table at this busy time.  They messed up on the order and we had to wait a bit for the food but it was all good.  I'm not sure if I would come back again 'cos it's so busy.  I ordered the beef tendon and curry fishball with wide egg noodle soup.  It was a little sparse for the price.    Don't forget:  only cash here.

gXNleGIksn8yNgXgHf5L2w.text: This place is delicious!!  They have the best duck in Las Vegas.  The wonton soup is also really good.  The broth is nice and delicate, not overly flavorful or salty.  The roast pork is also delicious!! Basically everything on their menu is delicious.  I just wish that they were open a little later.  Oh, get there early to get the roast duck bc they frequently sell out.

cQyu9paW9uhDThp1XlRS9g.text: Been disappointed when I found out this place was shut down for a while. I think they have the best Roasted Duck in town and great prices with everything else. Yes, place is small but would defintely eat here than Sam Woo! Look forward to eating here again!

oL3hwbPapu7t7J_YrmRB-w.text: The ROASTED PORK BELLY is the most delicious item on the menu that I've tried!!!! This place is not just consistent EVERY TIME but the prices are SO REASONABLE.  Make sure you bring cash.  Cash only establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Pork Belly...you can have it as an appetizer or entree!  They do run out so MAKE SURE YOU GET THERE EARLY!!!!!!!!

KqzWtJ3tYnSRyuBM8E2kig.text: This place was awesome. I had a craving for both roast pork and roast duck and this place definitely hit the spot! the price was decent $7.99 for combo #2 with rice, and it came with Chinese broccoli.. not steamed cabbage/carrots like other places. it was good that i inhaled it...I think the old man across me was watching me. didn't get to try the noodles but I did see some people order it and they made it look good. what really stands out about this place is that the waiters were the nicest waiters and they were Asian! not from here... so definitely will be coming back when I visit.

ho5-YS5et5k3_qZ6HlAnzA.text: For good old school, inexpensive, tasty Chinese BBQ there is no other in comparison to Asian BBQ & Noodles. Inside you got the hanging proteins in the glass mirror,  Chinese people everywhere, some bamboo plants, and its brightly painted walls. Its simple and plain, but it gets the jay oh bee DONE.   If you aren't familiar with Chinese BBQ then I would recommend the BBQ pork or "char siu" because its ridiculous. How ridiculous you ask? More ridiculous than anything that comes out of Donald Trump's mouth. ALSO try the roasted duck, its juicy, succulent, and made fresh several times a day. Actually better yet just get the BBQ pork and roasted duck in a combo, with rice, noodles, or just by itself. If you're feeling extremely gluttonous, spend $20, get the whole duck to go, and just go primal animal on it at home in private, don't worry I won't judge.  If you're feeling adventurous well... there is the pork blood and intestine... but lets just stick with what's solid.   I don't love the stir fry noodles (your chow fun, chow mein, etc) here, but if you're craving it, it will do. The roasted pork is also a favorite among everyone, but I don't really enjoy its fattiness combined with the crispy skin, however if you do, go at it!   The service... well with most decent Asian restaurants, if you don't speak the language, then keep it simple, no point in confusing the work staff, or/and making yourself flustered.   Cash only and its pretty clean in here (+10000 points).

2tH3HXzUuDo2KHufSOK82A.text: Best authentic Asian BBQ around. Local feel with all taste and no bling bling fusion nonsense.

uXdQJ43jE9rOFEAU4Cqk4g.text: Best Chinese BBQ place in Vegas.  Pricing is very reasonable and the BBQ items are always delicious.  Don't forget the soup noodles and the fishballs on a stick, all awesome tasting at this restaurant!    Make sure to come early as it gets packed during lunch hour.  Seating area is very limited as it is a somewhat small restaurant.  If you are looking for strictly good food and are not too worried about a fancy atomosphere, then you have to hit this spot.  It's all about the taste buds here.

-k2rAe-hSPSwcpK1urXaYQ.text: It's one of those hidden gems you just find while browsing around the outskirts of Chinatown. Tucked away in the same area as Q Karaoke, District One, and Icy Juicy and you'll find this joint. Not really a name or a nice sign that the normal eyes could see but it's one of those places where you'd have to stick your head in and see what this place is all about.  First and foremost, this place is CASH only. Secondly, this is an asian restaurant so don't be expecting top notch 5 star service.  The food. Poultry and meats are prepared in the back and hung in display out front chinese butcher shop style. One of the best roast ducks I've had in Sin City. I'm not usually a fan of roasted pork belly but I'd order it here because it's so damn good. Juicy inside and a nice crunch on the outside.  This place is not your ordinary chinese restaurant as you won't find dim sum or any exotic chinese or seafood dishes here. It's more for the simple person to enjoy to get in and out quickly. Prices are reasonable as well. Great place, I will be coming back.

nQUHHtTrllr0lMrUbDvh4A.text: Great food and terrible service, sounds like the perfect chinese restaurant to me! You definitely don't go here for service and you can't be shy or nice coming into this place, I learned that if you approach them and talk as firmly as they do, you establish some sort of connection and they'll have your food out faster. The food here is amazing! If I'm feeling like a soup, their Wonton Noodle Soup has a light flavor and has a great portion. The Roast Duck and Roast Pork is a must try if you go here. I buy pounds of them for dinner, snacks and parties. The Roast Pork is especially my favorite. The Roast Duck is accompanied by a sweet and sour sauce and the Roast Pork is accompanied by hoisin sauce.  It can also be eaten with rice. My all time favorite dish here is the Salted Fish & Chinese Sausage  Fried Rice. Only try it if you can handle a strong fishy taste! Overall the quality and taste of their food is amazing and the prices are just right. Just note, this is a Chinese restaurant so expect oily, greasy foods, but it's less compared to other chinese restaurants. I highly recommend you try this place if you haven't. One of the most authentic chinese restaurants you could go to in vegas:D

b40ZS17VpIrGD3YGgHgitA.text: Roast pork belly, how I love thee.  Let me count the ways.  One order.  Two order.  Three orders...  This place rocks as a bbq and noodle stop.  It's authentic with the yummy pigs blood and intestines, duck and shrimp dumplings, soups, noodles, and rice.  The BBQ is the star, of course, with that yummy, melty, oh-so-fattening goodness of their roast pork belly.  I love the sights and smells of roasted meats hanging, head in tact, in a window, and that's what they have.  Everything is good, cheap, and CASH ONLY.   I found my new spot for some serious pan fried noodles, too.  Love is in the air, and it's the smell of roasted and fried meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork belly

GUBu2-z2MHIeLyHDFhUqiA.text: Been coming here for the longest now..  Very hole in the wallish type of place.  Food is real good and yummy.  My favorites are the roasted duck and pork.  The pork is real crispy with that crunch we all expect from a good roasted pork.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

96SKUpkxVLWgmccnhyQYBA.text: I would recommend what we had during our visit...my daughter had combo #7 with pork and roasted duck over rice, my wife had delicious seafood egg noodle, my son had hard to find roasted duck porridge and i had wonderful roasted duck egg noodle with wanton, and the whole family shared a full plate side order of the famous roasted duck...theme of the day if you missed the pattern still...anything with ROASTED DUCK you cannot go wrong... :)

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck porridge...my son ordered and it is highly recommended...

lT4K8flIjqOy5SGyTQ1uww.text: - It's good, authentic (Cantonese?) food at great prices. - My cousin-in-law (from Hong Kong) always wants to eat here when he's in town. - The service is hit and miss, so it's pretty standard for an Asian eatery.

SluelgIQkQiQWIT2pBDeTg.text: Okay so it's been about seven months since i first reviewed this place and i've been coming back many times.   Been back quite a few time to get the egg noodle and shrimp wonton stoup which Toni T claims the closest thing to traditional tasting. Would i agree to this statement? I dont know, never been anywhere that has enough reasonable creditably to establish themselves as THE place to get shrimp wontons. Regardless the wontons were stuffed with minced/smashed shrimp thus giving a nice plump shrimpy texture. they didnt cut corners by throwing all those tasty shrimp into a food processor till it was just a mush. The soup wasnt bad either and didnt contain that much MSG which is a HUGE plus  If you're not in the mood for soup, and who is these days with summer right around the corner as soon as the weather ponies finish winter warp up (MLP reference!!) then go for the two bbq combo rice plate. I grab bbq pork and roast pork. If you're getting take out then dont expect any soup to come with your order but dining in rates you some soup.   Overall i'd like to stop by more to try other things on the menu as well. Problem is very rarely do i get cravings for Chinese food. I actually crave Mexican more than i do Chinese which is just down right..weird...  Yelp 100 - 022 of 100

nwgFa_MP744wW5CVew-Mog.text: This place is a good 4.5 stars in my book.  From the outside as a tourist it doesn't look like much but they have some amazing BBQ pork dishes with rice.  I had their Pan Fried noodles and that was just ok but that BBQ pork though. That was awesome.

Ptegkw6cMtdzTqffL--oVw.text: Great bustling atmosphere for a very busy small place catering mostly to locals. The pork chow mein was delicious but with little meat was quite expensive compared to similar places in Chinatown. Disappointing that they could not do a steamed shrimp and mixed vegetables for someone who has dietary restrictions and the plate of steamed vegetables was just a side of choy sum with no variety and almost as much as a complete lunch special elsewhere. So, delicious food but poor value overall.

csuz5ob23E9W3Xwo6n4iMg.text: Can this place be anymore crowded? It's crazy how long the wait was. We came here for the roasted duck and after 45 minutes, we enjoyed some delicious duck.   Definitely come here for the duck.  I don't know about anything else. The place is kind of ghetto but that's kind of normal for a Chinese restaurant in the Chinatown area.

eWGbR7UsyrnWENFnRiUYeg.text: After discovering this place more than 4 years ago, it still is one of the restaurants I have to hit up every time I visit Vegas.  One bite of the roasted pork and char siu, you'll know exactly why I drive across town just to have a meal or two here.    Quality of the food has been maintained throughout the years, service is exactly the same as it was before and typical of any Chinese establishment.  Food, once ordered, arrived to the table swiftly and fresh.  The egg noodles are a must, especially Lo Mien style.    Dishes I order each time I visit:  - Egg noodles with beef stew lo mien style - Won Ton soup  - 3 Meat Combo platter with roasted pork, char siu and the roasted duck  - Curry tendon  My other favorite is their look funn rolls but if I'm eating by myself, usually I cannot eat all of the food I order so I save this dish with a larger group.    My favorite thing about this restaurant is the consistency of their quality.  Thank you for always being there to satisfy my cravings.  The only downside is that they are closed on Fridays.  =(

2qI9_6Or_GsUPy42ABgHNA.text: This place is very small, they speak both Cantonese and Vietnamese, but mostly Cantonese. Be careful, their floor is a little slippery, I almost tripped a few times.   We usually come here for their roasted crispy pork belly, duck and their wonton noodles. My husband doesn't eat much Asian food, but he loves the roasted crispy pork belly at first bite.   Sometimes, I want to be healthy but still want to indulge my belly, so I only want a quarter pound but they only sell it to you for at least half a pound. Also, prepare cash! That's why we can still enjoy their low prices.   Service is just okay here, but who cares, as long as they give you tasty food. Small space, ehhh service, good food are reasons why we always order to go. Their roasted pork stays crispy after a 15-20 minute drive.   One thing I don't get is they close on a Friday night, when there's a ton of people coming here for food. Parking is crazy in this little shopping center.

eNd7_gReyqlVlJ-FucEnqg.text: It's our go to place for BBQ pork belly but was so disappointed today!  It was so salty, so I brought it to the waitress attention and she responded "you started eating already" smh of course I ate a piece in order to know that it's way too salty!

2DWZVeVIL81QFtuUqoBCjg.text: Have not been back to my favorite hole in the wall for a while. It's pretty authentic Canto style cooking. The cooks were arguing in the back as piping food was served. It reminds me a lot of the restaurants in Guangzhou. This place is awesome. It's so good. It places the wall in the hole for this hole in the wall find. Don't worry the service is friendly and nice. I have not had any bad food here yet after years. My only gripe was that they are closed on Fridays.  After a day's volunteer work, can here to grab a bite. Ordered the dry chow fun with beef, and seafood chow mein, along with an appetizer of piggy ears. In case you are wondering, chow fun are flat noodles, and mein are round noodles. All 3 items came out to be $25 total. Great food and great price. You should check it out if you are in the hood. It's a small little cafe size restaurant.

2S4-eqGyhaScejm2Qvy3WQ.text: I give the food 4 stars The ambience 2 stars because when this place is crowed the guests are blocking the entrance and bothering the guests who are eating.

ZGvIQA_sA82Rv9v296ZIvw.text: I don't usually give out five stars. But this place is close to being the best.  For fatty BBQ Duck!!! Here are the pros - hole in the wall :)  I love hole-in-the-wall restaurants.  And this place fits my definition.  Menu on the wall. Cash only.  - very good food. Awesome BBQ duck, wonton noodle with shrimp dumpling.  Definitely among the better BBQ meats I have had  - full of people speaking Cantonese.  And the people around me were raving about the food or business  - very fast service.  - inexpensive for the type of food.   Can't think of a con other than cash only but then again this place is pretty inexpensive.

AMlQbWhW2XPWldvm_PdgSQ.text: Very disappointed given the reviews. Food does not taste good. I couldn't finish my meal

BsxMvpQrRGCcTgG8YxGflQ.text: Whenever we come to Vegas, this is our spot to hit. Although I believe they close on Fridays, they are pretty busy on most days   1. Wonton noodle soup has a savory soup. Wonton has meat and shrimps. The noodles are perfectly cooked. Not too soft and not hard.  2. We always get the meat combo. Which includes three choices of meat. Duck, pork belly, xa xui, or chicken hainam with ginger. Al these meat is a must to try! Do not skip it.  3. Friend rice is also good. Plate is very big it can feed up to three people.  4. Crunchy or soft chowmein I a good option if you decided to order this dish. It is covered in vegetables and meat. I have to say the sauce is kind of salty so you can ask it little or on the side  5. Fish balls dipped in curry sauce. The curry sauce has a little spicy kick to it. So if you don't like spicy or curry, just eat the fish ball by itself. It'll still be good.  6. Chinese donuts are fresh everyday. Big and fluffy. We usually eat with our wonton soup. Sup it like bread.  Finally, service. Service is very welcoming here. Although there are some language barrier, their menus are filled with pictures and you can just point.:)   Enjoy!

LyZAtIUE17ZnJ021oOVx-A.text: The BBQ pork is really awesome.  It is so juicy and crispy everytime.  They do get a little busy around 5pm though.  Pricing is fair.

qrgcJL28bzK0n5XvtPJWpQ.text: When I have friends in from Hong Kong that desperately miss Hong Kong wonton noodles bbq meat fish balls Choy Sum... then this is a must. Prepare to wait and it is cash only.  One of my favorites.

8QtikFuBWMINOxj9xpzULg.text: Roasted duck was a killer. It was juicy. The skin was crispy.  The fried noodle with chicken gravy was excellent. The noodle was crispy and had nice A'Roma. The gravy was mild and nice A'Roma. The vegetables were crispy. The chicken was cooked to perfect and not dry.  However the roasted belly pork which brought me back here was very very salty today. I was very disappointed. The skin was crisp and the meat was juicy. If it wasn't super salty, it would have been perfect.

jRRiVC4HzjRtzquos0Avrg.text: Worth the wait! We went on Christmas Day at 12pm. Long wait. But the food turned out to be great! Best ever Asian bbq I ever had. The roasted duck is perfect. I also ordered noodle soup with pork stamoche which was really good. I'll come back next time I'm in Vegas.

xXx-DRPCRbSvom0SFoPOJQ.text: Great food, just watch your bill. Came here with a party of 3 and they added 15% gratuity without telling us (minus one star). It's also cash only. Get there early or prepare to wait. We got there at 5 pm on a Saturday and there were a few open tables. By 5:30 there was already a line which grew longer and longer as the night wore on.   Food was great and at a great price, especially for the area. Every dish we got was good enough to get again which included pork belly, BBQ pork, Hainan/Ginger chicken, porridge with pig blood, spicy pig ear spiced to order, picked radishes, and Chinese broccoli. The shining stars?  - Pork Belly: first thing to go, meat was super juicy and skin nice and crisp  - BBQ Pork: also super juicy and great penetration of flavor The porridges all come from the same congee base with the additions added depending on what you order. Still very savory and glad we were able to get the pig blood (our waitress says they generally run out bk it's so popular).   Service was pretty good overall aside from one minor mishap - one of the servers accidently gave us a dish for a different table. We started eating it thinking it was ours (I mean who can resist a plate of crispy juicy pork belly? My mouth is watering just thinking about it...). Wasn't until our actual combo dish came that we realized the mistake and informed the waitresses. Oops. The other table got their dish a few minutes after that but did have to wait a while for it. Other than that, everyone there was super friendly and responsive, albeit very busy.

EwaPozC0abxtAahWQknA-g.text: Cheap delicious food ... I mean seriously the BBQ is amazing! I used to come here once a week and order bbq pork with rice it's like $7. Weeks that was out of town I would have withdraws from this place. The noodles have a nice smoked flavor and the duck is nice and crispy!   The CASH only thing drives me nuts! Why? You should just pay the small fee of credit cards and you would have so much more business!!!! So I have to stop by an ATM prior to ever visit.   I will not comment on service or decor or the environment or anything besides if you want great Chinese bbq this is the place.

kF6glnpigD8zs8Eb7vXXYg.text: The best Chinese BBQ in North America.  Food is amazing and very flavorful.  The downside is that they run out a lot of stuff by 6pm, so you have to go for early lunch to get the best roast pork roast duck... roast anything.    Service is not bad either, they come by and check and refill water. Food comes out quick.  We come here every time we are in Vegas.  Must try....

rLJLhTJ_6d9rkQ5kRv6-0g.text: Fresh, quick and delicious. Regardless if they are busy, the servers will always accommodate you for a table or takeout.

n1_4NOXTjO9o9SOBqbxvQg.text: Disappointing 30 min. Wait, small place extremely loud like a fast food cafe. Ordered pork combo $14.99 was like an appetizer size and cold and dry. We ordered 3 dishes one person got there food combo chow fun after other two people almost done eating and not much flavor. Service was not good , had to get up twice once to ask for spoons for our soup brought to us another time for our 3rd dish we didn't receive until other 2 almost done also asked for water and never got it. AXGKihznYGjDZl0x-DVxvA.text: What kind of BBQ place runs out of ribs on Wednesday at 4:30...?  Very disappointed.  Might want to get your butts off them seats and start grilling...  Smh

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WzESoSFVPtpI8yVE9B00Aw.text: The best roast pork in Vegas is here! All of their Chinese BBQ meats looked really good at the counter. I wanted the 3-choice combo so I could get char siu but that would have been too much food for me so I went with the 2-choice combo platter. The roast pork skin was thin and crisp; the pork had an even amount of fat to lean ratio so it wasn't dry. The roast duck was well seasoned and also tasty but I preferred the roast pork more. I didn't see the pea shoots on the menu but when I asked the waiter in Chinese, he mentioned pea shoots was a vegetable option so I was sold. I was visiting from Honolulu, HI and back at home, we don't sell pea shoots at the market or in the restaurants.  This place is cash only. Their prices are reasonable and they give a decent portion. We came for an early dinner (before 5pm) so it wasn't busy. We noticed a lot of local Chinese eating here and I think they are regulars since they ordered immediately after being seated. The service the good and the staff are efficient. We were in and out in about 1 hour. I'm keeping this place on my food list for the next time I'm in Vegas.

0nwfQCAawWgIKeW6ipjHag.text: Great place for bbq meats! Remember to bring cash.  I tried the roast duck, bbq pork, hainan chicken, and wonton noodles.  Both the roast duck and bbq pork were super flavorful. I preferred the bbq pork a bit over the roast duck, just because there was more meat, however, both are really solid choices. The proteins here are on the saltier side, so I'd highly suggest getting it with a side of rice or noodles.  My s/o got the hainan chicken and said it was just ok - I'd probably skip this dish and stick to the bbq meats.  I also ordered a wonton noodle soup since it seemed super highly recommended. The noodles were cooked perfectly - they were al dente and had a nice bite and chew! The soup, on the other hand, had a really fishy flavor which I'm personally not a fan of. The wontons were also just ok.  Overall, this is a great place to get your asian food fix if you're in Vegas and want to go off strip.

wQ7vLWghwYcaSCSHWwi8zg.text: Excellent Hong Kong Style Noodle House...The Wonton Soup is Superb...The Roast Ducks are Fresh, Crispy and Juicy...The Stewed Tripe is Delicious...  A sign on the wall states that it was voted one of the top 100 Chinese restaurants in the US and I concur... Not expensive, packed on weekends, cash only  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

kHGVbbqH17JmwQmZyuI4rA.text: As a person that have great ties with hong kong. This place will bring you back to a little taste of Hong Kong noodle house. I only come here for one thing and one thing only. Brisket, curry fish ball with rice noodle. Briskets are soft, fish balls has that nice chew. The noodles are perfectly cooked, not too soft and not too hard, kinda like a chinese version of al dente. Mix that with a little chili oil and let me know what you think  I haven't tried other dishes so I cant give an honest review. Other people seem to enjoy rice dishes and fried noodles.  Perhaps I'll give that a go next time

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket, curry fish ball with rice noodle

0FjIco_iD5Qy5ALkW6MzxQ.text: If you're looking for canto food you won't be disappointed if you come here. Wontons were delicious. Bbq pork was awesome. Bbq duck wasn't great, lots of fat left on it and flavor was mild, skin was kind of chewy. Very standard Hong Kong food. Servers speaking canto and mandarin if you'd like. Fairly busy place but very quick service. Tables and chairs are hole in the wall level and very simplistic, very close together and not a bunch of space. Would come back here again for the right occasion (my dad coming into town) or if you want the best wonton noodle soup in Las Vegas.

He1ND2w0SL4_XyRYELW7AQ.text: Worth the wait! This place is pretty small so I wouldn't recommend going in a big group unless you don't mind splitting up. They have a pretty big menu, most of my party got the wonton soup with egg noodles. I opted the pho ap chao xao bo to share with my sister since I wasn't really hungry and felt like it was too hot to have soup that day. The dish I got was really good. Add some sirarcha or pepper for spice and it just makes the whole dish that much better! It's affordable and real good! My mom is a pretty picky eater, never finds any place good but complimented this place! We will be back next time, for sure!!

xWNCcvx8MqAQmZUpbtBNXA.text: Long lines so be prepared to wait! Also, this place is cash only!  The bbq combination is delicious - bbq pork, roast duck, pork belly.. super fresh and juicy!  Everything on the menu is great. Do not come here expecting cleanliness, good service, or attractive decor as you will be sorely disappointed... but the delicious food will definitely make up for all that you're missing!

amtO0JVPTgF3IL97QtHyhA.text: This place is a hit and miss in many ways. Most importantly, they're one of the only places that take nothing but cash. Keep that in mind before coming!  The setup is very traditional for a Chinese restaurant, meaning: the staff is extremely rude (even if you speak the native language lol), the decor is atrocious (what is with the clashing green walls and the stuff hung up everywhere, right?), and it's busy and it's noisy. But if you get past that cultural part that's going to be constantly prevalent in nearly every authentic Chinese restaurant you go to, the food is typically good.   I say "typically" because for the most part, the cooking is consistent. But like many other Chinese restaurants, there isn't really a set recipe, and how good your food is going to be is going to be dependent on who is cooking that day and how they chose to make your food that day.  For example, I've always found the fried duck to be pretty solid here. However, they've lately been skimping on how much actual duck meat they give you, and if you order something like a half duck, you might get parts of the duck that have little meat or are mostly skin and fat when they should be giving you a specific part of it that is usually served. Same thing goes for any soup dishes: sometimes the broth is tasteless, sometimes it's extremely salty, sometimes it's just right. There is unfortunately not much consistency here.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bo kho: beef stew

wmBu6J8VjTC5Nm2TvJhBpg.text: Why have I never been here?! I was in the mood for some crispy pork belly and rice. Yelp led me to this place and I'm so glad it did! I ordered the 3 BBQ special combo which came with ginger chk, roasted duck, & crispy pork belly. Everything was so amazing!! The ginger chk and roasted duck were so tender!! I have eaten a lot of chk and duck in my life and definitely one of the best I ever had. I might even have to admit that was the most tender duck I've ever had! They also gave us a few different sauces to eat with our BBQ combo. I will definitely be a returning customer.   Oh and they only accept cash here so bring cash!! If you're craving some bomb @$$ chk, duck, or crispy pork belly this is the place that'll hit the spot!

cTAcLxxIAFMtQf4B86Z9Gg.text: Finally tried their roast duck and the skin was slightly crispy, meat and fat were juicy. I also got to try the wonton egg noodle. OMG, the best I have had. This never disappoints.

f92_ZEH3DEt_Vo9aOXOdEA.text: Chinese food in Vegas is a little hard to find- especially good and cheap. Yes, we Lyft'd off the strip to this far, far away place (roughly ~$11 ride).   We ordered 1/2 duck, 1/2 chicken, wonton noodle soup, phoenix claws, and beef chow fun $55- tips included. Served 3 people- we were full! We absolutely loved the chow fun and duck was good. We definitely enjoyed the duck over the chicken; probably could have gotten away withOUT the phoenix claws as it was "meh". Service was decent; we spoke in Chinese (not sure if it would make a difference...). Small place; expect a small wait for a table and for food. We walked away rubbing our belly.  We would love to go back here again!  Beware: closed Fridays! Cash only!
