heJumDUL9E6xwrYbDIoH6Q.text: Step out of Vegas and step into Hong Kong. Authentic Chinese restaurant. Great food.  Only reasons for not getting the 5th star is that the place is small and you can always expect a wait especially during meal times. It is also cash only.

qBRdJIDMLd7m_kH8T_s17Q.text: Yummy Asian BBQ!!!  No frills just good old awesome food! Large menu with many choices.  I particularly love their pork belly with crunchy skin paired with pickled veggies & steaming hot white rice!!  This place only accepts cash.  But no worries food is very reasonably priced.  A famous Chef in Las Vegas recommended this place to us.  That speaks volumes!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of restaurant.

woda5yRIZET2Q54I1eIGsg.text: We went here twice during our trip to LV and it wasn't bad. The first time I was able to have their bbq items. They have your usual bbq pork, roast pork and duck. The menu has many choices to choose from beside bbq and you can also have noodles plus different rice dishes. I tried the roast pork and roast duck combination. They weren't as flavorful as others I have tried at other places, but they were still good none the less. The pork had the nice crispy skin and the duck was moist. They also provide a small dipping sauce for each item which to me was a big plus especially the plum sauce for the duck.  The second time we went I tried the beef chow fun which was good with a nice wok flavor and the serving size was large. The only thing was that it seemed a bit dry and could've used a bit more oil when cooked. Also I needed to add some soy sauce as it wasn't too salty enough.  The place is kind of small considering how busy this restaurant can get, but they do pretty quick service as they try to get people in and out without much of a wait. Good to try some Chinese bbq in LV for the first time and a place I wouldn't mind coming again on another trip.

OPc2JJvrssSvcDKd_g4GVA.text: Since Cantonese restaurants are in decline in my hometown, I had to get a quick fix before returning. I ventured into the middle of the Asian district for one of my last meals in Vegas. Parking isn't the best here. Hint: there's a huge parking lot across the street. This is a Hong Kong style BBQ hole-in-the-wall restaurant that provides wonderful Hong Kong classics. I emphasize that this is not the place for a first date. Take-out service looked very efficient here. I recommend the roast pork and roast duck. The ginger chicken that was served to me had a lot of bones and fat but not enough meat. I recommend going elsewhere for ginger chicken. The BBQ pork was good, but I prefer it without the intense star anise taste. Overall, after visiting this modest establishment, I realized how much the Asian food scene has modernized. Trendy Asian desserts, hip ramen joints, and the Korean BBQ wave outshine restaurants like Asian BBQ & Noodle. However, if you desire to appreciate authentic Hong Kong cuisine, Asian BBQ & Noodle represents tradition masterfully.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A couple of ducks hangin&#39; around.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo meat chow mein
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo 3 meat plate: Roast Pork Belly, Steamed Chicken, Pickled daikon, BBQ Pork, Ginger Sauce.

gAQ4yGurMBcqZfF0rhtqLw.text: LEGIT HK style cafe! You can tell how authentic it is when you try the staple, standard fundamental---the basic classic porridge.   Daaaayummm, it was so good. Fluffy consistency, perfect amount of salt and wish I could've had an IV hooked up to me.  Ordered the Chicken Vermicelli Noodle soup too, and it was super on point. Broth wasn't too salty and portion was big.   cant wait to try the rest of the menu!!

A2I3m27ma1U4amPVCy2yoA.text: I drove to Vegas from LA and after a 4 hour drive, this place had me drooling the moment I walked in the door.   bbq pork rice combo 5/5 - the pork had the perfect sweet glaze of charsiu, meanwhile the the rice served with a sauce that kept it moist. SOOO GOOD  Roasted pork belly 5/5 - the crispy skin with the tender meat. Dip it in the sauce and you're golden  Wonton noodles 4/5 - solid choice, but more noodle than wonton  My family of 10 came here and indulged in several more dishes and the food came out in such a timely manner. Staff was super friendly to canto speakers. Will definitely be coming next time im in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonton
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted pork

EnD7waIhjNonEqpmbelYFA.text: This place is really good.  I ordered the roast pork belly (skin was crispy), roast duck (it wasn't fatty and skin was crispy), and pan fried xo rice rolls (they took the time to pan fry both sides of the rice roll until crunchy on the outside). You can't get this kind of quality Chinese food in LA. Restaurants in LA can't do it right.

vzoN0XcCK11BZOkDm28MnQ.text: Went in for lunch and every single person in there was Asian. You know you can't go wrong here. Also, simple menu which is great for a place like this as they concentrate on what they are good at:  - won ton noodle soup  - beef chow fun (dry) - fried rice with salty fish - roast pork  All of these are either better or comparable to other Hong Style BBQ places. A definite return in the future for us. Small, but clean restaurant with efficient, friendly (yes, friendly) service. Cash only.

ZKeipK4vtyN3vCJvGQpPfw.text: Authentic, cheap and delicious!  Small restaurant but always busy. You can pick the type of noodle you want, and pick topping choices. There are ready-made noodle combos on the back of menu if you don't want to pick and chose. Noodle bowls always arrive quickly, hot, and tasty.  For the adventurous eaters, there are pork intestines, blood, ears (the spicy version served thinly sliced is yummy),  roasted duck, and roasted pork (skin so crispy it crunches). If not so adventurous, there is shrimp dumplings, tofu, meatballs, and mushrooms that you can add to your noodle bowl.  Beware, it's a cash only restaurant so no credit cards.

VAFam7Gh_rFVCcpM9dGsXw.text: Great place! I ordered the BBQ combo plate which I think was $7.95. Originally, my order was the BBQ pork and the pork belly, but they were out of BBQ pork (I guess it was that good!). I'm not a fan of duck (I know. Shame on me.), so I just doubled on the pork belly. F.U.C. it right?! You only live once, and consuming that much pork belly that might have been the last of my living days!  The pork belly was delish! The meat fat was so juicy and so tender. All most melt in your mouth tender, and the skin was extra crispy! The portions are very big portions. They offer two full strips per order with the combo so I ended up with 4. Don't worry I didn't eat all 4! The dipping sauce goes great with the pork belly. I'd really love to go back to try the rest of their food.  I also noticed that they have a wide variety on their menu! They even have a make it yourself noodle bowl with all the options for meat and vegetables as well as your choice of noodle. I would also suggest to try their lemon iced tea with your meal. Their iced tea here is so refreshing and very lemony!!!! It's more lemony tasting than than tea tasting.

Ji-ebTHOM5c02DTuaBhYXw.text: Amazing! Authentic, healthy and super tasty.  I had the Singapore Vermicelli and pork belly and duck was shared at our table too. Incredible flavor and they make their own sauces!  Highly recommend this place but time your visits because its popular and busy around traditional lunch time so go early or later.

WhFD_l8PgLZWN5qCGjICFg.text: It was my first time here, server were patiently explain the menu.  I ordered roast duck/ wonton noodles and the husband ordered the rice with three kinds of choices. The food was so good. I'm sure you wont be disappointed! The server were nice. the food were tasty and we are definitely be back!  Before we left and whole restaurant were pack with people and a line were line up outside already! it was 12:30ish when we left there.

GEaQ6nfrzgYY-BgN-HjKvQ.text: This is my favorite chinese BBQ place in Vegas, and maybe for the whole world.  They have simply mastered the whole chinese BBQ thing.  This place is always busy as well.  Fortunately the service is fast,, so getting a table won't usually take all that long.  They have my favorite roast pork dish, which, to my eyes, their BBQ has become the gold standard to all the chinese BBQ i've had in the pest.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfection

Nlh1oAVmpjyOqx_so-2ibg.text: There was a line when we came in but it moved fairly quickly. We ordered combo plates with  2 BBQ and one with ginger chicken as well as a side order of Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. Everything we ordered was precooked and came off a steam table affair. Buffet food served at your table! Something must have been wrong with the heat because everything was cold except for the bowls of corn water (it certainly wasn't soup!), that was McDonalds coffee hot. I know ginger chicken is served cold but I prefer mine closer to room temperature than refrigerator cold. Both the chicken and roast duck had so little meat on them. I cook poultry a lot and recognized both portions as coming from the poultry backs which are the least meaty parts. The oyster sauce on the cold broccoli was so salty and plentiful I had to scrape most of it off. Recommend it to friends or visitors, a resounding NO!

dnXN9asEsinqe13m15qF6Q.text: Every now and then I have a crazy craving of samwoo bbq since I grew up in City of Angels especially in San Gabriel Valley where samwoo bbq are running amock every three blocks.  Then I relocate to Las Vegas and the samwoo here is just suck ass. Thank god for asian bbq and noodles. They are as close as the samwoo in los angeles and I cant believe my luck when I found them through yelp.  Wonderful roast duck, so so on the bbq pork, I havent try all their food yet but they have crazy good hainanese rice. I am not crazy about the chicken I think big wong have the best hainanese chicken rice in vegas. But their hainanese rice are wonderful.  Good service, clean restaurant, wonderful bbq. Just dont stop by on Friday cos they are close, oh yah, CASH ONLY!

qwxjbQ4vwBhR9vQ-7_aiDA.text: Came here based on reviews since I was in town as a tourist.  My husband had cravings for Chinese food after having a few rich foods and buffet on the strip.  The BBQ food is good here and not too salty.  We ordered a combo with two choices of BBQ items.  We got the duck and pork which both tasted really good.  They were surprisingly not fatty as other places I have been near my hometown of Seattle.  We had a seat next to the glass window of BBQ and the duck was sold out at one point.  We ordered wonton mein and beef chow fun in addition to the BBQ.  These items were nothing to write about but the service we received was great.  If I could accurately give a rating it would be 3.5 stars.

GzoK0emrLEWdGJHiAS-3rQ.text: Beware of the bills they add hidden tip,  it does't showed on the bill so I did gave them tips on top of al the addition and we were only party of four. I found it out on our second visit. The rating I gave is for the food they were great. I don't know what is the law in Nevada in CA you must disclose the practice to the customer otherwise is violation of the law. I will never come back here despite the food are delicious.

ZecnR07AEPHn0jvoWoJXtQ.text: Great place! Cash ONLY!!! Be warning of the smell when you walk in.

9EMUM4kVwx20zqS_xSBHKg.text: Delicious Cantonese style BBQ with low prices. I like this place

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dCPtTuFViXScuj9iiboRkA.text: Chinese comfort food 101.  Hot, tasty and lots of it!  I am happy to finally have found a place in Las Vegas that serves bbq meats, rice and flat rice noodle dry or in soup.  After a few days of buffets, western bbq and seafood, I crave a rice bowl, and this place is a really good place for it.  As soon as you step in, the staff smile and ask what they can do for you, even at noon.  And the place is full of Chinese people, which is important if you are searching for authentic.  It was packed, so I ordered takeout - white rice with bbq pork belly and duck.  Huge amounts of white rice and the meats, and a couple of sticks of gai lan.  Their duck soy sauce was also very tasty without MSG.  Trust me - I am supersensitive to MSG.  $8, and I could only finish half the rice.  It was filling and really good food.    It's in the same mall as Cravin' Cajun, just three doors away, so parking is plentiful.  Definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

ETDJwvTN3xow21jE_K4TeA.text: Out of the rows and rows of Asian food options in the Chinatown area, Asian BBQ and Noodles could easily be overlooked. Finding this hidden gem is another reason why I love Yelp. A friend recommended this place but I had to confer with my trusted Yelp friends. And once again, Yelp did not let me down!  I still can't get over the amazing deal they offer. For $6.99 I got  a huge plate of Roasted Duck, Pork Belly and Rice. Everything was succulent. The Pork Belly skin had just the right amount of crispiness and not too much fat.  This place is nothing fancy but you definitely get more than you pay for. If you're looking for a cheap meal that satisfies and is easy on the wallet, this is the place to go!

cdgK8Wb7Dt8sswzLi6goCw.text: This place is a bit far from the Strip but the BBQ is legit. They have tender pork belly and crispy-skinned juicy duck. The duck was cooked perfectly and none of that grease layer under the skin. Prices were reasonable and I would recommend. My group was pleasantly surprised by the yummy food and we are picky eaters! CASH ONLY.  BEWARE, they add tip to your bill but  don't let you know so if you don't look carefully, you could end up getting duped into paying tip on top of tip. I'm all about tipping at least a minimum of 15% all the time but this was NOT COOL to add it without any mention anywhere.

xXTSwYGK44EfaAgXMcFiYA.text: Only downside: cash only and closed on Fridays.  My parents took me here when I was in town, and yum! I haven't had good roast ruck or roast pork in a long, long time! The skin was perfectly crispy and the meat itself wasn't too salty. The duck... mmmm juicy, just perfect! I thought it was so nice of them to cut the bone off the duck and chicken breast. The cold chicken with ginger is really good here too. I used to love KJ's, but maybe they changed chefs or something because it doesn't taste as good. I don't normally like wontons, but these are good! This place is very clean and the staff is friendly. I definitely want to come back the next time I'm home.

r6kK-s_BGGi8xcm7uoNjHg.text: Delicious and great service too!!!! Go early to enjoy the duck...it goes fast!  Will certainly return!

KlanoOpfPsAc5-jOuMr0Ag.text: Simply great meals. Just like what we have back in home town. Staffs are friendly, service are fast.

2ngW9m684lPpCHgd6RfN0A.text: Quite gem hidden in China Town. Food is good and priced well for Vegas. Definitely on the list of must visit when in Vegas.

oJxLw1zEjNefWB_mgSObNA.text: In the words of MC Hammer....too legit to quit.....I'm officially addicted!! I drop by for lunch at least once a week, especially since the prices are really cheap.  This is legit Cantonese food....and by far the best wonton noodle soup in Vegas (was $3.99 but now $4.99)...the soup base does not leave me dying of thirst from MSG and has a distinct flavor that other restaurants lack.  Someone told me they may use a fish base to get the flavor.  A big turn off for me is soggy noodles....but this place consistently has al dente wonton noodles!  Other items that are delicious are the roast pork with super crispy crunchy skin and the spicy pig ear side order.  The only thing I haven't enjoyed as much....is the duck....a little too fatty/greasy for me....  Little tidbits..waitresses have limited English...so all the ABC's (American Born Chinese)....get ready to practice your Chin-glish, closed on Friday's now and CASH only.

ZTEOKy7iVr4wlJdpUstCKw.text: Oh how I love this place.  This is a little family run Chinese place over in Chinatown and it's awesome.  Why is it awesome you ask? Let's start with the pork belly and the barbecued pork.  We've ordered these dishes a number of times and they are fan-freaking-tastic.  Easily among the best iterations of these dishes I've had.  Simply flawless.  Also outstanding is the oh-so-tasty wonton soup and the delicious brocoli in oyster sauce.  Another favorite here is the duck, which is just delicious.  I'm not a huge duck person, to be honest, but it's so crispy, tasty, and delicious here... you just have to try it.  As you can see, I'm a huge fan.  Go here, you'll like it. A lot!    Note: this establishment is cash only so plan accordingly.

SFwLbHjUq5wQ4LD_TTU8tQ.text: The plaza didn't seem busy because we came here a bit late but we when we entered this restaurant, it was packed! The food here mostly sells Cantonese "street food" so we ordered:  Curry Noodle with Pig Feet: This is my favorite dish here. We originally wanted fish ball instead of pig feet but they ran out. I love the broth. The broth isn't a strong curry like thick Indian curries but it was really flavorful. The pig feet was really tender too. They give about 6 pieces and a few vegetables.  Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce: It seemed that they overcooked the broccoli because the stem of the broccoli was soft and the leafy part was soft to almost gooey consistency. So I didn't care for this dish much. The sauce was good and not too salty.  BBQ Pork: Because a lot of people come in here for their bbq items (ex. duck, pork, etc.), they sell them so quickly that they didn't cook it long enough. But I noticed that people taking food to go order it, so they must cook it long enough on occasion. Maybe we just got a bad batch.   Meatball Egg Noodle Soup: The meatball is pretty good. It was soft. The egg noodle is pretty good too. It was really thin.   Service was ok. They don't have a lot of workers here but the food came out quick.  The restaurant is sooo small. The distance between tables are quite close. They also have a hard time with large groups that are more than 4 people because they have to combine tables for large groups.   Overall, all the dishes here are less than $10. Restaurant is small and food is good. I'll definitely come back here again.

y5yF-9JAuPtH1mgaoyJOTg.text: Delicious roast duck, roast pork, BBQ pork, and hainam chicken all in one place. The food comes out quick because the service is quick, and this place is always busy.   Their today duck is my favorite in Vegas because there's lots of meat and it's not loaded in sauce. Same goes for the roast pork, fat and juicy.   Just be careful when you order the hai nam chicken because they cut it up with the bones and all. There were a couple instances where I ended up crunching on tiny pieces of bone. Not very pleasant.   Also this establishment is cash only so be prepared.

AQ1urzXSvYhvyHfr1CmLLQ.text: We came here couple month ago just to buy the cha siu, but did not like the cash only policy. So it took us a long time to come back again, we like the food a lot, sausage fried rice without salty fish was very good, big portion too. And the BBQ Pork and roasted pork belly were really really good too! We still dont like that we have to prepare cash to come here, but great food made up to that.

hEahW0XcRQOCVadJRA7MSA.text: Pros:    Great Chinese BBQ Combo Rice    Fast Service Cons:    Parking may be difficult on the weekends    Service is meh    Price for a 3 item BBQ Combo was $10 (in LA its around $6)

uBXo8CXWOrxN7z-wfaIGig.text: Really great find.  Great tasting pork dishes.  Prices were reasonable.   The crispy pork belly had a great texture - crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  Definitely coming back on my next trip to Vegas.

YEPmG-OKn6JqvSuWJGN1Lw.text: Outstanding fresh quality char-su (Sweet BBQ pork), Siu-yok (BBQ pork), soy chicken and BBQ duck at really reasonable prices.  For me just the right amount of fat on the pork as well.  Chinese broccoli had a little too much oyster sauce on it.  Went on a Monday night at 6:45pm and barely got in without waiting - though in all fairness, the rapid turnaround in tables did not result in anyone waiting more than 15 minutes that night.    However, it is a mad house and people don't dawdle when eating there. If you want to eat at your leisure - go take out.  Will definitely be coming back.

PUihaX0YGf2D67fRN3Ok7w.text: The best roast duck and roast pork you will ever have in your life.   Honestly, I haven't had roast duck/pork this delicious since I lived in San Jose when I was younger.   The roast duck is absolutely delicious and juicy. It's made just right.  Same goes for the roast pork too. The crunch of the skin on the pork is just perfection.   The beef chow fun is great as well!   This place gets packed really quickly, so I suggest you go before noon.  You can always order to go as well.

xtE9eT2EBQEI3YDw3bHP6Q.text: I came here the first time with friends. It was crowded.   The place:  small and not comfortable. The table is small. We ordered four dishes for 4 people and there was not enough room on the table. I would not bring my date here to this little place.  Food: this is basically a BBQ noddle place, nothing fancy. If you are looking for BBQ and noodle place, you are in the right place. BBQ items are not bad but not much better than the other places. Ordered Chow Mein. They used the thick noodles and they were fried and not pan fried to save time.   Price: It is expensive. They are basically serving dinner menu all day. They don't have a lunch menu. Chow fun and average $12, probably the most expensive in town for a little place during lunch time. You can go to most Chinese restaurant to order chow fun on the dinner menu and they are around $9-10 max. It is more expensive than Ping Peng Pong in the Gold cost Casino. The portion is dinner portion. If you walk across the street to Hong Kong Garden (3407 S. Jones), the same dish on their lunch menu is only $5.99, exactly half and the quality is about the same, Their dinner price is only $8.99, much cheaper for comparable items. For lunch, I may not want to spend $12 for a Chow Fun dish in this place.   Service: It is OK because my friend is a regular customer here and he tips good.  Overall, this place has quality food, but not really better than other restaurants in town. The place is small and seating is not comfortable. The worst part is the price. It is expensive compared to most of the oter other restaurant for whatever limited items they are serving. This place is overrated IMO.   I would not return unless someone else is inviting me. I live in town and I have tried most of the Cantonese restaurants. There are better place with much better dinning environment and much cheaper with comparable quality food. Don't bring you date here. He or she may like the food but not the place.

JVSQ6KAl6ZacAKn2y1iqow.text: Decent quality.  Price is reasonable. Loved their BBQ pork and beef stew.  Cash Only.

0XYWJy1jZJyF5rAi_o2O-A.text: Clean Chinese restaurant with friendly prompt staff.  Decent prices but they only take cash.    Roasted Duck & Pork Rice Plate:  The duck was good.  Nice and flavorful, but pretty standard for Chinese roasted duck.  The roasted pork was the standout.  Very tender and juicy.  Not dried out like some places.  And not overly fatty or greasy either.  Great flavor on the pork and roasted to perfection.  Mi Xau Don (Crispy Noodle):  The flavor was good but there was too much sauce/gravy that made the noodles too soggy to fast.  If they lighten up on the sauce, the dish would be perfect.

l2FtGshQGgS1kRlBI2uJyg.text: This is my first time coming here and it was packed so that's always a good sign. I got wonton soup and roasted pork over rice. It is delicious. I will always come here for Chinese from now on.

m-nA6nSNTdPaF9yo9bpESQ.text: Cash only. Closed on Fridays. That said, I love the wonton noodle soup ($6). The broth is clear, flavorful, not too salty, and hot (in temperature). It cooks the noodles, so you have to wait about 2-3 mins. to dig into those. In the mean time you can sip broth and eat the delicious wonton (pork) wontons. It's the bomb if you know/like Chinese soup. They also add scallions and a few chinese greens.  I've tried their roasted pork. I did not think it was the bomb like other reviewers. It's ok. I think I just have spent my childhood eating roasted pork (lechon). So, if eating pork , I guess I prefer that (and wontons, and bacon of course).

aKSbk4JSWl5cyvB5thwOBQ.text: Very authentic Hong Kong-style "street cart noodles"! Beware cash only!  I haven't had noodles and pork skin this good since I lived in Hong Kong. The blood cube is the best I've had on the West Coast (and real pork blood too not chicken, even if it's not as good as Hong Kong's). They even have Ho Fun (flat rice noodles). The seating is simple but clean. Good for a casual food stop. I'll have to try their curry fish balls next time! My blunder was that I forgot to bring cash (only cash accepted), but the staffs were nice enough to let me came back later without giving me any hassle.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ho fun noodles with 3 curry fish balls, beef brisket, and mushroom
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thin egg noodles with beef stomach, pork skin, and pork blood curd

PLBw8cvrAtGOx6eHUe8eBA.text: I can never review enough or keep talking about me some Roast Pork Action!! I had friends visiting from back home thinking about checking out Asian BBQ & Noodles. Hell yay great idea! I have been meaning too go back too try more of the menu. Now three of us that more food can try. We ordered the chicken chow fun with black bean sauce. It was solid dish. I associate the black bean sauce too anything seafood or specifically clams with black bean in chinese restaurants almost fool proof. I enjoyed fact that had right balance not too much bean but nice hint along with chicken, vegetables, and prefect noodles. Delicious! We order the shrimp fried rice that was good. I think still would take the beef fried rice had the last time. COURSE since three pf us  got full lb of without doubt best roasted pork in Vegas. If read reviews reason why people come here for the roast pork. The only thing that little bit of let down had the roasted duck won ton soup. The roasted duck main reason ordered it plus never had soup here so figure get the best of both worlds. In this case not so much because being in soup lose the whole crispy duck skin. I could imagine just duck would be winnah although still lose out too the Roasted Pork. The noodles in the soup was just bland no flavor, the broth would say the same, the won ton was ok, and if order the roasted duck would taking it over rice then soup. Just me. I enjoyed Asian BBQ & Noodles it small place but has so much personality. When you go too restaurant that only takes cash helps keep from racking up the credit card debt. Lol!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Duck won ton noodle soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chow Fun with black bean sauce
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lb Roasted Pork!

qgra0an9iP8w-_ku0VfXAA.text: Everyone is raving about the pork, but I actually preferred the duck. I ordered the combination and I'm sure glad I did because all I read on here is the pork. I thought the pork was okay and the duck was actually tastier. I came on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy, but we were seated immediately when we came in. Most of the items are under $10, which is a deal in my book. Maybe this place was a little too authentic for me because most of the dishes had a home-made flare rather than the typical Chinese restaurant. One thing I do applaud them for is the service, the service was greeat! We were treated like human beings, which not very common at Chinese restaurants. Most of the time as a customer you feel like the server/owner is doing you a favor by serving you, but totally not the case here. If you're a big duck fan definitely come here. I'll probably swing by again just to try the soup because it looks pretty tasty on the Yelp pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Number 7.. Pork belly and duck.

IJtl_Aqm7azgsB6vrdjxLA.text: Note of advice: order for pick up/to go. Trust me you do not want to deal with the service. Absolutely rude!

ZAsSse8y3XlzzJXZexuGrg.text: We have tried only one item at this restaurant and keep coming back for it. Their pork belly is so delicious and addictive. It runs a little over $12 per pound and is well worth the price. We often serve it with baguettes or sticky rice.

9tYrMwE8MVNToPd6Xx5Jyw.text: You know the main photo for this place? This one: s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com... It's haunted my daydreams for months. Could it look any tastier? Every time I see it (or think it), I envision how good it must taste and have come close so many times to ordering it. I know, you're wondering "well why on earth didn't you?" The answer is not an easy one. Some combination of a lack of an official website/menu which can turn me off of a place a little, along with being tied to lunch partners who wouldn't have a desire to visit, along with some unknown fear that resided with me in trying it. Well today I strapped on a "No Fear" t-shirt from 1995 (not really) and called in an order to make my dreams come True. It was not easy. I venture to say it was one of the more difficult phone ordering processes I've ever experienced. It took a few minutes for me to convey I wanted the Roast Pork and Roast Duck combo over rice and an iced tea to go. In fact, during the drive there I was certain it wouldn't be what I wanted, that my dreams would be crushed over a simple game of telephone. When I showed up the entire restaurant was packed, and it made the telephone conversation difficulty a little more clear to me. Seeing the "Cash Only" sign only amplified my fear that my order was wrong and that they would try to charge me for a full roast duck and pig and a side of rice, in which I would need to work off by washing dishes in the back for the rest of the afternoon. To my pleasant surprise, once the cashier had a free second she rang me up and I was charged $6.99 (before tax) just as the photo told me. After what seemed like an argument I was given my iced tea and on my way. Back at the office I hurriedly opened my lunch to see what I had coveted all these months right in front of me. No napkins or fork were provided (just a spoon(?) and some chopsticks (I know, those should suffice), but at this point I didn't care, all I needed was my mouth and my combo. I was not opposed to shoveling it in with my bare hands if needed. I procured my own fork and napkins and dug in. It would almost be impossible to live up to my expectations, but it came very close. The duck was tender and delicious, and the pork was very tasty but I found it to not be as moist as I expected. The 10 lbs of rice and handful of pieces of Chinese broccoli were a good accompaniment. I was tempted to go 5 stars as dream fulfillment ranks very high on my list of pluses for a business, but the service could have been a little friendlier and the pork a little more moist for it to be the perfect experience.

S1oIMz3JWWTHnqk74XVtQw.text: Love the duck and roast pork. I haven't tried anything else but I will definitely be back to try other things on the menu.

nlLDdz1miKzUfWIpn3Lu4A.text: This place is authentic.  All the clientele were Asian with both Vietnamese and Chinese speaking.  They specialize in roast duck and pork.  You will see both meats hanging waiting to be purchased or ordered for a meal.  Service is quick and an ample amount is given.  My hubby had roast pork over rice.  The pork had a nice crackle to the skin, slim on the grease and meaty flavor.  I ordered curried squid and vermicelli noodles (bun) in a hot soup.  The squid was on a skewer and dipped into curry sauce.  The noodles were slightly chewy and plentiful.  It wasn't how I imagined being served yet still tasty.  The squid was a little overlooked but not rubbery.  It could have been from sitting near the hot soup.   Nothing fancy nor romantic about this place, just plain good food.  Excellent moderate prices too.

gNuzTnX63xe5Tm_Kuxdi6w.text: A hidden gem look past the cheesy green and yellow paint on the walls and all the fake plants surrounding the place the food is amazingly delicious.this place stays busy it's always a full house and you know what that means good ass food !! FYI CASH ONLY

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #67 the must, best gravy ever.
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. roll noodle with XO sauce !
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #7 BBQ 2 combo on rice, why you so good

8N-pZaJw_S8b3TgghKdM0g.text: It is all about the ROAST PORK and DUCK.  Being from the Bay Area, a place with plentiful Chinese food, I was pleasantly surprised by the Chinese BBQ at this place. The roast pork was super tender and its skin super crispy... Imagine a delicious piece of meat practically melting in your mouth and then bite down for a satisfying crunch from the skin. The duck's seasoning was unique - I had never had any duck as peppery as that, but it was a nice change of flavor.  They have other noodle dishes and their wonton soups are pretty good, but I would definitely recommend their BBQ. It does seem to be high in demand, and they ran out of roast pork when were were leaving, around 7 PM, so go early! (But not too early, as it seemed like their BBQ doesn't come out until around 5 PM). The ladies working are friendly, but probably more so if you speak Chinese.

GG2W5SZCrOjS8bVdErvVjg.text: There's not a lot of Asian places here in Vegas but this one is the best in town.    We got the crispy pork and it was just enough crispy on the skin and tender on the inside.  I also fried the BBQ pork.  It was delicious!! The duck was good but the pork is much tastier here.  We also tried some of their soups and noodle dishes.  The chow fun was really good.  You can also choose how you want your soup made.  Surprisingly for a Chinese place, the udon noodles were really good.  The curry fish ball was interesting and quite tasty.  Every item you choose, really enhances the soup itself.  Either way, very delicious.  I'm excited to say that I will definitely be returning.

5Vy5cYnTNEEQZo0-ioLbaA.text: This place is HOT, no room to sit, tables are full and people are still coming through the door.  We got one of the last tables, for two, stuck in the corner, but still happy to be seated.  The menu's arrive and my husband has already made up his mind, but tonight, they are out of duck!  So we both end up with a combination BBQ plate and shared a side order of noodle.  The noodle was good, my BBQ plate was decent.  The fact that they are busy, the service was just fair, and we missed out on their specialty.    I enjoyed people watching, there were so many people, obviously not from Vegas, talking non stop, and getting dish after dish.  I think that one big table, got everything on the menu!  That's probably why we were after thought in our server's mind.  It's worth a trip back, to get the duck and see if we agree with so many others, that it's in the top 100!  We just need to figure out when they are slow.

TgHPWMk-AflrctOWjURlVA.text: I don't know if it's just me but the wait line was way too long and on top of that the food is expected to be at the least "good." We ordered 8 different plates and they were all under seasoned, bland, or just alright at best. I tried to be unbiased but I honestly believe every other asian BBQ place I've eaten at whether it's Vietnamese or Chinese (what this place is for) has been a lot better. With the others reviews, there might be a chance that it's just my family's tastebuds, but I was definitely disappointed. The service was pretty good though so overall 2 stars!

o0RdhGE0Jq3IlO2FVO4j7A.text: I love this place. I rarely give out 5 stars here Yelper.  This is the real deal for some Asian BBQ and noodle soup. I wish I live closer! This is a must stop when we visit Las Vegas. Actually make it the first stop. :)  I always get the Roast Pork, BBQ Pork, Wontons and hubby likes the Hainanese Chicken Rice. They are always busy and they take cash only.

KrPoi-sDv_ZreX7R-Hm64g.text: When miscommunication happens, the waitress will come at you screaming "you said bean sprout!!!!" LOL whiskey tango foxtrot?

jqN0N9-8KVfFTLNJXFjEKA.text: If you want oodles of noodles that are, you know, delicious and cheap, this is your place. The volume of options can be a bit daunting, but so long as you keep it simple, you'll enjoy everything there.   You can build your own bowl of noodles (choose the type of noodle you want, the broth, and the toppings) or you can order a pre-set combination of noodle, broth, and toppings.   Also, get the duck or any of the BBQ meats in addition to the noodles.  Very busy place. Expect a wait during peak hours because they do get pretty busy!

3qVyyUosVv3ucy7zw8jJAA.text: This just isn't my type of place. you know your in trouble when there are no appetizers. I also felt that our waiter didn't speak english very well. the choice I made was ok but I wouldn't order it again and with someone who could clearly explain what things were and what I might like Im sure I would have had a better meal. They have whole ducks and pigs hanging in the BBQ warmer,which again isn't my style.I prefer to see my pork cut up on my plate.Im not to keen on seeing dead animals hanging by their snouts while im eating.Looked more like a shop of horrors then a restaurant. Again just not my cup of tea.which by the way we weren't even offered,I guess our eyes were too round to warrant that delicacy. basically my impression was that it was a fast food version of mcdonalds,chinese style.there was also an unpleasant smell in the air. I wont be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I always wondered what happened to miss piggy

ehD7C2bpIFgG1Zn5go2uGw.text: Don't tell me to come in at 5:00 when your duck isn't ready until 6pm. We ordered a roasted whole duck one week in advance for Chinese New Year. I get there with my receipt and after I waited for already 20min, an employee comes up to me and says, you're going to have to wait for another 20min for your roasted duck, unless you want to order something additional. I'm just like, excuse me what?!?! Did your customer service regulation go out the window. This is complete BS. Don't tell me this after I wait 20min. Did you give my order to someone else?!?!?! There was absolutely no organization in this restaurant what so ever. When someone orders an item 1 week in advance, they are obviously expecting punctuality. Never coming back here again. Congrats you have lost my business.

WdQbICGCe91vxyx8P4QWcQ.text: This place is as real as it gets. You can get the entire pig. Even pig blood and intestines if that's your style. Chinese broccoli is cooked perfect. The duck is my favorite followed by the BBQ pork.

KmQg5Y-c-3LapT-l-WvFuw.text: Delicious food for reasonable prices. I was craving duck noodle soup, and this was definitely the place to go. The roast pork had a surprisingly crunchy texture that I found fun. The duck wonton soup smelled and tasted very 'Asian' but the regular wonton noodle soup broth was a bit bland.

e67AF32Pj2R_7QlEgTA0kg.text: This place may be wonderful and have great food but today I was there for almost 45 min and still got no food!  I was excited because I have been looking all over Las Vegas for some good BBQ pork and when I arrive the line was out the door!   When I walked in I knew exactly what I wanted to order! 1 pound of BBQ pork to go! We were making our own soup at home and just needed the meat to top it off.  Anyways I waited in what I thought was a line to place my order, but everyone ignores me!!! Then I asked the lady at the counter who would take my order and she looked away!!! So I stopped someone else in the place and said who can take my order to go? They pointed in the direction of a woman walking around helping ALL of the people who were behind me in our line.  Finally after about 5 min she approached me took my order and them gave me a number. Yay!!!  Then it goes downhill... I waited for 25 minutes.... In front of register with my 4 year old who they kept telling to move. And all of a sudden the lady who took my order comes up and says... We are out of the BBQ pork!!!! You can wait 30 more minutes but the regular customer got it!!!!!  Omg! I was livid!!!!  Was really excited! Wanted to give it a shot, but on too of the customer service towards me being horrible I didn't even get to taste the food!   BETTER LUCK TO SOMEONE ELSE!

Y7sZX91KxddGr1wnYG1esQ.text: Finally found a good Asian BBQ spot!  We've been trying all the Asian restaurant along spring mountain dive we moved here 7 months ago. Most of them are just average and over price BBQ. We went to this place base on recommendation and we were satisfied with the taste, price, serving and service. It's not a fancy place but the food is pretty good! We got roast duck, ginger chicken and chicken fried rice. We are definitely making this place our go to comfort food!

9hzsPG0Es71N25RPmysbUw.text: Very crowded no room to move. Small tables. Bbq pork came in 5 min fried rice took 25 min so by then the bbq pork was cold. Waiter came by once for the order never saw her again.Bad customer service.

XBIrK12chHsiuxYm1TJICA.text: This is the real deal. Genuine Chinese food with quick prep. However, this place is a ZOO and really popular with the locals. If you want to be waited on hand and foot, go somewhere else. If you are ok being more 'proactive' in grabbing the attention of your overworked (but competent) waitress, then come here, you will not be disappointed.

-uhfW_oSTkvCs4nu18tN_w.text: Food was great and very tasty.  Like any other asian place you typically go to, the service definitely was not stellar. Overall, will likely go back if I am ever back in town.

Qx_yZvByIC4iQgEBLTKAIw.text: Ok. fact or fiction.  Fact: 1. They are cash only business. 2. If u are looking for a place to eat. Where u can contemplate and consider the merits of each mouth watering dish in a calm and zen like environment. "This is not the place"  It is pure chaos, noise (chatter) and movement all the time.  "I Love it". Chinese food with a show!  3. Expect to be greeted and seated with a menu when they can get to you!  4. Expect to be asked for your order 20sec after u have been seated. You have 10sec to respond with ur full order, or they will move on to the next customer. (Saw 2 different hostess do this) 5. Some of the best prices and menu options. 6. A non complex menu. It is what it is! With gravy or dry is all u need to know for your noodle dishes. 7. 5 star:  must tries      The duck, so good.      The soup, seafood dumpling with noodles. The broth was rich, salty.       4 Star:  delicious      The crispy pork belly and BBQ pork rib combo. I personally did not try this (gave up pork products for lent) but trust the people I was having lunch with. That it was good.       Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. I know not original. But this is always a must order dish for me .      3 Star: good but not great .       Combination crispy noodle. The noodles were off the hook. The gravy was good, that's it just good .   Fiction: 1. The best service you will ever have.  2. A nice quiet place to contemplate your day.   "Lol, not here"  I will deffinately come back here to try the many different dishes here , especially the soups.

TTybkYTt_TQm91nPhUO1NQ.text: If you want Chinese food in Vegas , this is a great place to go. Different choices likes noodles, congees, bbq pork, curry fish ball etc. Cheaper price for Chinese food in Chinatown. Not bad at all!

O_YjQUWdh9w-WP6oLkoMpw.text: If you're looking for indulgent meat, your search may end here. GIven that the primary headliners here (BBQ and Noodles) aren't my routine diet, it has taken me quite some time to venture here. However, I am glad that I did because it's a little Vegas gem.   As long as you are not sensitive to neon green and yellow walls, the interior is downright cozy and definitely clean. It feels like a True Chinatown immersion. If you don't speak Chinese or aren't familiar with the offerings, ordering might be a tad intimidating, but we had a super friendly waitress who tried her best to decipher what we wanted. She did a good job, except for the noodle dish. Somehow we ended up with a pile of plain, albeit very long, noodles and a pair of scissors.    The real star here is the pork with its perfect combination of buttery, succulent fat and magically crispy rind. You order this meat candy by the pound. We also ordered the soy sauce chicken, and I confess, the skin creeps me out, but the flavor was delicious. My husband couldn't stop raving about it. Nothing we tasted had the heavy five spice flavor, which is something I generally do not like.   After a minor communication breakdown, we managed to order ong choy stir fried with garlic. It was rather greasy, but I couldn't stop eating it! The menu only lists vegetables with oyster sauce, so I am not sure how you unlock this vegetable version. After trying to explain what we wanted, our waitress came by with a plate of vegetables she was taking to another table, and we said, "Yes, that!"  It was too hot for soups that day, but I definitely want to make it back to try their wonton.   If you're a lover of all things Asian, this is a must-try for sure.

QfGcoZjxCUYVPyUweiZWgw.text: Everytime I come to Vegas with my family we come to this place. It's great for big groups and it has great Chinese food. It's good if you want to take a break from the buffets. I would totally recommend this place.

MywNPEBTs68x7UEvLkZ7XQ.text: friendly staff and great food! It's always busy in there so be prepared to wait if you're dining in. Tip: This restaurant is cash only

1WMT_iamdKW018t5YKvlow.text: The best part about roasted duck and roasted pork is the crispy skin! So if you're one of those people who counts calories, hates greasy food and what not, then... you might just want to stick to Panda Express =P  Coming from a predominantly Asian community, my standards for Chinese food are pretty high. A couple of my classmates and I came here on a whim in search of good duck and crispy pork. We didn't order anything else on the menu, so I can't vouch for any other items. However, the pork & duck rice plate with yu choy (a Chinese vegetable) is pretty wonderful, especially at $6.95 a plate. It comes with two sauces to dip the meat in. And of course, the duck and pork skins are crispy and tasty. Quite the bargain :)

2I1GgHnm7g-leXDNkWLHaA.text: You could say I'm a conniseur of roasted stuff or "sieu yeah" in Chinese...  Being that I grew up in chinatown SF, I have sampled this fine delicacy on occasion. And I have to say this is the BEST in Vegas!  As MC Hammer said "u can't touch this" Salty,crunchy,tasty,fatty, o sooo good! Wonton noodle soup is as authentic as can be... There are multiple combos to choose from so sample away at this smorgasbord of Chinese tapas.  Chapas? A new category? I rec you try this spot n forget the rest, it trumps even BBQ king, yes I said it..... This is the real deal my fellow foodies!  Forget the rest, try the best....  Siyanara, wait thata Japanese  Joy geen!  Adios avedazay ciao  I meant what u knew.....

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The combo BBQ, oh yes!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted delicacies !

Dhz0PrN4EGw8eJtUpiTgoQ.text: I knew I was in for a treat before I even stepped in the door for lunch today- I could smell the food from the parking lot.   After reading several yelp reviews on this place, I decided to try the Wonton soup (4.99) and the two meat combo plate with steamed rice (6.99). The lady at the counter must have known it was my first time there, because she practically grabbed my hand and walked me over to the hanging pork and duck. The roasted duck was a little fatty for my liking, but the BBQ pork was amazing.   The pork was super tender and had a sweet flavor. I recommend adding a little chili oil to the pork!  The combo plate came with about 10 slices of each protein , steamed rice and greens. At first I thought they were  green onions, so I put them off the side. Upon further review, I added them back to my plate and was glad I did.   Unfortunately, I didn't agree with previous yelp reviews on the Wonton soup. The broth reminded me of miso soup and seemed to have a fish stock base to it. The Wontons themselves contained shrimp -which I did not expect. Since I am not a huge fan of shrimp, I can't confirm that this is the best version of Wonton soup in Las Vegas (as other have claimed).   The restaurant is clean, and well organized. There is a large menu on the wall behind the cash register that makes it easy to order. My food was ready in less than 10 minutes, and was still piping hot when I got back to work. I love this place, and can't wait to come back.

IWyh12Swdf5xXV-3fWuvtA.text: Okay, this is my forth time come to this place within a month and half. That tells me, I have to re-update my previous review. I really like the price of this place, it's really affordable. Most of the food come out really quick. Well, most of the food is already pre-made, that's why it comes out fast.   The BBQ Chicken and Duck is pretty good, not too much meat in it. I felt like there is more bones than the meat. But the BBQ roast belly pork is excellent, crunchy on the skin, juicy in the middle part, nice and tender on the meat. Perfect balance. I think it's my favorite, will always have to order that everytime I come.   3 stars for most of the food, 5 stars for the BBQ roast pork, 5 stars for the price minus 0.5 star for not accepting credit card.. Atmosphere 2.5 stars.  Average 4 stars. Great place to dine.

2yy3Z9E-SMnBM3YL-AG5RA.text: Best wonton noodle soup in town.  The noodle in the soup was nice and firm, the soup itself was so tasty with lots of flavor from diffrent spices and a very strong but sweet flavor of seafood. Wonton was very good, it was made with shrimp and pork. They cooked the veggies just right, not too raw and not too soft.  I have been here three times already. I am not impressed with other stuff on menu, but maybe it's because after the wonton soup, everything else seems second rate.

w6qcPSM_fOmhIe1HgAx-xA.text: I'm not one to give a bad review but when a place really misses its mark, I am definitely going to share what I went through.   We went there on a Sunday afternoon and the restaurant wasn't even that busy, in fact I had the largest party (of 7) when I arrived. The server automatically brought out waters but took a couple of minutes for the menu to get to me after he was ready to take my order and realized I didn't have one.   I ordered the whole duck which came to my table room temperature, it wasn't even hot to enjoy that parts of the duck that contained a high portion of fat was too fatty to bite into.  The Shrimp & Combination Fried Rice wasn't too bad but wasn't the best either. The ratio of noodle to veggies/seafood for their pan fried noodle wasn't well proportioned (lacked so much noodles) and finally when I ordered the pigs ear in soy sauce & the spicy chicken feet, it would've been nice to be told that these were cold appetizers.   My server was too busy catering to the other customers who were Chinese unlike me & my party who were not. Even to get a water refill was almost impossible. I can guarantee you that this is definitely the first & LAST time I'll be ever eating here & I work for the hotel industry so I can assure you that I will spread the word to my friends that this place is by far a horrible choice to make! If I could rate it with negative stars, trust me, I would have!!  I was so disappointed because for the first time I went to a high rated establishment that was a total False rated place for me.

iSbZ-b0A9_YuAIRHy6p4Tw.text: This place is one of those hole in the wall. If you can bypass some of the asian rudeness then you will find that this place is a goldmine. This place can get crowded as its a very small restaurant. When there is a line of peoppe, it can get confusing. They dont really have a number system and when they give you a ticket, they just write down the number of people. So once you get your number, you will need to keep a mental note of who was there before and after you or else yoy may wind up have a MoFo come in and take your spot.  Other than that, the food is fantastic. The porridge taste better than some of the restaurants in the san gabriel valley and the bbq is tastier and softer as well.  Definetly a place to stop by if you crave authentic asian food once you are done gambling.

odYN_f4vYN9u2iX60mbxCQ.text: Not the best Chinese BBQ in the world, but certainly better than BBQ king. This place is not only cleaner, but it is air conditioned. This is as good as Chinese BBQ gets in Vegas. You can also order che jai meen (combinations with I.e. pig blood, pig ears, beef stomach, etc). They serve good wonton noodles. Price is cheap too.  Update: I haven't been there recently, but I heard they raised their prices by about a $1.

Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HMZ1nGjq2fsKKkmri1BDBw.text: Pork belly is amazing, the combination of juicy meat and crispy skin is just awesome.  It is one of the best pork belly dishes I have ever had the pleasure of eating.   I know we ordered other dishes which were also good, but nothing was on the level of the pork.    Definitely worth venturing off the strip for the pork belly, will return next time I'm in Vegas.   It's your typical authentic Asian restaurant however, its not the cleanest place and the service is lacking.

6m11i64nHQl9P5d6F0TgEQ.text: They're awesome at what they do here.  BBQ pork, roasted duck, noodles.  Crowded, and long waits sometimes.  Also, sometimes on a busy day/night, they run out, so call ahead.

pygxkFvjkAUduxVN-GpziQ.text: Pretty busy Asian BBQ place, a la Sam Woo but without the loud people and screaming kids. It's away from Chinatown, so mostly locals only eat here.   Food is awesome. Just by myself I ordered 3 items just to try and they were all tasty. The roast duck and wonton soup was full of wontons and duck, and very little noodles, most other places it's the opposite. The steam chicken and ginger/scallion sauce was top-notch, chicken is fresh, you can tell by the chewy skin texture, kinda like a baking hen. Wife had a soup with curry fish ball, must say we had never tried this, so wasn't expecting too much, I came away loving it, wifey so-so, but then she's Caucasian and grew up on meats and potatoes, roast pork was flavorful and skin was crispy like it should be...so much to eat and best of all you can't beat the pricing.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is so good!

DG-xA2Q6cPLjl45o-syBYg.text: I love this place! This place has one of the most authentic hong kong style cuisines in terms of the noodles. It is one of the secrets of Chinatown area until recently when more and more people are coming. It has been voted 8th in the top 100 Chinese foods list. My family comes here all the time due to its authenticity in terms of taste and cost. First, the cost for the food is cheap compared to other places and there is a variety of things to try from roasted duck, roasted pork, to noodles, to various toppings to add onto your noodle. And they are closed one day of the week, I think it was Fridays that was written. Second, the food comes really fast after ordering. This place is always crowded around lunch time and you will have to wait if there are no seats. The place is pretty small compared to many other restaurants in terms of space and seating. Third, the food is always flavorful. Though I had a couple times where the topping I wanted "Pork Blood" was sold out. All the toppings are always cooked really well. The main thing to try at this place is the noodles + toppings. You have a choice between the type of noodle you want. I usually chose udon due to my taste for a more chewier noodle. And then you can choose whether you want one, two, or three toppings to add into the soup/noodle. The toppings range from pork blood, pork belly, curry fish balls, fish balls, tofu, and etc. Also, there is a lot of different mixes that they are willing to accommodate if you ask. For instance, you can order a won ton soup and still add in different toppings if you wanted to.  However, if your taste buds are not so interested in the toppings you can add into your noodle, there is always duck and chicken to try. It is always fresh and flavorful. The butcher always cuts the meat really clean so when you get the product, you don't have to go trying to pull the pieces apart. In addition, he is very delicate with the food (which also means patience) if you are looking to do take-out. But the duck and chicken are a lot better than other Chinese places I've eaten at.  Very important: This place is CASH only.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Udon with pork intestine and pork blood
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry fish balls
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu 5/5

WhHZdlb_EK307AElwzcNbA.text: A few friends were on a search for somewhere to grab a late lunch. It led to this place, located well off of The Strip. "They supposedly have the best bbq pork in Vegas", they said. Challenge accepted. Definitely off the beaten path for us, as we found it nestled in a corner of a strip mall. They ordered the pork while I got the roast duck. Awesome for the price and portion of the food. Have you ever had bbq pork with the skin on it? Not only that, but it's cooked to a crisp, like a pork rind? Oh my blob, it's good! The roast duck was very tasty, and they even topped off the rice included in the place with its sauce. Worth the visit, and worth coming back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BEhbquHObn7TOdVSkX-RLA.text: Sooooo good. By the time we got there, around noonish - there was already a wait. We waited about 10 minutes. Found this place on Yelp and noticed their BBQ items. Went with a pork and wonton noodle soup, soy sauce noodles, half a duck, and some pork belly. Everything was delicious, especially the duck. No complaints to the food. Cash only.

hRaTFtRpw4JYFyoH8Xz-VA.text: Before heading back to Cali, my friends and I wanted to get a quick bite. My buddy keep talking about this place she found on yelp. I was already skeptical about this place but I always try to keep a open mind. This interior decoration was horrible. Nothing on there menu look appetizing. I decided to be safe and just order the rice dish with bbq pork and roast pork. It wasn't bad but nothing special either. Would I be back! No!!!

pijzHvkckaaMJEhvEVCOEg.text: Decent Chinese food. Their Ong Choy was fresh and delicious. Small dish BBQ was good too. Would come back!!!

vziJHnx30ateIP9j2sOzxg.text: Get the pork belly bbq. The wonton boodle soup was also really good. This place can compete with any noodle house in the san Gabriel valley. And he portions are generous.

tKIblE1GGHQ80VWPiaiiPA.text: Nothing mind blowing, but it gets the job done.   We were craving congee after a long night out. Ordered the thousand egg variety, and the duck. The thousand egg congee didn't have the yolk, my favorite part :( Just the brown gelatinous "whites"... so sad.   The duck pieces in the congee was surprisingly pretty meaty.   We also ordered the three meat combo with chicken and pork. It was decent.   I'd probably come back if I was craving hole-in-the-wall greasy-spoon Chinese/viet food.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3-meat combo - roasted pork, soy sauce chicken, hainan chicken
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thousand year old egg porridge

qdVDPzIcG8rc-T4QiYW9MQ.text: Most legit Asian BBQ place in Vegas and might I say even better than LA...  ooo yea that just happened. Roast Pork's crispy skin always on point.  The go to:  Roast Pork, roast duck and bbq pork on rice. (Get extra duck sauce and pour some on the rice anyou're welcome) Pork and century egg porridge (if you're into that)  These are also good: Chicken porridge Crispy egg noodle with beef Beef chow fun Soy sauce chow fun Bbq pork fried rice Chrysanthemum tea (cold)  The wait can sometimes be very long during rush hour times. If you order on the phone, do yourself a favor and don't show up until 45 minutes later. You don't want to wait for your food in there, trust me. Small space, packed, and everyone walking back and forth. When you get to the cashier, be aggressive in letting them know which order you're there for, or else you will be ignored or someone else will jump right in front of you. That's just how it goes. Even though all this is a hassle, the food is so legit, 5 Stars. Been coming here for years.  FYI: CASH ONLY

fObsWM7Pv61hKwkeY9RcZQ.text: Can you guys change the cashier women ??? She has terrible attitude ALWAYS!!!! Me and my friend really hate her, always destroying our eat mood, even we just wanna to go sometimes. We are local and we like the food we respect, but not her. Sorry for the bad reviews, she just too mean to annoying people.  By the way, I'm glad to edit the review if you guys really care about customer or making some change.

U-qN-G3e_229vOLCG7Cs6A.text: If it's your FIRST time here, you've to try their roast belly pork and roast duck(thin crispy skin) yum-o!!!its one of the best in town and most popular.    I like their noodle  with wonton but the broth is kinda bland . Rice w salted and chicken is good(big portion) and XO noodle is pretty good( first time trying it). It's a small restaurant and gets very pack  during lunch and wkends. So I always go rt when they open( what can I say I'm an early ) hehe!!    The price are reasonable with big portions..

D62qDtKPXAea_02wMneW7A.text: They have the best roast pork and char siu in Las Vegas. I have tried many different places and theirs is even better than the ones in OC.  I have been going to them since they opened. Their duck is oily but delicious. Their noodles has the right amount of chewiness and the broth is not to salty.  All in all I like everything on their menu except the intestines and pig ears. I haven't had the courage to try those yet, maybe one day.  I am only giving them a 4 star instead of 5 because their service can be a hit and miss. Especially with the cashier, she has a grumpy face and doesn't acknowledge you. Since their food is so good, I will deal with their not so friendly service.

lZDl4x0Q1YMy1GyFXnk56g.text: Comparable to the BBQ and noodle places in Monterey park, for sure, and Monterey park is where you would go to for authentic Asian food places in LA county, Whenever we go to Vegas, we definitely try to drop by at this cute little spot.   They were named top 100 restaurants in 2012 (I believe) and I would vouch that they deserved the accolade.  I'm definitely a big fan of their noodle soup, especially their  combination noodles, as you get to choose the type of noodles and the type of meat/ veggies (pig intestines, pig tongue, pig feet, etc.).  Also love their BBQ items, their crispy pork and roasted duck are to die for!   Service was also good.  Food came out quickly, water was always full (without asking)! Like I said, probably one of the best BBQ and noodle restaurants I've had, would definitely recommend it!

pLUvr5gT-nF9meTxiCrN1Q.text: Dirty hole in the wall Vietnamese CANTONESE restaurant. Don't mistaken this for a traditional Vietnamese restaurant, they don't serve pho and any traditional Viet dish here. Their canto style food is super legit that I'm giving it 5 stars because the food alone make up for it. If you are planning to bring your date here for a romantic experience then you are in the wrong side of neighborhood. Some must try items are their crackling BBQ pork and roasted duck.

JGy3bcvUebB-zpT1TH4yhw.text: By far the best asian wonton noodles and bbq platter meat in Vegas!! Amazing meat.. and chinese brocolli. Friendly customer service and attentive, what I didnt like is it is small seating so sometimes long wait.. but a hole in the wall.. meaning very delicious for a small price. Really recommended!

nE_ULQgw-hAk8vLKAUvltQ.text: This used to be my very favorite restaurant. Unfortunately, the last two times my wife and I were there, seemingly things have changed.   Three days ago, my wife and I went in for our regular weekly visit.  As usual we ordered fish balls in curry sauce, marinated duck wings, char siu and roast duck, a dumpling soup and a beef with pan fried noodle.   It was at 12.30 pm and the place was jammed pack. We were seated in turn. The fish balls and the duck wings were per as usual, tasty and well done. Then came the char siu and roast duck which were simply awful. The duck pieces were full of fat and little meat. The char siu was tasteless. Our dumpling soup came and it was OK.   However, we waited for another 30 minutes for the fried noodle. When we asked the waitress to speed it up, we were told that the kitchen was very busy. I then noticed that nothing came out of the kitchen for a long time. All the other dishes, fish balls, duck wings and etc were all from the front counter.   What really irritated us was there were three tables that ordered later than we did, and their kitchen foods came out sooner than ours. When I expressed this to the waitresses, all they can say was Sorry. It took another five to ten minutes after the tables ahead of us had their food before we received our noodle dish.   What really ticked us off was that the fried noodle dish was simply awful, The noodle wasn't pan fried, feels like somewhat deep fried and very oily.  The sauce is minimal and the beef and veggies in the dish were not cooked properly and tasted terrible.  Ever since this restaurant has opened up another one on Spring Mountain, I noticed that the quality has slowly gone down hill. Have they moved one or two cooks to the new place?? Or is the new restaurant losing too much money and this place has to slim down to help out monetarily?? In  the old days, the owner(s) are always visible in the restaurant managing the place. Now it seems like the owners are not there, they may be at the new place, and hence when the cat is away, the mice play.   My wife and I have refused to patron their new restaurants as each dish is about 30 to 40% more expensive and the food is not as good as this place.   This place is such a money making place and if the owners choose to forsake this place and let it run down, it would be a terrible loss, for them as well as for their followers.  We will wait a few weeks and return for another visit. If it is still as bad as our most recent visit, I will simply write off this place and wont visit them again.

ugVSTuAXMsue_GygjGiXpg.text: My worst meal ever ., all the food come soooooo slow , that might be understandable as it's a rush hours but when we want to cancel the food ., server kept saying it's already cook and on its way ., but still took over 15 more minutes before it comes and it's so salty . Everything is salty , I order my hot tea ., no one care to come back to check on my drink and do hard to call any of them as they are too busy taking new customers and clear the table ., I don't know how can they get 8 out of 100 best Chinese restaurant when they can't even cope with rush hours properly

UfRCk3JM7D91DE8zSj8ziw.text: Love the crispy pork belly and cha siu. May be up there with the best places in NY and CA. I would recommend take outs. Small place and not kid friendly. Also it's cash only.

-VgCWcZZz392r4kq67PG9w.text: This place is genuinely good. Although this hole in the wall, corny decor, loud, only take cash, so-so service should knock a star or two off that's not what you come here for. You come for the best Chinese food in town. Once you've had bbq and the mouth watering X.O noodle all the small things mean squat.  I'm a regular and the food is always consistent, me and staff are coo now.   Stuff to remember:  1. Bring Cash, seriously they do not have one here. 2. If you come after 7pm expect them to run out of entrees. 3. They're closed on Fridays. 4. Get the tofu. 5. Be patient, there is no such thing as personal space.

MvfHZwpO1p3oSl-x8D93Qw.text: Food = 5 star  Service = 0 star  The best way to order... Pick a clear photo from Yelp and show it to the guy that takes order instead of trying to explain what you want.   Tip... When you order their whole duck, try to tell them you want the one in the showcase.   I came back a couple of times after my first visit. I tried BBQ pork and roast pork. Absolutely delicious.  Still, can't give 5 star to a business with rude service. On top of that, they only take cash and they are closed on Friday!? What kind of restaurant business is closed on Friday (especially at night. Major prime money making day for any restaurant business.)  ..... I will be back!

8jaZuhrgamDmTF7-6mj-8A.text: Large lot but it was very hard to find parking at 7 PM on a Saturday night. It's located in the same plaza as Snow White, a Mongolian hot pot place, District One and a few other popular restaurants.   The restaurant is pretty small and a server was talking to the cashier when I walked in. The cashier did not even look at me and continued to look through some papers. When I told her I wanted to order to go she waved over to a server to take my order. I noticed that prices have gone up about $2-3 for the combo plates. I ordered the 2 item combo ($13.99) and I chose the pork belly and duck as well as wonton soup. The total came out to be $22.69. CASH ONLY!!!   My order came out fairly quickly. There were 7 wontons in my soup which were good, but I felt that it was overpriced. The broth wasn't anything special, it seemed like regular chicken broth to me. I would recommend the wonton noodle soup over the wonton soup, I think they're the same price.  I was very disappointed in the pork belly. The portion I received was very salty. The duck was well seasoned but super fatty. I think I'll order only duck next time.

irPpKLjyKxKG42UGAn5yrw.text: If you're looking for the best Asian roast pork belly in Vegas - look no further. In addition to the bomb Asian BBQ here the wonton noodle soup and seafood chow mein Hong Kong style are a few of my faves.  Service is decent, but you'll want to arrive early for the lunch and or dinner hour since the place is popular and gets busy.    Bring your Jackson bills because plastic is unacceptable and you'll be washing dishes to settle your bill otherwise. Waitresses here aren't out of your way friendly but cordial and get the requests filled when made - pretty typical of most Asian establishments.   Come here for the solid food you won't be disappointed.

J8wZUO3dereIQfYxPZBj0Q.text: This is the best BBQ pork i have ever had in the US. The only problem was with their service. I think they need to manage their services. They need to put a sign for to go order or a sign to wait a table. For example, when i was there, i wanted to put an order for to go. I had been waiting for the line in front of the cashier for 10 minutes, suddenly the lady who worked at cashier said 'not here, you have to go there'. Oh no, i had to wait another line to order my food :(

rFrxMF_xKK3IsbYVf-QWtA.text: SPOILER ALERT! CASH ONLY!   When the question, "where is good Chinese food in Vegas?" Came up.. I had no idea where to go. I've had this place book marked for years and never went until tonight. There's a million run of the mill places but only a handful of gems.  This place is like a production line in the best way possible. Quick, polite, fresh, affordable, and satisfying. Come here for Chinese BBQ duck, pork, and pork belly. Served over rice, with noodles, or in soup. They do have a bunch of soups, pan fried noodles, and noodle soups. There are banners claiming it's the eight top Chinese restaurant in the entire USA- kind of cool!  I ordered the two meat combo served with white rice, shared an order of duck, and shared an order of crispy pan fried beef noodles with gravy. Everything was delicious. I particularly liked the bbq pork. It was melt in your mouth delicious. The pork belly was also really good with the dark dipping sauce. The white rice had a splash of meat drippings on it and really made the plate of food special. They served a complimentary soup that I liked. It was a nice start to the fatty dishes. The pan fried noodles were okay- kind of small portion of protein.  The BBQ'd meats were really good and each stood out in their own way. I was initially put off by the staff's lack of urgency with getting our order as opposed to diners who sat after us. There was a gentleman who sat after us, got soup, and got his entree before we even got water or placed an order. I'm glad the lady who came up to us did when she did because she was very sweet and helped us decide what to order. I'll give them the benefit of the doubt this time..  It ended up being a solid four as the food and sweet lady out weighed the bad. I really liked my dinner. I can't wait to go back and kind of fell in love with the hustle and bustle of this little BBQ joint.

eb1QFPwg0hP6oMGqscqLPw.text: In my recent Vegas one-day trip, I found a jewel in the Sin City !  Based on raved reviews from other Yelpers, I decided to give it a try (and I was so glad I did).  Everyone in my family agreed this was one of the best BBQ/Noodle house there is.  It rivals the best in San Francisco China Town !  We ordered: Wonton egg-noodle soup ($4.99), wide-strand egg-noodle (dry with soup in a separate bowl), porridge, bbq pork dish, roasted duck dish, roasted pork.  They all were delicious and hit the mark right on.  The noodle bowls and porridge are steaming hot as they come to the table.  The place was clean and efficient, very busy during lunch hours.  The restaurant closes on Fridays (that tells you how well the business is doing that they would choose to close on one of the busiest days of the week).  The waiter who waited on us was super helpful and friendly - a rarity in a Chinese establishment like this.  It was so good that we had to return the next morning for another yummy meal before hitting the road.  btw, we also ordered quite a bit of bbq and roasts to take home.  This is definitely a "Don't Miss" noodle house.  I hope it will continue to deliver such great taste in the years to come.

JenHk3JyS0OYelHgBEtGTA.text: Place was good, we had been loyal customers since their opening days and tips very well.  However, nowadays they are often busy, and servers have become very rude.  One day, my wife came in to pick up a take out.  They didn't provide the sauce that is supposed to go with the food.  My wife politely asked for the sauce, and they first stated take-outs don't come with sauces, and then they provided the wrong sauce.  My wife asked for the correct sauce for the food and stated she will pay for the sauce, and the response was "even you have the money, we will not sell it to you".  Well, we will not be going there anymore after that!  We know the owner lady, and she is a very nice person, so she is hearing from us soon...

VUUc2LLGKeY_8Jp_K3grWQ.text: A real local place! Great food, low price, friendly people! A perfect combination! Love it here!

Nv6Fqq8INaNKDaEeW7bEuQ.text: I was in Las Vegas for a convention recently and came across this place and decided to try it out for a change from our normal stop at Sam Woo and what a pleasant surprise! The place was about 1/2 full on a weeknight ~ 7pm with plenty of parking. Service was quick & efficient, not a fancy place but more than adequate. Ordered the bbq plate and Won Ton noodle, both were above average. The  bbq pork belly was so good that we ended up ordering another order. They also have quite a few items in the menu, we will try out others on the next visit, definitely add this one to the dining list in Las Vegas!

jNFs8eocaRc_2OagnWGmlg.text: Most Chinese food in this town sucks ass.  This is awesome.

IVaTXqSLVm3LZFJ-oxjcjA.text: Sometimes you just need some asian food.  For lunch we ended up in Chinatown at Asian BBQ & Noodles for a bowl of Duck and Wonton Noodle soup for just $6.  Wish i didn't have to play basketball right afterwards or else i would've gotten two bowls.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7k-bRHXtbcDwhdBhHZRcew.text: 300th review for Yelp! Crazy how time flies...  So I am a little late to the game, just finding out about Asian BBQ and Noodles recently...but better late than never!  Came here with Grandpa, so I decided it would be a great time to try a BBQ combination platter! We chose the Roasted Pork Belly, Roasted Duck, and BBQ Pork. Pork Belly was good, tender and flavorful with a very crispy skin. The Roast Duck was outstanding! Very juicy, flavorful and not gamey at all. The BBQ Pork was the highlight for me...great smokey BBQ taste, beautiful smoke rings and lots and lots of flavor! I'd say the Roasted Duck and the BBQ Pork are the best I've ran into so far!  Also tried the Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce. Good stuff! Came out piping hot, fresh, and yummy...good distraction from all the meat and rice   This was too much food for two people! And the prices are very reasonable, with rice bowls starting at $6.50 with choice of BBQ meat!  All of this cost less than a $20 bill for two people.  Just remember, cash only!  I love finding new places I can get excited about...a very worthy #300 in my book!

a6s1PZiC-7WONqdBIrazOA.text: $$$Cash Only$$$ My first time here (2 months ago, late review but better late than never) even tho its right next door to my friends restaurant District One, so I yelp'd Chinese BBQ pork and it lead me to this small hidden gem in Chinatown. So, I entered the place about 20 minutes after opening (10 am) and there were about 12 people already eating so I knew this place was going to be good if this was there choice of breakfast.  The place was CLEAN with great Chinese BBQ smells flowing through the air.  There were about 5 waiters waiting around to take your order when ready.  So, I ordered 1/2 of The Roast Duck, # of The BBQ Pork, and # of The Roast Pork. Everything was great with flavors n crunch and not greasy or fatty in anyway.  This hidden gem is Worth the drive from anywhere if you want the best of the best in pork and now my favorite duck (not a duck fan at all but this won my taste buds over).  They have a whole lot of other dishes that I will be back to try and I will be back! For More.
