po4RIcNHKTOoUtROIWoc2A.text: Picture it, three Asian dudes and one Midwest white dude who never acquired a taste for "Asian" food.  "I'll order for everyone OK?" says my bud, fluent in Cantonese.  Mutterings of indifference. A few minutes later steaming bowls filled with chewy, thin egg noodles and flavorful broth arrive, a generous portion of well braised beef brisket, soft gelatinous tendons, earth tripe, chewy pig ears, airy fish balls, shrimp filled won tons and flavorful mushrooms weighing everything down.  Chopsticks in hand we all dig in.  My Midwest bud, holding his fork, looking like someone stole Christmas exclaims "why couldn't we eat that", pointing at the table with a plate of roast pork.  The waitress answers for us "You eat first.  Good for you.  I bring after you finish".    To his credit he made it through the noodles and devoured the Chinese BBQ that followed.  Were talking a succulent roast duck with very little subcutaneous fat, the juicy meat permeated by star anise and bathed in its own juices and pureed innards; moist, salty roast pork with a golden, blistered crisp crackling skin, and a deeply flavored char siu, moist, some burnt bits for bitterness, sweet with a delicate fermented aftertaste.  Sure, the roast pork and char siu was a little lean but  this is health conscious 2013.  Very inexpensive noodles and rice plates (roasted meats, duck, chicken over rice with choy sum).  BBQ items sold by the pound, roast duck by the whole or half.  Good eats for sure.

Ksn1qN5cVRLqumqoyq5cvQ.text: This place is CASH ONLY!  If you find yourself in sin city... do not miss an opportunity to try the roast pork - it is "delicioso".  The roast pork is listed on the menu as "Roasted Belly Pork".  We have tried roast pork at plenty of restaurants in Monterey Park, SF Chinatown, Cupertino, Hong Kong, Vancouver Chinatown, etc... and this place has one of the best "chanchito" around!  We ordered won ton with noodles soup and the noodles were not overcooked and Hong Kong style.  Soup broth was just okay.  Also had a Yang Chow Fried Rice that was a bit on the greasy side, but acceptable if you are hungry.  We will definitely come back for the roast pork on our next visit to Las Vegas.

y7WyANvmWlEIgo6xYQ14nA.text: Had the trio, BBQ pork, roast duck and roast pork belly. I'm usually not a big fan of the BBQ pork but it was amazing here. Beautifully caramelized, tender and flavorful.  If you're looking for authentic noodle soup this is the spot. Very reasonably priced!

6jFtgryPQTZM3za8p_BtXQ.text: This place is really authentic. It's a simple kitchen like atmosphere, with great food served at a fair price.   What impressed me is they serve real Chow Mein, not Lo Mein, and call it chow mein. I strongly reccomend the BBQ Pork Chow Mein. I prefer the "crispy noodle" choice, but others tell me the soft noodles are also very good.   Great combos, and lots of choices if you like to eat duck. They skip the "gringo" Americanized Chinese dishes like Kung Pao Chicken and Sweet and Sour Whatever.  Just real authentic Chinese food dishes.   So, if you are into really good tasting, authentic Chinese food, and don't care about the table cloth, vest outfitted waiters, and the always positive fortune cookies, this is the place to go.  Also, it's great quality for take out, for that dinner at home, or house party.

yaDMF9ykoYL4ZFUfRgLHHQ.text: I have friends that mentioned this restaurant.  I was told there is always a line waiting to be seated and the food is good.  I decided to  eat on a Friday and there were about 20 people waiting to be seated.  You can put your own name on the list  just inside the door and I waited outside with others.  Several people outside asked if I had eaten there before and they also heard the food was good.  The wait was over 40 minutes and I was given a table against the wall which also served as a storage area for napkins, chopsticks, and condiments.  The place was packed and loud.  I had to complain that no one had taken my order as I observed others that came in after I did, being waited on.  I ordered the duck/BBQ combo plate.  I was told no more BBQ and the server suggested something she thought was good so I had duck/whatever.  I was given my drink and waited for what I thought was longer than I should have waited and I was brought a large  mound of  rice, which was good.  The duck was good but barely warm.  I'm not sure how duck supposed to be served but it was good.  The second item (pork?) was about room temperature and left no memorial impression.  I would not go through what I went through to eat there again.  The restaurant was packed with many Asian people so I have to think that the quality of food must be  what people are coming in for.  This restaurant has seating for about 40 people  but that seems a little to much for comfort.  I gave 3 stars for the experience I have to think 3 stars would be normal.

T3WvxxaurF_5WNdP6RLJhw.text: I frequently travel with family to LV for gambling and AYCE.  But you can only have so much AYCE before your tummy explodes! So as a little break, we like checking out local restaurants.  When we came across this little gem, the first thought that came through my mind was.. WHAT?!?!? Why are we eating Chinese food in LV, LA has SUPER awesome Chinese food and there's no way this place could compare.... boy was I wrong!  Delicious BBQ Pork and totally heart their noodle bowls.  Warning -  1. It's not a huge restaurant so expect long waits if in large groups! 2. Do not expect awesome service.  The wait staff is a rough around the edges but overall, they do aim to feed you ASAP.

-yMmbN6EXJax0IwZTzeQ7Q.text: Fantastic roast duck and the pork belly was delicious I give them five stars I'll be back

mY4RRu-6_VDihv4gcr5ebg.text: No frills chinese restuarant with delicious char siu and roast duck. Not a lot of room in the restuarant though.

BJGYWrD7_EyfUylubMFndw.text: The food was excellent, my date and I both got the BBQ pork and I LOVED it, I have been looking for good bbq pork for awhile and I'm so happy that I finally found it.   Not a big fan of the place being cash only, but I'll live and the service was pretty meh, but that pork! It was even good the next day, cold. om nom nom.

y_XVqTYWuXcux1w9NdUM5A.text: Food tastes so authentic, as if I were in HK!!  Ordered BBQ pork fried rice, BBQ pork on rice, and wanton soup, oh man it was so yummy and great portion, we were impressed!  Definitely recommended if you are looking for good HK style food!

TlYkxNNw9yRO1RfhEcPDRQ.text: This place is as authentic as it gets. The real deal. Bring cash ! They don't take cards

MeeFRir7r-NNEvolomNKGA.text: Love the roast pork so much. Flavorful and perfectly crispy.  The roast duck is savory and succulent  The BBQ pork is delicious too. Meats ranked in the order listed. They do Chinese BBQ right. Cooked to perfection.  The soup noodle (thin egg noodles) choose your items is really good. Soup base has a light curry flavor. Amazing authentic Chinese flavors. Love the stewed beef. Deep fried fish balls no curry.   Would love to visit whenever In Vegas

ZYunJLhXEQdUSXfCt3p-bQ.text: Richard Pro here with another review.  Delicious! Tried the roast pork, bbq pork, and HK style milk tea. Meat portions are huge, succulent, and juicy. I salivate at the mere thought of that massive plate of sliced roast pork beside cuts of honey glazed bbq pork. The HK style milk tea is excellent--not too sweet with a rich milkiness and bitterness.

F0DLgPc8tO2kGq9xJd6D1g.text: One of the best Chinese BBQ I've ever had. Believe me I've eaten in numerous restaurants in Hong Kong. Highly recommended. Prices are very reasonable.

dfMZHH7GdgFhPtM2eWns5g.text: I have to give this place a 5 star only because it's SO hard to find a place that sells their food cheap but also VERY DELICIOUS! Oh my goodness I ordered the pork combo with the charsiu and the pork belly and it literally melts in your mouth and the pork skin is so crunchy, it's slightly salty which makes it even tastier. And then I ordered a wonton soup without noodles and oh my was that surprisingly delicious! I say these two are the best combo to get! The wonton soup tastes authentic and not like they put a shit ton of MSG in there, the wontons have half shrimp and half meat in there and some Bok Choy but I have to say it is worth it! This place is wonderful for if you want good cheap Chinese food (:

Expect a line, but expect to eat some good food.    Go early they run out of some of the meats everytime I go.  Crispy pork is always on point.

cfY-2fEa7UxADjQ9DhY4Yg.text: My cousin and I went to this place together and she was not a fan of it. If she could rate it from 1-500 she said, she would rate it 500- but it's a negative. It wasn't my cup of tea either. Note that the wallpaper is hideous and their decorations consist of chili peppers dangling from the wall.

D5l6a9JnMjWQBESI3o0TyQ.text: Looking for a solid Chinese bbq joint? This little hole in the wall spot on Jones and spring mountain is straight fire! Definitely my go to for Asian bbq, It can get pretty packed on the weekends, and there isn't much seating, so I like to call in my order. I recommend the crispy pork, roasted duck, and the chili pig ear salad! Yep pig ears! So bomb. Oh gotta have the Chinese broccoli in oyster sauce also

HMA8wKaOa1BehzE6wryTvw.text: Made a trip from the strip to give this place a try.  The place was full and I was craving noodles/BBQ.  Service was very friendly and the food is cheap. $6-7 for a bowl of noodles with duck $11 for two types of meat  The noodles were just A-ok.  Nothing I would drive out for. Might be spoiled from all the good asian food in the bay area. Meat felt it was too oily, but it was good.  I recommend getting the spare ribs.

TrMqhdxDcW7fTjvNoOqaTA.text: This place is delicious! My family loves it and so do I! My favorite is their duck! The pork is delicious too. I defiantly want to try their noodle soup next time. This place is defiantly worth the bang for your buck! Busy place and cash only!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7.99 2 combo with rice. Duck and BBQ pork ribs, along with Chinese broccoli and pickled carrots and radish, yummmmm!

Nice size portion of the pork with some green veggies on the side and a scoop of rice with some sauce on it. T-T-TASTY!  The next time I go though, I promise I will try the PORK BELLY!!! AWWWWWWWW YEAAAAAAAAAAH!!!

eCTBZsTiASzfZ9rlsqDyuw.text: Like some others have said, the service can be much better. We've been here many times before and service was always just OK but this last time it was awful.   We were seated and had our order taken. Ten minutes pass and people who were seated after us started to get their food. Our server comes by and asks us to confirm what noodle dish we ordered. We told him and continued to wait, another ten minutes pass by.  A couple who had just been seated got what appeared to be a free bowl of soup and their food quickly. Finally a different server comes by and asks us to confirm what BBQ dish we ordered. We just decided to leave after waiting so long and seeing half the tables empty and people coming in and getting their food within a few minutes.   The food however is good, even though it's gotten more expensive over the past couple years. The roasted pork belly is probably the best in the city and the BBQ pork is solid. The duck is just mediocre though as it isn't very meaty. Overall for Chinese BBQ, I'd rather go across the street to Hong Kong Garden Seafood & BBQ Cafe. The service isn't great either but it's never horrible. To get my cheap roast Duck fix, I'd rather go to Foods 2 Go on Decatur & Tropicana at the International Marketplace.

Lav3eOBnH3RMhgTa_GpQfA.text: First, I have to comment about how CLEAN this place is!!! It's weird!!! Coming from the service industry, I always look at the cleanliness of the place and this place exceeds my expectations! I was in awe how clean their cutting board was! lol. This place will make you feel like you're not in Vegas. The food made me reminisce that time when I was at the night market in Kowloon! A place I definitely will frequent more often. I tried the BBQ duck with rice and washed it down with a Thai tea. I will recommend both! CLEANEST Asian restaurant I've been to!!! You gotta try it just for that reason!

Vj_iONXqhsuQw8RnffMulg.text: Went there last week. The soup was okay butter five star is going to the Peking duck and just plain rice.   And it was reasonable pricing too.

0TFnEFRioCr1imFHZQl4Gg.text: Awesome roasted pork and roasted duck.   This place is usually packed to the brim. When we are craving this place we make it a point to get there as close to opening time as we can to beat the rush and to ensure there is still roasted pork/duck left. Yes...they've run out before.   Parking: There is a good sized lot in the plaza they are located in, however, there is no guarantee that everyone parked politely. Let's just assume the dbag that took up 2 spaces was in some sort of roasted pork emergency.   My family and I usually get the roasted pork and roasted suck egg noodle soup with the meats on the side. That way the crispy crispy pork skin doesn't get soggy from the soup.   This place is worth the wait and enduring the fluorescent green and yellow walls. The layers of crispy pork skin, soft fat, tender juicy meat and flavorful end will make you want seconds. The duck is just as delicious with it's semi-crispy skin and rich meat. YUMMM. Get some to go too.

LyUPegWrUpJzfUwk1uOpCg.text: This place was simply amazing - their roast duck and crispy pork belly were probably the best I've had anywhere!   We came here because we wanted some Fobbinese food after gorging on burgers/sandwiches for the past couple days. Location-wise, it's off the strip and nestled in the corner of one of the Chinese strip malls in Chinatown where the prices are so much cheaper.   We had:  1. Roast duck and pork belly: Just friggin' delicious. Portion was plenty for all of us with just one plate. The whole plate was packed; although the plate itself was not too big to begin with.   2. Hainan chicken rice: Yummy!! The rice was a little hard (seemed like it had been sitting out for a while), but the chicken was tender, moist, and the whole combination was flavorful.  3. Salted fish and chicken fried rice: huge portion and big on flavor! So goooood!   4. We also ordered sides of fishballs and green broccoli - fresh, cheap, and delicious!   Service was rather slow, even when we came at 11 a.m, but the food is great, cheap and delicious!   I will definitely be back the next time I'm in Vegas.

The pork belly is the best of the 3.  The taste of this food just sits heavy on me and I taste it for 12 hours or so afterwards, No thanks and I dont have any issues with asian food in general.  The price is right with a two meat plate at lunch for less than $10

Mv8LravYZxZ3hzVi9_pWLg.text: Cheap, no frills, get-your-food-and-go kind of place. Kind of small and cramped, but the quality of the food is good. Too bad they don't seem to speak anything else other than Chinese, but it's not a huge hindrance if you just point at the menu.

n8STIx83OkROJ4WnyNQ_Jw.text: The chicken had no taste. It was just cooked in water the sauce they put was not that good. The chowmein tasted like it was bad... 36.75 down the drain. If I could give this place a -5 stars I would... Disgusting...

0FcnD4Lr80uy1R-l8z6Jjg.text: The best Chinese Roast Duck and Crispy Pork in all of Las Vegas. Closest thing to the Bay Area Chinese BBQ I've had here in Las Vegas. I've lived here in Las Vegas for 13 years and this is the go-to spot for Chinese barbecue.

AokdRZHH281atgT0fILYSA.text: Probably the best overall Chinese restaurant in Vegas, Asian BBQ and Noodle is a casual sit down place with roast duck, BBQ and crispy pork, and many other options.  I will say this place is unfriendly towards non-Chinese speakers who aren't familiar with this style of restaurant. They aren't mean but the menu is too vague and many of the waiters and waitresses speak much English. It is also cash only.  Still, the food is excellent and the prices low. My favorite is the cha siu. I get it either with rice or in soup with noodles.

0znf3wQmuaYsPy4unmf5wQ.text: Don't get me wrong, this place has some of the most delicious BBQ I have ever had but the lines here are insane especially on weekends and around holidays (duh I know, but when I say packed I mean sardines packed). If your schedule allows, I suggest showing up fifteen minutes before they open just so you don't have to deal with the crowds. If not, I suggest just getting it to go.   Their crispy pork is literally the best I have ever had. Lemme put that into context for you. I live in Southern California, and my family had made the drive just so we can show other people how good this place is. Their wonton soup and peking duck are good also. I love that I can get chinese broccoli with oyster sauce here (cause usually I'd have to venture to a dim sum place.)   There is really good, authentic Chinese food here and it's definitely worth the trip! If you're ever in the area, go and try it! You won't regret it!

CWGfRumnW0w7Z5hxSulWsw.text: I went their to have a quick lunch. I suspected they have sold the restaurant. Because the food quality declined and the food tasted blended. The skinny lady guarded the register was going to China a month. She never leaves the cash register. The toasted duck has no spices and tasted very blend. The wonton Noodles had only three wontons before they was 5 wontons. That's the last time I will visit that place again.

60wbyer2Zifp9jvEy1s8_Q.text: I love this place. It's kind of a little hole in the wall as it's tucked in the corner of the plaza. It's my go-to place for BBQ duck and pork. I order the #7 combo with the BBQ duck and pork, religiously. The rice is so yummy with the broth that they pour on it. I also recently tried the pan fried noodles and oh my gosh, it was delicious! I am really impressed with the consistency on how the food tastes every time I come here. I highly recommend going here for roasted duck. The jelly fish and pigs ears are also some of the sides that I enjoy from time to time but those are delicacies so it might be weird if you've never had them before. They're definitely good tasting so if you're feeling adventurous feel free! The service a hit or miss but oh well!   Also this place CASH ONLY, so bring some.

y0XUsvQLzfIibQw3_h9IxA.text: I love this restaurant. I take all my friends that visit Las Vegas here. Little gem with very delicious food. I always get the roasted duck, pork belly, and wonton egg noodle soup. The duck is incredible and pork belly is flavorful and crispy. Definitely one of my favorite spots in Las Vegas. Only down side is that they only take cash and are closed on Fridays! What restaurant closes on Friday!!?????

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8zDMBjoBCj1fUyu89ZkUww.text: Best duck in Vegas! We love coming here for delicious, authentic Chinese food. The only downfall is they're closed on the randomest day - Friday. They're also cash only so remember that before you go.   All dishes are made fresh daily. They throw everything out that isn't eaten at the end of the night.   There's so many yummy dishes here!! We always get the following:   1. Roast Duck: BEST DUCK IN VEGAS!!! They run out of the duck quickly on busy days. The skin is crispy and fatty, the middle is juicy, tender and tasty! It's so good. You can eat it by itself or dip it in the sauce it comes with. You can get a whole duck to take home as well.  2. Pork Belly: I've only had bad pork belly here once. Every other time it was tasty and on point.  3. Combination fried rice: can't go wrong w/ any of the fried rice dishes here.  4. Snow pea leaves vegetable 5. Steamed chicken   Everything is fairly cheap here. You can easily enjoy a hearty meal for $15 or less depending on what you order. Of course, all larger dishes are big enough to share family style.   The service is always good when I go w/ my mom or husband (both speak fluent Vietnamese or Cantonese). However, when it's just me there was a bit of a language barrier so they had a hard time understanding some of the questions I had about the dishes. I recommend reading the menu and naming the numbered item you want. The Food always comes out hot and fresh.   The place gets busy for lunch and dinner. You'll be seated faster w/ a smaller group (2 people). Anything larger may mean you have to wait a bit.   Overall, I love this place! Highly recommend if you want fast, yummy, authentic Chinese food    Happy Dining,   JT

l_L9ZPZ-QkKJ1nKICNjQ5Q.text: This cash only restaurant has some legit Chinese bbq. I've been here a couple times and each time I've left very happy and full. There's always a crowd here but wait times are never too long.   If you come here, I definitely recommend ordering their bbq items just to try it out. The roast pork has crispy skin, their chicken is very tender, and their duck is fatty, juicy and delicious. Can't really go wrong! If bbq is not your thing, their fried rice and noodles are excellent as well. My favorite is the salted fish and chinese sausage fried rice and the chiu chow rice noodle rolls. The salted fish adds a great salty flavor to the rice but the chinese sausage adds hints of sweetness. The rice roll is pan fried to crispy perfection with great flavor. The noodle comes with pork, shrimp, egg and green onions.   They also have stuff like wonton noodle soup and congee. Next time I go I definitely want to try out their congee!

gc6EE0jzT3QVzB4eivT9CQ.text: Packed little space! Friendly staffs and good smell lingering inside. Come early because they are so busy. I went there every time I visited Las Vegas.

ieK7n9umey7gO8LQCo1KmA.text: My mom loooves coming here. Every time I fly into town, this is the first place she takes me. It reminds her of home in Hong Kong, and honestly it's the brash service, loud and colorful atmosphere, that really reminds me of there too. Their service and food are straight from Asia, so you should walk in knowing what to you want, order, eat, and get out of the way. This is a great place for a quick bite, not a sit and converse for hours type of space. But the food is delicious and flavorful, I recommend the roast duck with rice and wonton soup. This combination is a Chinese person's comfort food!  TIP: I usually ask for light sauce over the rice because it can be too salty, or ask for it on the side and you can add as much or as little as you want.

H06ko42OccYrbncc08-9OQ.text: The restaurant is very small and busy, but the service is prompt. Went in on a Monday around noon and ordered half duck, vegetable fried rice and noodles. Took a bit to cook the duck, but food was delicious and hot when I got back to my friends house 30 minutes later. We devoured everything. Literally the best duck I've had in a long time. Order ahead for duck. The prices are really fair and the food is to die for.

XDWT28yd07oK8IqJ1I1yTw.text: Service is frenetic inside. I had the duck and it was quite tasty but a little overpriced for what it was.

lFUI141cbZ8O5ZIE2iN19Q.text: Cash only business.  Make sure you bring cash and a healthy appetite.  This place is what Asian BBQ is all about.    We ordered a two meat combo of pork and duck which really showcase the quality of the meat served here.   We also ordered Beef Chow Fun (beef with bean sprouts and wife egg noodles).  Be sure to order it dry as the wet sauce dilutes the fabulous flavors.   The Chinese broccoli on oyster sauce was perfectly prepared and an awesome bargain at $4.95.  Our last dish was a curry pork tendon with rice.  This is an acquired taste that isn't for me. My better half says it is quite tasty and well prepared.  I will take her word for it.    The service is what you would expect from a Chinatown restaurant.  It is brisk, efficient and non-personal.  I have grown used to this type of service so it does not bother me.  The facility could use a bit of TLC.  The door on the men's room is broken, the tables/chairs are a bit rundown.    The takeout business is brisk and when you eat the BBQ here you can understand why.   Great place for hardcore foodies!

Ir38Fk-7gSLDIU2RKfhkSQ.text: Go grab some cash and come get the three meat plate. Just don't do it on Fridays, because you'll be sorely disappointed- they're closed.  The roast duck is the obvious top pick, juicy and delicious. My second-favorite is the roast pork, fatty and tender. The BBQ Pork is another option, thin-sliced and lightly sauced. The plate gets all of these served on a bed of rice with some Chinese broccoli, and it makes a huge meal.  Got the won ton soup based on all the other rave reviews- I like that the broth was actually seasoned, and the won ton filling had a good sesame oil flavor, but this dish doesn't travel well and is probably best left off your list if you're grabbing takeout.  As others say, the service is uh, "authentic"? Don't expect the staff to understand you without making various hand gestures and/or pointing. But the prices are fair and the portions are huge, and even if they give you the wrong thing, it's probably still super tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork,  duck, and  bbq pork

nUfyVjemtOfLmXag0nBbNg.text: Asian BBQ & Noodle is one of my go-to spots when I want something delicious and cheap. Being Chinese, I've grown up on Chinese food and am very familiar with many restaurants across town. This place is my absolute favorite spot in Las Vegas to eat Chinese food. I've had AMAZING Chinese BBQ in Hong Kong and this is the closest to it in quality and taste (very authentic).  I always get the #7 combo (2 BBQ meats with rice and vegetables). The duck skin is consistently crispy, which is hard to find in a lot of Chinese restaurants. The roast pork is so delicious and flavorful. I like the sauce they put on the rice. The BBQ pork is delicious and saucy, but not my favorite out of the three types of meat.   This place is always busy and packed with Chinese locals (good sign btw). Most of the time I get seated right away. It is a cash-only establishment. This place is a gem and I will always come here when I crave for Chinese.

lIVj8TJ3QWIOtAB__tVpLA.text: CASH ONLY! I didn't read the reviews before I came here and had to count my pennies and nickels from my coin bag to pay for my food. Apologies to the cashier for putting you through all of that. But money is money. Luckily I had enough to pay for my food.  Super popular spot for Chinese bbq! They serve anything from roast duck to bbq pork to roast pork to ginger chicken and hainan chicken. Despite the horrible service, you will still leave happy. $9.99 for their two-bbq entree rice platter which is a lot of food. They give you a huge mound of rice, chinese greens, and your choice of two bbq items. Definitely worth the money if you are craving some greasy chinese bbq.  Roast Pork: a crispy layer of skin, 90%fat, and 10% salty pork. I literally had mounds of fat leftover after I dissected the pork layer out. Eat with caution!  Roast Duck: Overly flavored and very salty. I felt like they overseasoned the duck or maybe I am just spoiled from the roast duck in San Francisco. Super oily but still yummy.  Ginger Chicken: Delicious and garnished with a lot of ginger! My favorite of the bunch. Didn't come with too many bones either so it was easy to eat.

q0-ic4bS3c1sIsXzbquZVA.text: My wife and I live next to LV Chinatown. We don't go out all that often but when we do, I'd say 90% of the time we go here, which is known to us as Tung Ky.  Yeah, it's cash only - so what? Yeah, it's tiny, generally packed, and utilitarian. Yeah, the servers' English isn't all that great. But what you really need to understand is that this restaurant isn't the least bit tailored for Americans or their tastes. They have their niche, they have their customers, and it's not down on Spring Mountain where the tourists generally go, so you're not going to get anything remotely approaching a tourist experience when you go there. It's not what this restaurant exists for.  I generally get BBQ pork over rice for carry-out. My wife, who worked in Hong Kong for many years, generally gets roast duck over rice, and swears it's the best she's had in the States. But with her in Asia this week, guiding her mother and father over here for an extended visit, I've been dining in the restaurant for a change. Sauteed vegetables with beef over rice? First-rate. Singapore noodles? Absolutely delicious. So what's it going to be tonight? BBQ pork chow fun? One of their noodle soups with numerous add-ins to choose from? Could be, could be.  But the beef with black bean sauce chow fun is delicious and the XO sauce rice rolls are great, as is practically everything else we've had there in the 8 or 9 years we've been going there. It's fine if you don't like it - they're not going to miss you if you blow them off for whatever reason.  Certain tourists seem to think that LV is a big adult theme park, where everything should be up to THEIR standards. Uh-uh, not here; this is an extremely popular hole-in-the-wall that happens to make first-rate everyday food tailored primarily for Cantonese and northern Vietnamese tastes, and that's IT. And having worked as an expat in HK for several years after living right next to San Francisco Chinatown, I prefer to eat at Tung Ky than at any other Chinese joint in the neighborhood. As long as your expectations are realistic, it's that good.

NOVdu2MPva02qn1dvxdRQQ.text: This place is legitimately one of the best bbq in vegas...I'm a meat and potato's kinda person so the fact that I can just have fantastic bbq with rice and everyone else can order their soups and noodles and sides is cool.. Be advised it's cash $$$ only...

eoVzsw1gimyzhtStxpXcIg.text: The BEST local Chinese barbecue food! The roast duck, crispy pork, and barbecue pork are hands down the best in town. Living locally, I have tried a lot of the Chinese restaurants around town and I always end up back here. The workers work hard and service is very quick, it's a great spot for a quick meal. The wonton soup and porridge are my go to comfort food too.

XQcL-B6f_p8ZNN1GSEGD6w.text: Best Chinese bbq place in town, hands down. Just be prepared for a line and cash only. Definitely recommended the Polk bbq and roasted duck. The noodles are good for a chilly day.

XW7WyxnqlLgV9XWIhwp7Fg.text: This place used to be my to go place whenever I'm craving for some congee or noodles. I always order the chicken and bbq pork rice plate. Today, the food did not meet my expectation and the services was horrible.  I am Chinese and I order my food in Chinese where they can understand. It started off okay, and I ordered what I usually get: - Cold Spicy Chicken Feet - BBQ Pork Belly -  Lean Pork and Century Egg Congee - Salty Fish & Chinese Sausage Fried Rice - Ginger Chicken (Half) - Chinese Fried Dough   The food came and I was not impress. Cold Chicken Feet usually come with a white vinegar dipping sauce, so I asked the server if they have any. She paused for so long and kept telling me there's vinegar on the table (red vinegar). I told her that's not the one for this dish. She then paused so long again, and said she will ask the kitchen. After like 10 second, every server/cooks were screaming and said they have no white vinegar. The whole act is not necessary. Can simply tell me they don't have that. Next dish was the BBQ Pork Belly. It's one of their signature dish, but it was so salty! I love salty food but I feel like this one, I'm biting into a big piece of salt block. Moving on to Chinese Fried Dough, nothing special other than its cold as usual. Next is the Lean Pork and Century Egg Congee... It was so thick, like extra thick with no taste. It used to be so flavorful. Looking at it was so depressing. Then Salty Fish and Chinese Sausage Fried Rice came, the egg was over cooked. It was so dry and ruined the whole fried rice. Lastly the Ginger Chicken, I believe they change the method of cooking it. It just tasted weird.   At the end, I asked the server to give me some to go boxes and sauce container so I can bring it home. The server only gave me one sauce container but I wanted 2, so I asked for another one. She stop and stare at me for the longest time and questioning me why I need another one. First, you shouldn't be asking why I need one. It's just not professional to do that. Second, after I explained I need it for the ginger scallion sauce, she still look at me and question me. Like, just give me another one. I don't know if she is new to being a server, or she just so slow. I even speak to her in Cantonese. It was a stressful yet horrible lunch. I would give 0 star if I can and  I will most likely never going to go back again.

GchLfazZA_7liIMG8QJm5Q.text: The most authentic chinese restaurant here in vegas, IMO. Their Roasted Duck Wonton Noodle Soup is one of my favorites. This place only accepts cash and the parking sucks in this plaza, especially at night. But it's alright! If you like chinese food, it is definitely worth fighting for...parking.

OpLTdLXT85kYfnlRACvJ9g.text: I decided to try this place out after discovering that our first choice (Wendy's Noodle Cafe) was closed on Monday.  Maybe it's luck, maybe it's fate.  I've often heard about the amazing food here and I finally had the chance to try it.    The go-to combo off of Yelp was the 2-meat BBQ combo which I chose the Roast Duck and the Pork.   The dish came with a generous serving of white rice along with some Chinese broccoli on the side and hoison and sweet & sour sauces to dip in.  Absolutely loved it.  Good portions.  Tasty food.  Why haven't I came here sooner?  My wife ordered the Beef Chow Fun (no gravy, dry) which was very good as well.  The beef were sized pretty well and the taste was spot on.   The portions were a good size and it was enough for the two of us.    Service was fast.  Food came out fast.  I'll come back again real soon and I'll hope to try the soups in addition to that mouth-watering pork and roast duck.  Mmm Mmm.

I3djnOtj-QKlopV7FBFvuw.text: One of the best places i have ate at. Everything was very flavorful the staff was helpful on recommending what to have. will be back soon.

ZpfYLGcuqWUjnyQoLY8n_A.text: Came in on a weeknight so There was no crowd thank goodness.  The food here is very good and the food comes out quickly.  The service was great so like any restaurant it's hit or miss and I guess we just got lucky! Yay us! We got a BBQ mix plate and the roast duck which super delicious.  I'd say weekday mid afternoon to early evening would probably be the best time so you won't have to wait but if anything you can always take it to go which creates happiness all around as well.

ePYTClSQQqszR_d_MRL51w.text: I walked in at Asian BBQ & Noodles and I saw pork and duck hanging - a positive sign of good authentic Chinese food.  Everybody who was eating here were Chinese and some Vietnamese.  The servers were speaking to me and my sister in Chinese and it felt like Beijing all over again.  It's a tiny place that seats 50 people.  We ordered roast pork, yang chow fried rice and Chinese broccoli since we weren't too hungry.  The traditional Chinese restaurant would serve you dishes one at a time and it's usually the quickest one to prepare is the one that gets served first.  So, we got the broccoli then the roast pork.  We were dying to eat the pork already since the skin looked so crispy and delicious...but we had to control ourselves and wait for the rice.  It didn't take long.  The broccoli was fresh.   The pork was super crispy and succulent - honestly, the best pork from a Chinese restaurant in Vegas!  I was very pleased and all I could say to myself was "HAOCHI! HAOCHI!" (delicious).  The fried rice had a lot of stuff in it: chopped green veggies, eggs, BBQ pork and shrimps.    We took a BBQ pork rice bowl to-go.  I tried a piece and it was delish!  Their food is inexpensive too!  It's like $6-7 for a rice bowl and you get a lot of food.  If I was blown away by one dish, I can't wait to try the other items on their menu!  I'll definitely try their roast duck and something else next time.  Other Chinese restaurants in Vegas marginal roast pork. There's a particular place with a type of flower in their name that microwaves their roast pork making the skin gross and chewy.  I'm also not concerned with the use of MSG...in China, they give you a small saucer of MSG!  I never get headaches from it so I don't care!

HV-3VoIpQRWOVfz8W6naqA.text: This place offered probably one of the best Chinese foods in town.  The focus here is Chinese Barbecue.  The restaurant itself is not too big and the ambience feels a bit old style like the 80s.    BBQ Platter was great here, not restaurant style with fancy stuff in the middle, just 3 types of meats.  Roasted Pork, Char Siu, and Duck were all delicious.   The half of a chicken was good, and they sliced up the breast prior to serving it to reduce the effort needed to chew through it.  We got some pig feet and pig blood noodles, not something you can get everywhere, but they did a fine job on those too.  Their XO Rice Roll was a surprising discovery, as it came with stir-fried eggs, which most restaurant does not.  Visually gave a stunning appeal, the eggs did not do much to improve the dish, and it tasted about the same as other places.  After visiting many Chinese restaurants in Vegas, Asian BBQ & Noodles definitely stands out among them.  Service was decent and they were quick to response to various requests we had.  Oh, and remember to bring CASH.

WXO_h8Ak-ZhcPIqeFI2jsQ.text: I am always on the lookout for the best, most authentic BBQ duck and pork in Las Vegas, so that is why I tried Asian BBQ & Noodles.    They nailed the first test by having their meats hanging in the kitchen.  I ordered the BBQ duck and pork two meal platter, which came with rice, some veggies, and soup.  This was all for under $10!  The BBQ dishes had bones still in the meat, which I guess is how it's supposed to be served, authentically, but I would have preferred it to be deboned before served.  The portions were also solid and the juices very tasty, overall.  The prices are almost impossible to beat in Las Vegas.  I was just hoping for a more authentic BBQ meat dish when I walked in.  Overall good for the price but not a must try with so many great Asian restaurants in Las Vegas.

YdI6Vw2e9UMBokvC59_84g.text: Not sure if this place is closed or not but I would love to order... seems like their phone number isn't correct on their Yelp page or they just don't feel like answering their phone. Will update this rating once I can finally get ahold of them.

x9b2qLjCV0GEMhRrZwiTvA.text: This is our go to place when we are visiting Las Vegas. We recently went there twice. The food reminds me of Hong Kong so yes go for the food. Service was decent until our last visit. We waited 35 minutes. After ordering our food, we realized people around us were getting theirs before us, but they were seated after us. Our waiter never once came to check in us. My husband had to go and ask for our dishes. We got the porridge after our complaint. Then 15 minutes later we had to go ask for our meat dish(realize porridge and bbq plate does not require any real cooking time.) After finishing our porridge and bbq plate we still hadn't received our chow fun (note this was already 50 minutes after we ordered). We asked for it to be taken off our bill. The supervisor got into an argument telling us if we want to cancel a dish we need to give them a heads up. We explained that we had to go after each dish to be put on our table. He told us are we sure we had to do that, pretty much said we were lying. Let's just say after the argument, he did not understand our point. We took it to go, dumped it and will never return.

WTSbcg-oVD17CNOOOk6uzg.text: Delicious food and service very fast! Perfect!!!Of course I was so hungry so I ordered so many dishes now I am too full and my girlfriend like it also ,she order some to go !!!

zRpaGQ-yzcl0z9MODY89Pw.text: I haven't tried a lot of things from this restaurant but from what I did try, everything was deliciously yummy. Their prices are awesome as well -- they're not going to burn a hole in your wallet however! It is CASH ONLY. So don't come here with a credit card cause that isn't going to help you. Although the wonderful thing is, there is a Wells Fargo, Chase, and BoA somewhere down the street of Spring Mountain.   Like many people have said .. absolutely LOVE their roast pork. It is full of flavor and a good combination of meat and fat. It goes GREAT with rice! So don't be afraid to get that combo :P  Their roast duck and bbq pork is only okay though. I've had better bbq pork. As for their roast duck, it's good however their sauce ruins it for me. They left the herbs in the sauce and the concentration of the flavors of the herbs are just too much for me ..it ruins the flavor of the duck rather than complimenting it.   Also, love their noodles and fried rice. I've tried their "chei jai mein" which is a street cart food back overseas. For here, you get to choose the type of noodle you want then choose 1-3 items, such as pork intestines and pork blood. It was quite yummy :D Wasn't bad at all. BUT, I typically like to use chili oil with my noodles however theirs isn't that great ... Next time, I'll bring my own!   Awesome authentic Chinese food. Can't go wrong. Don't worry about the service cause for the food you get, to hell with service. It's a Chinese place ... just be loud when trying to get their attention and you're good to go! HAHA  But in all reality, when I've eaten here, I haven't really experienced any rude attitude  .. maybe because I haven't been here enough? Tehee.   Give it a try :) If anything, just order take out.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thin egg noodles with pork intestines, pork skin, and mixed beef internals. Yummy!
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork

mSvqfROLQQEiPw6jXNbf5w.text: I went to this restaurant with a group of friends last night and accidentally left my purse on the chair. Quite a bit of cash, drivers license, and and a few credit cards. Came back this am before they opened to hopefully retrieve it to be met with hostile employees and their "boss" (2 different chefs claim to be the owner) telling me that it wasn't there without checking. When I asked for them to check the cameras that were directly facing our table, they kept telling me no and making excuses saying it would take too much time. After pleading with them once again to just let me take a look, I knew the exact time we were there and it would have taken 15 min tops to check, they started threatening to call the police. My Chinese isn't that good but I figured it would be easier to communicate with them in Chinese than English and the "boss" started yelling at me that I was accusing them of stealing when I was just trying to explain that I wanted to see what happened to my purse. I may have used the wrong Chinese term and there was a miscommunication, but when I tried to explain that to him he got even more mad and started yelling at me more about how they are too busy (there were 3 tables of people and 10 employees who were mostly standing around) and to leave.   What probably happened was one of the employees found it and kept the cash and the purse and they are covering for them. There's a luxury good resale store next door so I'm almost positive I'll see my Purse there the next day.   I've already filed a police report so hopefully they are able to do something before the "boss" erases the footage which he probably did the moment I left the restaurant.   I seriously don't understand how someone, let alone a whole restaurant, can be that shady and crooked and get away with it.   As for the food... meh. Had the duck and pork and the beef chow fun. Duck taste like every other BBQ duck place. Pork was ok but the skin was a bit too crispy verging towards too damn hard. Beef chow fun was ok. Nothing special but too much bean sprouts.

F2u7rIuoMu8JAsEQUtzoXw.text: This place has the best roasted pork belly. Hands down. The skin perfect breaks in your mouth and then the meat is salty and chewy!   I always order the duck and roasted pork combo and it's only $11.99. The duck is pretty good too but just a little bit too greasy.   I also tried their noodles and it's okay. I like how you can customize your toppings and which noodles you would want.   Honestly just stick with the roasted pork and duck and you're set!

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two meat combo! Roasted pork and duck
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lai fun noodles

NZOzoDMy-bKvvjl7KUGarw.text: Been coming here for years but mostly  for takeout. All time favorites are the noodles -- delicious flavorful broth, choice of any toppings but beef and duck toppings are excellent. You could choose to add tofu, mushroom and stewed radish as well. The fried tofu with gravy is highly recommended as well as roast pork.  Downside is cash form of payment only.  Service is not the best as expected from authentic Chinese/Asian joints, but don't let that discourage you from coming here. There's a reason why it remains a local favorite eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Congee and tofu at Asian BBQ &amp; Noodles

JH8P_V2BUarGmgHExMoFhg.text: Whenever I come here, there are ALWAYS some lazy asian customers who park their car right outside the restaurant (at the corner where people are turning their car), as a result it's creating problem for other people to pass through or to park, I mean how lazy and inconsiderate can you be? I couldn't take it anymore so I went inside to talk with one of the worker, he just shrugged and said "I don't know whose car is it", you can't kindly announced in the restaurant to please move the car so other people can park? obviously you only care about getting money from lazy customer by not having any business etiquette, this place is CASH ONLY, that tells you a lot right there why restaurant with such horrible service still around.  And if you are one of those lazy customer who likes to park your car right at the corner reading this review, SHAME ON YOU.

_InRVRj_ymldZFPJEbOCmA.text: CASH ONLY!!! but service is fast and food is very authentically spot on!  Curry fish balls, BBQ combo plate, wontons and chow menu all served piping hot within minutes of placing our orders.  Although there's usually a wait at this 50 capacity restaurant, it moves along fast.  Will return next time in town.

8R66XcKwUJYBEzD-hgzGhA.text: Like most people, came here for the barbequed meats.  Overall experience was just so-so.  It was pretty dead when I came in yet getting a small to-go order where all they had to do is chop up meat took forever.  Just one person ahead of us, so I couldn't figure out why it was taking so long.  The restaurant is very cramped, so there is really no convenient place to wait out of people's way.  The meat was also just okay, the smell was overwhelming in my car and fridge, yet the meat was a little bland.  Duck had a lot of bone, so it was less than I thought once I removed the meat off it (lots of fat too and not really as crispy as I would prefer).  Pork was a little dry.  Not sure if I would return.

1DQq7bTdNKuaSXdgnUQGAQ.text: Poor experience. Server did not know what she was doing. We ordered the gravy chow fun, and she came back telling us it would take a long time to make. She gave us an alternative dish to order instead. After more time passed, she came back saying that THAT dish would take a long time too. By that time the rest of our party finished eating already. We decided to just cancel our order. Never coming back

ijY0ZBg3HzBykmTn-jKptA.text: Best pig intestines and roasted duck in town.  Highly recommend this place if your in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted duck
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pig stomach and intestine egg noodle soup
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VdeVxk5J-loUxfxGLwkNBQ.text: Food was great and the service was ok. The only thing that keeps me giving them 3 stars is that if you order for to go over the phone, they won't start cooking your food until you're there.

il55AIWX_DTRBGcBcyGRgA.text: I've been here several times before but this will probably be my last.  Service here has always been questionable but they would at least get the order correct and the BBQ meats were generally good.  This day, it was horrible.  We ordered Wonton Noodle Soup, Congee and added a 3 meat combo with BBQ Pork, Roast Pork and Ginger Chicken.  After a little while, the Congee and Noodle soup came out.  The meats didn't show up until the Congee and Noodle soup was almost finished.  To make it worse, they gave us Duck instead of the BBQ Pork.  After trying to grab a server for a few minutes, we gave up and decided to just eat what was served.  The Ginger Chicken was anemic, compared to past meals, and the Roasted Duck just tasted off and mushy.  The Roasted Pork was good.  We ate, left most of the Chicken and Duck, paid and walked out.  On the way out, one of the servers was cleaning something up and put a "wet floor" sign on the ground.  Walked around the sign and before you know it, foot slipped and fell hard.  It wasn't water.  They spilled oil or grease on the ground and didn't bother covering it up.  These people are generally clueless, rude and generally act like they don't care.  But ... still came back for their BBQ meats.  Not anymore.  They're just lucky I don't sue.

nONur1X0Q0CcBSuji2OJGw.text: This place has the best roasted pork!!! Service is not always the best, but if you are looking for amazing roasted pork, cheap noodles this is the place! Cash only

6d_vdWz-qCieEafeUDVKKA.text: Wow.   What a dive.   Ordered half a duck,  got all bones.   I almost sent it back asking for the meat half.   Would never recommend to anyone.   Too bad,  I had such high hopes. .  Flavorless water disguised as soup. ..  Cash only. ..  Now I need to get some REAL food.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Total dive. .. highway robbery at best. . Go elsewhere! !

UeHRjrzijHjjjtO0XUStYw.text: Wow. Can't believe we have authenticate Hong Kong style bbq cafe here.  We love the bbq pork, roast duck, fried beef noodles. Yummy food with good customer services.  The only draw back is cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I4Kte7EB61XKFHAj4TNzYw.text: Never been to any place that so rude. I've been eating here for years since they're first opened. Never experienced this before. This old waiter was so racist he told us that Vietnamese better learn Chinese no Chinese need to learn Vietnamese after I was asking him if he knows Vietnamese so that my bf could order something(which most of the time the waiters speaks both Viet and Chinese....so we doesn't know...just asking). Instead of being racist and talked like that he could've just told us NO or at least be more friendly not with an attitude. He took an ordered so quick, we did not even finished, he left. He came back with a wrong dish(of course because in the beginning we already asked if he could speak vietnamese....my bf was confused between the pig intestine w/ pig stomach) so i guessed we ordered a wrong dish and so of course we were very nice and asked him can we get a different dish which is "pig stomach". He stared at us for 5 secs and said "no. Cant take in no more. They already cut" and I said "ok? Can we just get a different dish and i will pay for it too no big deal" he literally stood there and kept saying no. He acted like we don't have money to pay! I was so mad I stood up bout to leave, he immediately changed the way how he talked and said "ok i don't know what u want" he grabbed the menu, gave it to me, ran away and never return. LOL. Never come back to this place ever again. !

ad9cg2q_nAEj2MkFNLOcLQ.text: Love the Roast Pork here.... moist.. yet crispy and just the right amount for lunch.  The atmosphere is fun, too.  Love seeing the hanging duck.  I'll go back again and again.  Though it's really bare bones kind of place.... It just FEELS real and tastes GREAT.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I never thought I&#39;d say this about BBQ... but WOW.... I love Asian BBQ from Asian BBQ!

wYQdHOyV8haxv9awWFzCFg.text: This place has roast duck to die for.  The roast pork belly, barbecue pork, spareribs, beef stomach, curried fish balls, soups, hong kong noodles and veggies are all delicious.  Kind of noisy and congested but work the lack of ambiance.  Prices are fair and service is good.

W7GBjzG0v-DlItRgtDjXgQ.text: Every time when we inLV , this is the place that we have to eat. Cash only.  But last night we have party of 6, they charge 15% of tip on the bill, and did not mention when they give us bill. Because my mom still eating, so I take a look on detail and find out they charge 15% for tip. We have no problem with auto charge but server have to notice by the time you handed to us. Pls teach your employees.

BG5Lb3XNmBrdBzFkZd29JA.text: The food was alright, its enjoy able. The one thing I didn't really like was the when we where paying. We put the money on the table and they just come and grab it. While we say wait for a few time. That happen two  time. I don't like that experience.

FHAKMUpXg8CZQEcp1xWU_A.text: Really good roast pork and wonton noodle there.  Very legit hong kong flavor.  The roast pork has cripsy skin and soft tender meat, While the wonton soup and noodle are very good. They also have very good porridge and steam vegetable, very cheap and fresh.   It is very hidden in the plaza but once you open the door is a happening scene with full house of people eating and ordering. The smell of it will hit you in your face instantly.  I went on a late sunday morning and there is a line waiting to get it. They are listed the "Top" 100 chinese food. The only thing I didnt like is the chinese donut, its not crispt and light enough. And the bbq pork is a bit dry. Overall still a pretty authentic bbq meat and wonton place. Oh and try the ginger chicken that is really good, soft and tender with grinded ginger and green onion sauce!!

yzFAyWdrpGdMEwovkKekKg.text: Damn this place for being so delicious!!!  We started going to this place when it first opened. ... I'm going to guess around five years ago.  Back then a  roast duck rice was 5 bucks.   Now that same dish is 8 bucks.  Quite an increase!!!  .. But so good!!!!  Their business is so good that they close on Fridays! !!! What restaurant can do that!!!   I think the owner is the cashier lady.  We have been there probably 20 times and have never seen her smile.   Next time I go,  I will tell her that given how good her business is she should be smiling like the Joker!  Food. .. Bbq pork- most of the time the meat is not to fatty.  Has great flavor and tender.  Roast duck- about 50 percent of the time you will get a great combination of crisp skin,  minimal fat,  and wonderful tender duck.   The other times you will get too much fat and soggy skin. Roast pork- same review as duck but I would say 75 percent of time it's crispy, minimal fat and delicious.   Pan fried noodles- one of the best I have had.   It's not oily.  My guess is that they fry the noodles well ahead of time and drain the oil properly.  I would request this with a black been sauce.   Crisp noodles and delicious sauce.   It is literally a place that will make you smile when you take a bite of the food.

40pQ6l-Ypt4VoiaSvGNWkQ.text: Short and sweet review... and BBQ!  Comparable to Sam Woo down the street in Chinatown.

oUh_YgXDFqUKMb4uZ4ImDQ.text: *Thumbs up* The only thing I tried was the roast pork over rice ($7 including tax) and it was delicious. Perfectly crispy skin paired with juicy and fatty meat is the ultimate combination.   *Thumbs down* It's located in rather shady-looking strip mall plaza a few more blocks down from the Monta/Raku/Kabuto strip mall on Spring Mountain. That may make some people nervous, others however, right at home. Language barrier can be an issue, but they speak enough English and you can always point at the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork with rice

UFKzr_sI4LTKFA-jNeFi9g.text: Great place for authentic Chinese food. Portions are generous and price is fair. There is a strong Cantonese  and Mandarin presence and the restaurant is near the edge of Chinatown. It is a bit far from the LV strip, but well worth the drive out for good food. Would definitely recommend to those in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Asian BBQ & Noodle - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef soup with egg noodles and Peking bbq duck.

kf_PEGEDeZqIPrPSb9f3Ig.text: This was definitely overhyped for me.  The service was good, the ladies behind the counter were nice.  The food was not good.  We got bbq duck, pork belly, chicken and bbq pork.  The duck skin was not rendered out and was flabby, the pork belly was crispy but had virtually no flavor, the chicken was cold and flabby and the pork belly was good.  We also ordered the highly recommended bbq duck soup.  The broth tasted like dish water.  Overall we were pretty sad, but we had an excellent duck noodle soup at Pho Kim Long the next week so I nearly forgot about it.

eogrgBfIPc-6xj_TknJVjw.text: Excellent authentic Hong Kong style BBQ and Noodles. Not expensive at all. Loved it.

iOW9GMZ67GwwavwMfj-BGQ.text: Fried rice, BBQ pork and duck, small dishes are all delicious . I always go back here every time I visit Vegas .

TyizIdv5ZY86R9y8sboQBQ.text: Shrimp and wonton soup: good size, good amount of tasty dumplings   Pork belly plate: awesome little plate of pork, the skins are super cruchy!  Beef chow fun: great portion for the price  The portions are very fair and affordable. I'll be back.

SjvU2K4TqFJyo7dAFkrDpQ.text: Excellent service and food! Comparable to the "street food I had in Hong Kong. Can't wait to come back to Vegas so I can dine here again.

jnglqlIu3iAyXBq4dNXqEQ.text: Amazing. If you need your roasted duck and bbq pork fix while in vegas this is the place to be.  Good, cheap and tons of other options.  Place isn't "pretty" like most restaurants on the strip but the food is amazing.

AhOf7G_7pC_bXNvqyilzNA.text: Not much to say except...great roast pork!!!  Super juicy and crispy at the same time.  What i really like is how neat they cut it and place it in the to go box.  The also alot of other tasty items.  Roast duck wonton noodle soup is a winner or the simple bbq pork with rice.

5M4WR4lBMcm4kz7FfNp3ig.text: I was looking for a place to get some soup with thin egg noodles. I highly recommend the beef stew with thin egg noodles. Also, the wonton soup was pretty good too.

D0zrkokc1FVSSSK2ajrQQA.text: The food was very tasty!  The price was very affordable.  The restaurant was very clean. The owner and staff were very friendly.  Aside from loving the food.........real Chinese people were in the kitchen cooking and NOT Mexicans.  I'm sorry but Mexicans just don't know how to cook like Chinese.  I've gone to many Asian restaurants here in Las Vegas and am very disappointed with the taste of their food because it's not authentic!    If you are new in the area, a local, or a visitor..........this restaurant is the place to go!!!!  You will not be disappointed!

ZxbKojEpld2A0Axf5P9uHA.text: Have been visiting this restaurant a couple of times this month.. Initially was pretty pleased with the food they served till recently on the last 2 occasion, disappointed with them.   First occasion, I ordered a packet of rice with BBQ pork , roast duck n pork belly to go. I asked the lady for extra sauce with my meat, when I got home there weren't any so I guessed maybe she might have forgotten. Fine !!!  Yesterday, I ordered the same item again. This time round, I ask the same lady again : "can u PLEASE give me extra sauce. Here comes her answer : "There's already sauce on you rice". and she was real eager to collect $$$ from me and get me out of her sight. obviously I knew it, doesn't she understand what is EXTRA sauce?   Could not explain how angry I was when I left the shop. I was asking myself maybe I should have asked her :" Can I pay you for some extra sauce?"

35iUYshwKAURrc88ZnNMPA.text: Wonderful and flavorful!  Had the special which was a beef tomato on noodles!  Definitely a different taste and very good!  Just a note.... Cash Only!

jkfJ8wWZaht_Z2tH6RU9ZA.text: Food is excellent and huge portions.  Can't go wrong with their fried rice...especially the BBQ pork fried rice and its affordable.  Roasted pork belly...yummy....pan fried noodle with seafood gravy...excellent

e4ioLFumcIWBu3AKg5ZgGA.text: We recently went to Asian BBQ & Noodle and had a pleasant surprise. We tried to go there one evening and figured that they are closed on Fridays. I would give it a 5 stars despite of this is another cash only restaurant.  The staff are friendly and the food are authentic. We ordered some roast duck noodles and BBQ pork ribs. They are both delicious and reasonable-priced. Definitely will return to this place when I crave for pork belly and cha siu.

Eal3jnuk1ZopaBEn_ij_vg.text: Amen for nice people! I have eaten here several times. I love the pork belly and fried rice! On my last visited I waited, and waited and waited, until finally a nice couple said she needs help. While this was a longer wait than usually I feel like this is along the lines of the quality of service for non-Asians. I love this place but I have to be in the mood to tolerate the service.

WB-D6Q4Uuenfr_MjvclKpw.text: The food is good & in decent portion.  The roast pork & bbq pork were excellent.  I have to say it's better than the Chinese restaurant in LA.  It's a pretty small place but quick turnover....only accept cash & close on Fridays.  One thing I didn't like about it's that they charge extra in holidays without any notice.....Other than that, everything is great.

2z1VKrwn4Ly_H36gD4ro2A.text: I must have gone on an off day, according to everyone elses review. Ordered the duck with rice. But instead got skin,bones and rice. And a bonus of shattered bones through my meal. Not pleasant.

GM3wStVkSpIaDCpq3wBdGg.text: Wow, after reading the previous reviews, I wish I had the same experience.  Prior to ordering it had some signs strung up above the cash register claiming 8th top chinese restaurants in the USA.   Way to raise the hype...  One of my buddies lives in Vegas wanted me to meet up at this Chinese Noodle House on Jones.  After meeting him up, I was pretty surprised at the menu prices.  Almost everything on the menu was under 6 bucks.   They even have a font 20 menu for the grandmas and grandpas.  I ordered the Roast Pork Shrimp Dumpling Noodle for $5.99  Price - 5 stars Noodles - 3 stars Broth - 3 stars Roast Pork - 1 star Shrimp Dumpling - 3 stars Service - 2 stars  I was really disappointed with the Roast Pork, because all the pieces I got were straight up bone; with the exception of one small piece.  Overall, I was not impressed and probably will not go out of my way to eat here again.

4Uoxyxeo5x8eNm7orDEEhQ.text: My daughter and I tried this place for the second time. It's good food. Definitely authentic Hong Kong style cuisine. Must have wonton egg noodle soup! The dumpling soup was also very delicious! The curry fish balls reminded me dearly of Hong Kong. This is one eatery I'd recommend to all my friends. But be forewarned, it was only my daughter and I eating in and they charged us an extra 15% gratuity.

QutWDShL40j-rfR16cEEGQ.text: Horrible customer service. Do not go here unless you are friends with the workers there. We had a party of 5 waiting for a table that they were cleaning. They told us that would be our table when it was clean so we waited. In comes a party of 3 that were friends with the workers and sat down at our table. Then the worker has the audacity to tell us to wait for another table. Are you f***ing kidding me? We just left. Never ate here and never will. Only went by yelp reviews but they can forget it now. Jacka**es.

qIx8s1bvguUgVeIqNXCu6Q.text: Went on Xmas eve and it wasn't very busy. The stag was very disorganized so I went to the counter to order and politely asked to order. The lady flat out ignored me so I asked a server who took me to a table ( where they were hoisin in cups ) and took my order. I ordered BBQ Pork, Crisp Pork Belly, Beef Chow Fun, Veg Fried Rice and Singapore Noodles. She didn't take my name but out the order in. There's no real waiting area so we moved around getting out of the way. Others came in ordered and left. I think because we ordered stir fry from the back it took longer. After 22 minutes I asked the server to check . She showed that the BBQ itenms were there and then I saw 2 of the items come out. Still waiting on the rice. Approached the counter again, ignored again. It made me feel as if they didn't want me there or my business. I waited 5 more minutes then turned and walked out without my order. I can't comment on the food for obvious reasons.
